Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl.desc: Go to bars and buy alcohol.
Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl.name: Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl
Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl.start: Speak to the [[barbarian guard]] at the entrance of the Barbarian Agility Training Course.
Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl.items: *208 [[coins]] to buy all the required alcohol

Animal Magnetism.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[The Restless Ghost]] **[[Ernest the Chicken]] **[[Priest in Peril]] *[[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 18 [[Slayer]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 19 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Ranged icon.png|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 30 [[Ranged]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 35 [[Woodcutting]] (not boostable) (required to start)
Animal Magnetism.desc: Draynor Manor has a new resident and, adventurers rejoice, she is a damsel in distress. Far from being Sleeping Beauty, she finds the Manor's beds not to her liking and is suffering from insomniac nights. If you fancy yourself able to aid Ava in her search for a good night's sleep, who knows what the budding scientist will produce as a reward?
Animal Magnetism.name: Animal Magnetism
Animal Magnetism.ironman: *[[Mithril axe]] ([[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 51 [[Smithing]] (boostable)); [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 28 [[Thieving]] (boostable) for the [[Chest (Isle of Souls Dungeon)|Isle of Souls dungeon chest]]; [[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 60 [[Woodcutting]] (boostable) to purchase axe from [[Perry's Chop-chop Shop]] in the [[Woodcutting Guild]]; access to [[fairy rings]] (BKQ) and killing [[tree spirit]]s, blue dragons, or king sand crabs) * [[Holy symbol]] ([[File:Prayer icon.png|link=Prayer|alt=Prayer]] 31 [[Prayer]] (not boostable))
Animal Magnetism.items:
*[[Mithril axe]] (required to obtain the [[blessed axe]]; no other type of axe will do)
*5 [[iron bar]]s
*[[Ghostspeak amulet]] ([[Morytania legs]] will not work)
*20 [[ecto-token]]s (or 4 [[bones]], 4 [[bucket]]s and 4 [[pot]]s to gain the tokens)
*[[Hammer]]
*[[Hard leather]]
*[[Holy symbol]]
*[[Polished buttons]]

Another Slice of H.A.M..requirements: *[[File:Attack icon.png|link=Attack|alt=Attack]] 15 [[Attack]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Prayer icon.png|link=Prayer|alt=Prayer]] 25 [[Prayer]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *Completion of the following quests: **[[Death to the Dorgeshuun]] ***[[The Lost Tribe]] ****[[Goblin Diplomacy]] ****[[Rune Mysteries]] **[[The Giant Dwarf]] **[[The Dig Site]] *The ability to defeat a level 64 (using any combat style) and two level 30 enemies using either [[Ranged]] or [[Magic]].
Another Slice of H.A.M..desc: The dwarves are building a new underground rail link between their city of Keldagrim and the cave goblins' Dorgesh-Kaan, but work is being held up by the discovery of ancient goblin artefacts, and they need the help of a qualified archaeologist. Helping them out should be simple enough - unless you stumble upon another H.A.M. plot against the city.
Another Slice of H.A.M..name: Another Slice of H.A.M.
Another Slice of H.A.M..start: Go to [[Ur-tag]]'s house in [[Dorgesh-Kaan]]. (Can be reached either via Kazgar from the Lumbridge cellar or via Dartog from the water mill by telling either NPC to take the player to the mines. Afterwards, go south past the sword icon and enter the door.)
Another Slice of H.A.M..items:
*A [[light source]]
*A [[tinderbox]]
*Magic or Ranged [[equipment|gear]] for enemy fight ''(cannot use [[Melee]] on them)''

Architectural Alliance.requirements: Various skills depending on the [[favour]] activities done *[[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 42 [[Mining]] for any [[Lovakengj]] activity
Architectural Alliance.desc: Prove yourself to the five houses of Great Kourend and gain the support of several architects to rebuild the statue of King Rada I.
Architectural Alliance.name: Architectural Alliance
Architectural Alliance.start: Speak to [[Hosa]] by the [[Statue (King Rada I)|statue]] outside [[Kourend Castle]].
Architectural Alliance.items: Various items depending on the favour activities done

The Ascent of Arceuus.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[Client of Kourend]] ***[[X Marks the Spot]] *[[File:Hunter icon.png|link=Hunter|alt=Hunter]] 12 [[Hunter]] (not boostable) (required to start)
The Ascent of Arceuus.desc: A long time ago, the citizens of Arceuus house gave up their human bodies and claimed immortality. This event was known as the Ascent of Arceuus and it marked the end of death within Arceuus house. Or so they believed. For the first time in a thousand years, a member of Arceuus house has fallen. You will need to solve the mystery of this death. However, time is of the essence and the fate of Arceuus house lies in your hands.
The Ascent of Arceuus.name: The Ascent of Arceuus

At First Light.requirements: * [[File:Hunter icon.png|link=Hunter|alt=Hunter]] 46 [[Hunter]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 30 [[Herblore]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Construction icon.png|link=Construction|alt=Construction]] 27 [[Construction]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Children of the Sun]] ** [[Eagles' Peak]]
At First Light.desc: Learn about the role of the Hunter Guild and unlock higher tier rumours.
At First Light.name: At First Light
At First Light.start: Speak to [[Guildmaster Apatura]] at the [[Hunter Guild]].
At First Light.items:
* [[Needle]] or [[costume needle]] (one needle spawns in [[Pellem's Fur Store]] nearby)
* [[Box trap]] (can be bought from [[Imia's Supplies]] nearby)
* [[Hammer]] (obtainable during quest)
* 2 [[jerboa tail]]s (obtainable during quest)

Barbarian Training.requirements: * Completion of [[Tai Bwo Wannai Trio]] (not required to start) * [[File:Fishing icon.png|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 55 [[Fishing]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 35 [[Firemaking]] (not boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Strength icon.png|link=Strength|alt=Strength]] 35 [[Strength]] (not boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 15 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Farming icon.png|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 15 [[Farming]] (not boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 11 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 5 [[Smithing]] (not boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 4 [[Herblore]] (not boostable) (not required to start)
Barbarian Training.desc: Otto Godblessed has been researching his history and training people in the ways of his ancestors, and now he's ready to teach you. From his hut on the banks of the lake at the top of Baxtorian Falls, you'll go Fishing with your bare hands, mix fish eggs into your potions, wield one-handed spears and, finally, go deep into the ancient cavern beneath the lake.
Barbarian Training.name: Barbarian Training
Barbarian Training.start: Speak to [[Otto Godblessed]] in [[Otto's Grotto|his grotto]] at the lake atop [[Baxtorian Falls]].
Barbarian Training.items:
*Farming:
** Any [[seed]] that can be planted with a [[seed dibber]] (such as [[Allotment patch|allotment]] and [[Herb patch|herb]] seeds) and a free Farming patch for it (part 1)
** Any [[sapling]] and a free Farming patch for it (part 2)
** A [[spade]] (part 2)
** An [[axe]] or 200 [[coins]] (part 2, to clear a required patch if it is occupied)
*Firemaking:
**Any [[bow]] ''except'' [[Twisted bow|twisted]], [[Cursed goblin bow|cursed]], [[Dark bow|dark]], [[Crystal bow|crystal]], [[ogre bow|ogre]], [[Rain bow|rain]] or the [[signed oak bow]] (part 1)
**[[Oak logs]] (can get some oak logs north of [[Otto's house]], down a hill) (part 1)
**A [[tinderbox]] (part 2)
**An [[axe]] (part 2)
*Fishing:
**Some [[fishing bait]] or [[feather]]s
**A [[knife]]
*Smithing:
**[[Hammer]]
**Two metal [[bars]] of a level you can smith
**Two [[logs]] corresponding to the type of metal bars you are using. [[bronze bar|Bronze]], [[iron bar|iron]], [[steel bar|steel]], [[mithril bar|mithril]], [[adamantite bar|adamantite]], and [[runite bar|runite bars]] require [[logs|normal]], [[Oak logs|oak]], [[Willow logs|willow]], [[Maple logs|maple]], [[Yew logs|yew]] or [[magic logs]], respectively.
*Herblore:
**A normal [[attack potion]] (2 doses)
**[[Roe]] (can be obtained during Barbarian Fishing)
**A [[knife]] for [[roe]] or [[caviar]]

Bear Your Soul.name: Bear Your Soul
Bear Your Soul.start: Speak to [[Aretha]] after reading a book called [[soul journey]] in the [[Arceuus Library]].
Bear Your Soul.items: *[[Spade]] *[[Dusty key]] or [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 70/80 [[Agility]] (boostable) or [[Key master teleport]]

Below Ice Mountain.requirements: *[[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] 16 [[Quest points]] (required to start)
Below Ice Mountain.desc:
Willow, an energetic archaeologist (perhaps suspiciously so) is hunting for her next big discovery. She believes she has found the entrance to ancient underground ruins found to the west of Ice Mountain. There's a catch though - the entrance is sealed tight and she needs to re-unite her old crew to help her break in. Naturally, she has to stay close to the ruins in order to lay claim to the find, so it falls to you to bring her rag-tag group back together for one last caper and a final big pay-off.

Burntof is an old dwarf with a penchant for demolition, Checkal is a well-built lifter of heavy things and Marley is a cunning thief with a knack for disarming traps.

Together, they have the talents it will take to gain entry to the secret ruins. But persuading them might not be easy. See, the gang aren't all too keen on working with Willow again, and her intentions might not be as honourable as she claims...
Below Ice Mountain.kills: [[Ancient Guardian]] ''(level 25)'' ('''Note:''' You can skip the fight with a [[pickaxe]] and [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 10 [[Mining]] (boostable))
Below Ice Mountain.name: Below Ice Mountain
Below Ice Mountain.start: [[Willow (Below Ice Mountain)|Willow]] on the path south of [[Ice Mountain]]
Below Ice Mountain.items:
* [[Cooked meat]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Bread]]
* [[Knife]]
* [[Beer]] (can be obtained during the quest)
** Alternatively [[Asgarnian ale]], [[Dwarven stout]], or a [[Wizard's mind bomb]]

Beneath Cursed Sands.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[Contact!]] ***[[Prince Ali Rescue]] ***[[Icthlarin's Little Helper]] ****[[Gertrude's Cat]] *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 62 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 55 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 55 [[Firemaking]] (not boostable) (required to start)
Beneath Cursed Sands.desc: When Sophanem was beset by a series of plagues, the gates to the golden city of Menaphos quickly closed. The city has been locked down ever since, with no one allowed to leave or enter. However, rumours have escaped of strange happenings inside Menaphos and there are stories of citizens mysteriously disappearing. These odd happenings need to be investigated, but few are willing to do so. Maisa, a spy from Al Kharid, has grown tired of inaction. She is determined to solve this mystery herself, but she won't be able to do it alone... are you up for the challenge?
Beneath Cursed Sands.kills:
* [[Head Menaphite Guard]] (level 174) without the use of [[protection prayers]]
* Two [[Scarab Mage]]s (level 119)
* The [[Champion of Scabaras]] (level 379) 
* [[Menaphite Akh]] (level 351)
Beneath Cursed Sands.name: Beneath Cursed Sands
Beneath Cursed Sands.start: Speak to [[Jamila]] at her stall in [[Sophanem]].
Beneath Cursed Sands.items:
* [[Coal]]
* [[Iron bar]]
* [[Tinderbox]] (obtainable during quest)
* [[Spade]] (obtainable during quest) 
* Any cooked or raw meat (fish will not work; raw yak meat will not work; purchasable from shop during quest)

Between a Rock....requirements: * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Dwarf Cannon]] ** [[Fishing Contest]] * [[File:Defence icon.png|link=Defence|alt=Defence]] 30 [[Defence]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 40 [[Mining]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 50 [[Smithing]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * The ability to defeat a level 75-125 enemy ''(depends on how much gold you mine)''
Between a Rock....desc: Hidden away from the fearsome trolls and the roaming Fremennik, the dwarves delve deep beneath the mountains in search for the ore they need to support their home of Keldagrim. One dwarf in particular, however, has for years been trying to crack open a rock that seems to be impervious to any material that he's tried on it. Convinced that solving the riddle of the rock will lead him to unimaginable wealth, he has spent the later part of his life on just this lump of stone. Help him out, but take care you don't end up in a tight spot!
Between a Rock....name: Between a Rock...
Between a Rock....start: Speak to [[Dondakan the Dwarf]] at the [[Keldagrim south-west mine]].
Between a Rock....items:
* A [[pickaxe]]
* 4 [[gold bar]]s (You will need an extra bar and telegrab if you want to keep a golden cannonball for after the quest)
* A [[hammer]]
* An [[ammo mould]] ''(can be bought for 5 coins during the quest)'' or a [[double ammo mould]]
* ~830 [[coins]] ''(for cart and ferry)''

Big Chompy Bird Hunting.requirements: * [[File:Fletching icon.png|link=Fletching|alt=Fletching]] 5 [[Fletching]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 30 [[Cooking]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Ranged icon.png|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 30 [[Ranged]] (not boostable) (not required to start) * The ability to defend against level 64 [[wolves]] and level 53 [[ogre]]s
Big Chompy Bird Hunting.desc:
Rantz the Ogre needs to feed his demanding children, Fycie and Bugs, so he wants to go Big Chompy Bird hunting. Problem is, he's all fingers and thumbs when it comes to making ogre arrows.

Could someone please give him a hand?
Big Chompy Bird Hunting.name: Big Chompy Bird Hunting
Big Chompy Bird Hunting.start: Speak to [[Rantz]], far east of [[Feldip Hills]].
Big Chompy Bird Hunting.items: * Any [[axe]] that you can use ([[Blessed axe]] does not work) * [[Feather]]s (100 to be safe; coloured feathers from [[File:Hunter icon.png|link=Hunter|alt=Hunter]] [[Hunter]] work) ** Bringing 50 to buy 25 feathers from [[Fycie]] also works * [[Knife]] (or 10 to buy a knife and chisel from [[Bugs]]) * [[Chisel]] (or 10 to buy a knife and chisel from [[Bugs]]) * 4 [[wolf bones]] (can be obtained from level 64 [[wolves]] during the quest or from level 14 [[wolves]] in the [[Stronghold of Security]]) * [[Cabbage]] (can be obtained during the quest, Draynor cabbage will not work) * [[Tomato]] (can be obtained during the quest) * [[Onion]] (can be obtained during the quest) * [[Potato]] (can be obtained during the quest) * [[Equa leaves]] (can be obtained during the quest) * [[Doogle leaves]] (can be obtained during the quest)

Biohazard.desc:
This is the second part of an ongoing adventure. Help Elena discover the truth about the infamous Ardougne plague.

Smuggle test samples across Ardougne to Elena's old mentor.
Biohazard.name: Biohazard
Biohazard.start: Talk to [[Elena]] in her house in [[East Ardougne]].
Biohazard.items:
* [[Pigeon cage]] (Can be obtained during the quest. Found behind Jerico's house)
* [[Priest gown top]] and [[Priest gown bottom|bottom]] (can be obtained during the quest for a total of 12 coins from Asyff's [[Fancy Clothes Store]])
* [[Gas mask]] (can be obtained for free from the cupboard in [[Edmond]] and [[Alrena]]'s house in [[East Ardougne]])

Bone Voyage.requirements:
*100 [[Kudos]]
*Completion of the following quest:
**[[The Dig Site]]
Bone Voyage.desc:
Curator Haig Halen needs your help to finish the construction of a barge fit to take the Varrock museum crew to an unexplored landmass to the east. There have been many attempts to reach the island, but none were successful.

This quest will have you venturing across Gielinor, aiding the Varrock museum and making the success of the voyage a possibility.
Bone Voyage.name: Bone Voyage
Bone Voyage.start: Talk to [[Curator Haig Halen]] in the [[Varrock Museum]].

Cabin Fever.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: ** [[Pirate's Treasure]] ** [[Rum Deal]] *** [[Zogre Flesh Eaters]] **** [[Big Chompy Bird Hunting]] **** [[Jungle Potion]] ***** [[Druidic Ritual]] *** [[Priest in Peril]] * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 42 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 45 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 50 [[Smithing]] (not boostable) (required to start) * [[File:Ranged icon.png|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 40 [[Ranged]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]])
Cabin Fever.desc:
It's war on the high seas as Bill Teach tries to make the journey from Port Phasmatys to the pirate enclave of Mos Le'Harmless!
With his crew heading for the hills, he's looking to recruit anyone eager to become a pirate to help him sink the enemy before he ends up swimming home. He's offering a lot more than a shilling to join his crew. Have you got what it takes to be a pirate?
Cabin Fever.name: Cabin Fever
Cabin Fever.start: Talk to [[Bill Teach]] at [[The Green Ghost]] inn in [[Port Phasmatys]].
Cabin Fever.items: You don't need to bring any items yourself. However, make sure that you have at least '''11''' open inventory spaces for items you will obtain during the quest. A higher amount, like '''14''' open spaces, is recommended however.

Children of the Sun.desc: Children of the Sun begins on the familiar streets of Varrock, where a delegation from Varlamore has arrived to sign a treaty with the rulers of Misthalin. It’s a day for celebration, but something’s amiss… you’d better find out what’s going on!
Children of the Sun.name: Children of the Sun

Client of Kourend.requirements:
*Completion of the following quest:
**[[X Marks the Spot]]
Client of Kourend.desc: Will you help Veos handle a mysterious client?
Client of Kourend.name: Client of Kourend
Client of Kourend.items: * [[Feather]] ''(a [[Stripy feather|stripy]] or coloured feather can also be used, but a [[magic gold feather]] cannot)''

Clock Tower.requirements: The ability to run past level 53 [[Ogre]]s
Clock Tower.desc: Help the confused Brother Kojo find the missing cogs and fix his clock tower. Search the dungeon using brawn and brains to correctly place the four cogs.
Clock Tower.name: Clock Tower
Clock Tower.start: Talk to [[Brother Kojo]] in the [[Clock Tower (building)|Clock Tower]] south of [[East Ardougne]].
Clock Tower.items: * [[Bucket of water]] (obtainable during quest) or [[Ice gloves]] or [[Smiths gloves (i)]]

Cold War.requirements: *[[File:Hunter icon.png|link=Hunter|alt=Hunter]] 10 [[Hunter]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 30 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 30 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (required to start) '"`UNIQ--ref-00000000-QINU`"' *[[File:Construction icon.png|link=Construction|alt=Construction]] 34 [[Construction]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 15 [[Thieving]] (not boostable) (required to start) *Access to a [[crafting table 3]]
Cold War.desc:
At the Ardougne Zoo, one of the zookeepers has become a bit preoccupied by penguins. In fact, he's downright paranoid about them. He needs your help to observe their habits on the iceberg in the Lunar Sea.

What begins as a peaceful bird-watching expedition opens a new world of espionage and bad musicians.
Cold War.name: Cold War
Cold War.ironman: *[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 50 [[Woodcutting]] (boostable) for the mahogany plank
Cold War.items:
*10 [[oak plank]]s
*10 [[steel nails]]
*[[Hammer]]
*[[Spade]]
*[[Clockwork]] ''or'' a [[steel bar]] to make one
*[[Plank]]
*[[Silk]]
*[[Raw cod]] ''or'' the [[ring of charos (a)]]
*[[Swamp tar]]
*5 [[feather]]s (only regular chicken feathers work)
*[[Mahogany plank]]
*[[Leather]]

Contact!.requirements:
*Completion of the following quests:
**[[Prince Ali Rescue]]
**[[Icthlarin's Little Helper]]
***[[Gertrude's Cat]]
Contact!.desc: The High Priest of Icthlarin has problems again - this time with the inhabitants of Menaphos. Sophanem is recovering from the plague, yet most of its citizens are still trapped on the other side of the river. Diplomacy has failed and subterfuge beckons. Clearly, this is the sort of job that a shifty adventurer could excel in.
Contact!.kills:
* [[Giant Scarab]] ''(level 191)''
* Summoned by the Giant Scarab:
** [[Locust rider]] ''(level 68)'' - Ranged and melee
** [[Scarab Mage]]s ''(level 119 & 66)''
Contact!.name: Contact!
Contact!.start: Speak to the [[High Priest (Sophanem)|High Priest of Icthlarin]] in [[Sophanem]].
Contact!.items:
*A [[Light sources|light source]] ([[Kandarin headgear]], [[Firemaking cape]], [[Abyssal lantern]] or a [[bruma torch]] are extremely recommended as they can't be extinguished by traps in the [[Sophanem Dungeon|dungeon]]). If you don't have one, the [[Sophanem guard]] under the temple of the lesser deities will sell you an [[unlit torch]] for 200 [[coins]].
*A [[tinderbox]] (unless you have the [[Kandarin headgear]], [[Firemaking cape]], [[Abyssal lantern]] or a [[bruma torch]]). If you don't have one, the [[Sophanem guard]] will sell you one for 50 coins.

Cook's Assistant.desc:
The Lumbridge Castle cook is in a mess. It is the Duke of Lumbridge's birthday and the cook is making the cake.

He needs a lot of ingredients and doesn't have much time.
Cook's Assistant.name: Cook's Assistant
Cook's Assistant.start: Speak to the [[Cook (Lumbridge)|Cook]] in the kitchen of [[Lumbridge Castle]].

The Corsair Curse.desc:
From the newly revealed town of Corsair Cove, deep in the south of Feldip Hills, the captain of the Corsairs has sailed to Port Sarim seeking help. His crew is sick, and he suspects that a curse has been laid upon them.

If you can unravel the fearful and conflicting tales of ogre relics, vengeful mermaids and demonic possession, maybe you can help his ailing crew overcome The Corsair Curse.
The Corsair Curse.name: The Corsair Curse
The Corsair Curse.start: Speak to [[Captain Tock]] at the crossroads north of [[Port Sarim]].

Creature of Fenkenstrain.requirements: * Completion of [[Priest in Peril]] * Completion of [[The Restless Ghost]] * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 20 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 25 [[Thieving]] (boostable) (not required to start) * Able to defeat a level 51 monster and run past level 72 monsters
Creature of Fenkenstrain.desc:
[[Dr Fenkenstrain]], master and sole occupant of the castle to the north-east of [[Canifis]], needs a new servant to go on a dark errand for him.

Do you have the stomach to help Fenkenstrain complete his twisted purpose?
Creature of Fenkenstrain.name: Creature of Fenkenstrain
Creature of Fenkenstrain.start: Read the signpost in the middle of [[Canifis]].
Creature of Fenkenstrain.ironman: * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 4 [[Smithing]] (boostable) (to make a [[bronze wire]])
Creature of Fenkenstrain.items:
* [[Hammer]]
* [[Ghostspeak amulet]]
* [[Silver bar]]
* 3 [[bronze wire]] (unnoted)
* [[Needle]]
* 5 [[thread]]
* [[Spade]]
* 1 [[law rune|law]] & 1 [[air rune]] for [[Telekinetic Grab]] OR 50 [[coins]]

Curse of the Empty Lord.requirements: *Started [[Desert Treasure I]] and [[The Restless Ghost]] **[[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 53 [[Thieving]] (not boostable) (required to start) to obtain the [[Ring of visibility]] *[[File:Prayer icon.png|link=Prayer|alt=Prayer]] 31 [[Prayer]] (not boostable) (not required to start) (Some players will need this to access the 2nd floor of the [[Edgeville Monastery]])
Curse of the Empty Lord.desc: Follow the sad tale of woe from one cursed soul to the next and learn more of Zamorak's betrayal of Zaros.
Curse of the Empty Lord.name: Curse of the Empty Lord
Curse of the Empty Lord.start: Talk to the mysterious ghost ([[Valdez]]) near [[Glarial's Tomb]].
Curse of the Empty Lord.ironman:
* [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] You may need to visit [[Entrana]]
* [[File:Hardcore ironman chat badge.png]] You will need to go into the [[Wilderness]]. To make this somewhat safer you can also do this in [[F2P]] worlds.
Curse of the Empty Lord.items:
*[[Ring of visibility]]
*[[Ghostspeak amulet]] ([[Morytania legs 2]] or higher may be used instead, except when otherwise noted)
*Some players may need 5 [[coins]] to purchase a [[Shantay pass (item)|Shantay pass]]
*[[Knife]] or Slash Weapon for the Lava Maze

Daddy's Home.desc: Marlo's father requires someone to refurnish his disastrous house.
Daddy's Home.name: Daddy's Home
Daddy's Home.start: Speak to [[Marlo]] in the Estate Agent's house in north-east Varrock.
Daddy's Home.items:
*10 [[plank]]s – (oak/teak/mahogany will '''not''' work)
*5 [[bolts of cloth]] (can be bought from the [[Sawmill]] for 650 coins per bolt)
*At least 16 [[nails]] of any type, e.g. [[steel nails]] (more are recommended as nails bend when building furniture. 100 is recommended at 1 [[Construction]], obtainable from the [[Sawmill]] during the quest)
*[[Hammer]] (Obtainable during the quest from Yarlo)
*[[Saw]] (Obtainable during the quest)

Darkness of Hallowvale.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[In Aid of the Myreque]] ***[[In Search of the Myreque]] ****[[Nature Spirit]] *****[[Priest in Peril]] *****[[The Restless Ghost]] *[[File:Construction icon.png|link=Construction|alt=Construction]] 5 [[Construction]] (boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 20 [[Mining]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 22 [[Thieving]] (not boostable) (required to start) '"`UNIQ--ref-00000006-QINU`"' *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 26 [[Agility]] (boostable) (required to start) '"`UNIQ--ref-00000007-QINU`"' *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 32 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 33 [[Magic]] (boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Strength icon.png|link=Strength|alt=Strength]] 40 [[Strength]] (not boostable) (required to start) *The ability to withstand several melee attacks from a level 169 enemy.
Darkness of Hallowvale.desc:
Fighting tooth and nail against the vampyre overlord, Drakan, the Myreque have moved their secret base camp to Burgh de Rott. Now the fight starts in earnest! Veliaf needs someone to make their way into the Sanguinesti region, the eastern side of Morytania cut off from the west behind an impenetrably huge wall.

Will the fight be supported by Myreque resistance inside the vampyres' domain? What grim discoveries are to be found behind that dread wall? And what of the Vyrewatch - deadly sky-bound patrollers of the blood-tithed lands of Meiyerditch?

Only a daring, quick-witted agent with an eye for detail can hope to pick their way through the tumbled down slums of Meiyerditch.
Darkness of Hallowvale.kills: None - however, [[Vanstrom_Klause#Vampyre|Vanstrom Klause]] (level 169) needs to be fought until he has attacked you 5 times (whether he hits or misses), and it is very possible to die. However, death can be avoided if you pray protect from melee right after you draw the third sketch.
Darkness of Hallowvale.name: Darkness of Hallowvale
Darkness of Hallowvale.start: Go to [[Burgh de Rott]] and into the basement of the inn there and speak to [[Veliaf Hurtz]].
Darkness of Hallowvale.items:
*8 [[nails]]
*2 [[plank]]s
*[[Hammer]]
*[[Knife]] (obtainable during the quest) or a [[sickle]]
*Means to cast [[Telekinetic Grab]] ([[air rune|air]] and [[law rune]]; both obtainable during the quest)

Death Plateau.desc:
Trolls have come down from the north and are camped on Death Plateau. They are using this base to launch attacks on the principality of Burthorpe!
The Imperial Guard is taking heavy losses. They need your help!
Death Plateau.name: Death Plateau
Death Plateau.start: Talk to [[Denulth]] in his tent in [[Burthorpe]]. Tell him you will discover the path for him.
Death Plateau.ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] Players need 21 empty inventory spaces to deliver items to Tenzing.
Death Plateau.items:
* 60 [[coins]] (bring 1000 for the gambling dice with Harold part)
*10 unnoted [[bread]]
*10 unnoted cooked [[trout]]
*[[Iron bar]]
*[[Asgarnian ale]] (can be found on the bar at the pub in [[Burthorpe]])

Death on the Isle.start: Speak to [[Patzi]] by the entrance to [[Villa Lucens]].

Death to the Dorgeshuun.desc: Humans have been visiting the Dorgeshuun mines for some time now, but no Dorgeshuun has visited the surface since the signing of the Lumbridge-Dorgeshuun treaty. The Dorgeshuun Council fears that the [[Humans Against Monsters|H.A.M.]] group may be planning another attack, and want to send an agent to the surface to investigate. But they do not want to send someone to the surface without a guide...
Death to the Dorgeshuun.name: Death to the Dorgeshuun
Death to the Dorgeshuun.items:
*Any [[light source]] ([[lantern]]s are recommended - open light sources such as a [[candle]] can cause [[gas explosion]]s and require a [[tinderbox]])
*2 full sets of [[H.A.M. robes]] (all 7 pieces) (chance to receive robes is significantly higher during the quest)'"`UNIQ--ref-0000000C-QINU`"'

Defender of Varrock.requirements: * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 55 [[Smithing]] (not boostable) (required to start) * [[File:Hunter icon.png|link=Hunter|alt=Hunter]] 52 [[Hunter]] (not boostable) (required to start) *Completion of the following quests: **[[Shield of Arrav]] **[[Temple of Ikov]] **[[Below Ice Mountain]] **[[Family Crest]] **[[Garden of Tranquillity]] ***[[Creature of Fenkenstrain]] ****[[Priest in Peril]] ****[[The Restless Ghost]] **[[What Lies Below]] ***[[Rune Mysteries]] **[[Romeo & Juliet]] **[[Demon Slayer]]
Defender of Varrock.desc:
Long ago, one man wielding a magic shield stood against the undead armies of the Mahjarrat. His name was Arrav, and he was strong and noble, but the fates had spoken: his downfall at the hands of the evil necromancer Zemouregal was inevitable. In one last desperate act to save his people, Arrav flung the shield towards the town now known as Varrock, protecting it from further harm. In that very moment, Zemouregal struck him down. Standing over the fatally wounded hero, Zemouregal made a promise:

"When I return, you shall lead my armies. You shall be my greatest champion, and suffer under the knowledge that while you hoped to save your people, you will instead be their doom."

Now, there is fear in the air. Whispers of the dead rising. Could this be the time of the prophesied return?
Defender of Varrock.kills:
* At least six [[armoured zombie]]s (level 85)
* Multiple [[Chaos Golem]]s (level 70)
Defender of Varrock.name: Defender of Varrock
Defender of Varrock.start: Speak to [[Elias White]] in the [[Jolly Boar Inn]].
Defender of Varrock.items:
* [[Chaos core]] (Can be obtained during the quest)
*[[Barronite deposit]] or a [[pickaxe]] to mine one

Demon Slayer.desc: A mighty demon is being summoned to destroy the city of Varrock. You find out you are the one destined to stop him (or at least try).
Demon Slayer.name: Demon Slayer

Rumours abound throughout Varrock and Al-Kharid that an archaeologist has discovered clues to a hoard of treasure hidden deep in the desert, south of Al-Kharid.

Desert Treasure II - The Fallen Empire.desc:
During Gielinor's Second Age, the world was dominated by an empire the likes of which had never been seen. The areas now known as Asgarnia, Misthalin and even the Wilderness all once flourished under the banner of the Empty Lord. With the grand city of Senntisten at its heart, this civilisation washed over Gielinor like an unstoppable tide, pushing the boundaries of magic and science, while crushing any who stood in their way.

Fast forward to today, the Fifth Age, and you won't find much trace of this ancient empire. Indeed, Saradominists and Zamorakians alike have spent many lifetimes purging all remnants of it. However, small fragments of this fallen empire remain, for those who know where to look.

Perhaps you’ve already encountered some of these remains. Maybe you’ve met the monstrous Nex, sealed behind the Frozen Door for millennia. Or perhaps you’ve visited the bandits of the Kharidian Desert, the final human followers of the Empty Lord. You might even have encountered some mysterious Mahjarrat hidden away beneath those same sands. However, there are other parts of this forgotten empire that even you won’t have encountered yet. For example, this story begins deep in the desert, within a mysterious vault...

"There's gold in them there hills" (well stream actually) as well as many other items that can be found at the digsite. Join the students in their attempt to be a qualified archaeologist, and become experienced in making the earth move!

Have you got what it takes to unearth the hidden altar to one of RuneScape's lesser-known Gods?

Dragon Slayer II.desc: 30 years prior to the fateful day a mighty adventurer awakened Elvarg from her slumber, Crandor was a thriving and very much alive island, with a great tradition of mages and adventurers. The history of Crandor is a bold one, enough so that many a Crandorian earned the right to be part of the Champions' Guild! The Crandor we know today is very different from that of the past and there are so many questions that remain unanswered - your chance to uncover the secrets of the past starts with Dragon Slayer II.

*A [[machete]]
*A [[saw]]
*[[Catspeak amulet]]
*[[Ghostspeak amulet]] ([[Morytania Legs 2]]+ work)
*[[Goutweed]]
*[[Cut dragonstone]]
*2 [[molten glass]]
*[[Glassblowing pipe]]
*[[Chisel]]
*[[Spade]]
*[[Astral rune]]
*[[Seal of passage]] (or [[elite Fremennik Diary]] completion)
*[[Tinderbox]]
*[[Pestle and mortar]]
*Runes for 3 [[Fire Wave]] spells '''or''' 3 [[Fire Surge]] spells

Dream Mentor.requirements: *[[File:Attack style icon.png|link=Combat level|alt=Combat level]] 85 [[Combat level|Combat]] (required to start) *Completion of the following quests: **[[Lunar Diplomacy]] ***[[The Fremennik Trials]] ***[[Lost City]] ***[[Rune Mysteries]] ***[[Shilo Village]] ****[[Jungle Potion]] **[[Eadgar's Ruse]] ***[[Druidic Ritual]] ***[[Troll Stronghold]] ****[[Death Plateau]] *The ability to defeat 4 powerful monsters without the use of prayer
Dream Mentor.desc: Gielinor is not the safest place to live - dragons, trolls, demons... dangerous and despicable monsters of all sorts roam free. In this quest, you must help a fellow adventurer that doesn't do so well against these threats. With perseverance and the magical help of the Moon Clan, there should be no monster that can't be beaten. But is that really true? How about the monsters in your dreams? How about your own inescapable fears? How would you defeat them? Well, you'll soon find out as a tough and often bizarre quest awaits those of a strong will!
Dream Mentor.name: Dream Mentor
Dream Mentor.start: Talk to the [[Cyrisus|fallen man]] in the small cave in the [[Lunar Isle mine]].
Dream Mentor.ironman: [[File:Hardcore ironman chat badge.png]] '''Note''': As opposed to the dream world in Lunar Diplomacy, the dream world in Dream Mentor is not safe and dying here is the same as dying in the rest of Gielinor: you will lose your hardcore status.
Dream Mentor.items:
*A [[seal of passage]]
*3 different kinds of [[food]]: 6 of 1 type and 7 of 2 others for a total of 20 pieces (Sacks of [[cabbages]], [[potatoes]], and [[onions]] can be used as they each contain 10 piece of their respective [[food]] and only require a total of 3 inventory slots. Fruit baskets also work.)
*[[Goutweed]]
*An [[astral rune]]
*A [[tinderbox]]
*A [[hammer]]
*A [[pestle and mortar]]
*A good [[weapon]] ''([[trident of the seas]] recommended because they have no magic defence)'', good [[armour]], good food such as [[shark]]s, and [[super potion set]]s.

Druidic Ritual.desc: The Druids north of Taverley need help making a potion to reclaim the stone circle south of Varrock.
Druidic Ritual.name: Druidic Ritual
Druidic Ritual.start: Speak to [[Kaqemeex]] in the stone circle north of [[Taverley]].
Druidic Ritual.items:
*[[Raw bear meat]]
*[[Raw rat meat]]
*[[Raw beef]]
*[[Raw chicken]]

Dwarf Cannon.desc:
For several years now, the Dwarven Black Guard have been developing the latest in projectile warfare.

With the constant attack of goblin renegades, the dwarven troops who protect the mines need to put this secret weapon into action.

Only with your help can the true power of this cannon be harnessed!
Dwarf Cannon.name: Dwarf Cannon
Dwarf Cannon.start: Talk to [[Captain Lawgof]], south of the [[Coal Trucks]], north-west of the [[Fishing Guild]].

Eadgar's Ruse.requirements: * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Druidic Ritual]] ** [[Troll Stronghold]] *** [[Death Plateau]] * [[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 31 [[Herblore]] (boostable) (required to start)
Eadgar's Ruse.desc:
Sanfew requires a rare herb for the next part of the purifying ritual.

Travel back to the Troll Stronghold to find this herb that the trolls use as an ingredient for their favourite dish.
Eadgar's Ruse.name: Eadgar's Ruse
Eadgar's Ruse.start: Talk to [[Sanfew]] in upper floor of the building where [[Jatix's Herblore Shop]] is in [[Taverley]].
Eadgar's Ruse.items:
* [[Climbing boots]] (or 12 [[coins]] to buy from Tenzing)
* [[Vodka]] (sold by [[Funch's Fine Groceries|Heckel Funch]] at the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]] bar for 5 coins)
* [[Pineapple chunks]] (pineapples are sold by [[Funch's Fine Groceries|Heckel Funch]] at the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]] bar or any [[Charter_ship|Charter Ship]], use a knife to dice the pineapple into chunks)
* 1 [[Logs|Log]] (2-3 logs and a [[tinderbox]] may be helpful)
* 10 [[Grain]] (obtainable during the quest, just south of [[Tegid]])
* 5 [[Raw chicken]] (there are chickens on the way at [[Tenzing]]'s house. Undead chickens do not work)
* [[Pestle and mortar]]
* [[Ranarr potion (unf)]]

Eagles' Peak.requirements: *[[File:Hunter icon.png|link=Hunter|alt=Hunter]] 27 [[Hunter]] (boostable) (required to start)
Eagles' Peak.desc:
The Ardougne Zoo is always looking for new specimens, but one of their anticipated new attractions - a ferret from the north - has been proving elusive.

One of the Zoo's more eccentric freelance specimen hunters is reported to be on the case, but after setting out for the far western reaches, somewhere between the Piscatoris Fishing Colony and the Tree Gnome Stronghold, nothing more has been heard from him.

Will you be able to use your skills as a Hunter to track him down? What else will you discover at the mountain known as Eagles' Peak?
Eagles' Peak.name: Eagles' Peak
Eagles' Peak.start: Speak to [[Charlie]], one of the keepers at [[Ardougne Zoo]].
Eagles' Peak.ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] You need to unequip your headgear and cape and have 6 empty inventory slots in addition to that.

Elemental Workshop I.requirements: * [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 20 [[Mining]] (boostable) (not required to start) '"`UNIQ--ref-00000003-QINU`"' * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 20 [[Smithing]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 20 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (not required to start)
Elemental Workshop I.desc:
Hundreds of years ago, a mineral was found that had the ability to change the property of Magic.

The magicians, fearing the effect this may have on their profession, sealed this Workshop forever; or so they had hoped. See if you can rediscover the lost knowledge of elemental ore.
Elemental Workshop I.name: Elemental Workshop I
Elemental Workshop I.start: [[Seers' Village]], the house south-west of the bank. Search the bookcase there.
Elemental Workshop I.ironman: * [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 30 [[Mining]] (boostable) (if mining the coal)
Elemental Workshop I.items:
* [[Knife]] (obtainable during the quest) or a [[slash weapon]] (e.g. [[dagger]] or [[scimitar]])
* [[Pickaxe]]
* [[Needle]] (obtainable during the quest, '''[[Costume needle]] does not work''')
* [[Thread]]
* [[Leather]] (obtainable during the quest)
* [[Hammer]]
* 4 [[coal]] (4 more for each additional bar you would like to produce)

Elemental Workshop II.requirements: *[[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 20 [[Magic]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 30 [[Smithing]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *Completion of [[Elemental Workshop I]]
Elemental Workshop II.desc:
Among the ancient scrolls and papers held at the Dig Site's Examination Centre, scholars have discovered more references to the mysterious elemental ore. Recently they have uncovered a beaten book detailing long-lost uses for this odd material.
Can you decrypt the code that will lead you to the deeper depths of the Elemental Workshop? Can you get your head around fixing the mind-bending machinery, or will you fry your brain in the attempt?
Elemental Workshop II.kills: (If you do not have the elemental metal bars) 2 [[Earth elemental]]s ''(level 35)''
Elemental Workshop II.name: Elemental Workshop II
Elemental Workshop II.start: Search the bookcases in the [[Exam Centre]]'s library and read the [[beaten book]]
Elemental Workshop II.items:
*[[Pickaxe]] (if obtaining elemental ore during quest)
*[[Hammer]]
*2 [[Elemental metal]]s (3 elemental metals if you wish to smith the [[Mind shield]]), or:
**2 [[Elemental ore]] (obtainable during quest) (3 if you wish to smith the mind shield)
**8 [[Coal]] (12 if you wish to smith the mind shield)
*The [[battered key]] from [[Elemental Workshop I]]

Enakhra's Lament.requirements: *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 50 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 45 [[Firemaking]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Prayer icon.png|link=Prayer|alt=Prayer]] 43 [[Prayer]] (not boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 39 [[Magic]] (boostable) (not required to start) *Must be on the [[standard spellbook]]
Enakhra's Lament.desc:
Lazim the sculptor has a sad tale to tell - his days of making art are over, and now all he can do is carp at adventurers as they make a statue for him in the desert. Although, isn't just south of the Bandit Camp an odd place to be putting up a statue?
Help Lazim out with his artistic endeavours, and learn more as this quest goes deeper into the history of ''RuneScape'' than you might expect...
Enakhra's Lament.name: Enakhra's Lament
Enakhra's Lament.start: Talk to [[Lazim]] just north-east of the [[Desert Quarry]].
Enakhra's Lament.ironman: *[[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 45 [[Mining]] (boostable) to mine [[granite]]
Enakhra's Lament.items: *[[Chisel]] *One of the following: [[bread]], any kind of [[pie]], any kind of [[cake]], any kind of [[pizza]], or a [[baked potato]] with topping (partial pies, cakes and pizzas do '''not''' work, and neither will burnt versions) *[[Tinderbox]] *[[Candle]] (a [[black candle]] will '''not''' work) *[[Logs]] *[[Oak logs]] *[[Willow logs]] *[[Maple logs]] *[[Pickaxe]] (unless you already have the required items) *[[Soft clay]] (obtainable during quest if you bring a pickaxe and bucket or jug of water) *[[Coal]] (obtainable during quest with level [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 30 [[Mining]](boostable)) *52 kg of [[sandstone]] (obtainable during quest with level [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 35 [[Mining]] (boostable)) *Two [[Granite (5kg)|5 kg pieces of granite]] (obtainable during quest with level [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 45 [[Mining]] (boostable)) *Runes to cast [[Fire Bolt]], [[Fire Blast]] or [[Fire Wave]] *Runes to cast [[Wind Bolt]], [[Wind Blast]] or [[Wind Wave]] *Runes to cast [[Crumble Undead]] (multiple casts recommended in case of splashing) *Enough remaining Prayer points to cast [[Protect from Melee]] for about five seconds

Enlightened Journey.requirements: *[[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] 20 [[Quest points]] (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 20 [[Firemaking]] (boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Farming icon.png|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 30 [[Farming]] (boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 36 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (required to start)
Enlightened Journey.desc: On the peaceful island of Entrana, a lone monk has tired of his life of simplicity and quiet reflection. Auguste wants to boldly write his name in the history books; to craftily defeat the laws of physics; to miraculously sail through the air... preferably not to horribly explode into a ball of flaming death. Of course, to do all this, he'll need the help of a worldly adventurer: are you bold enough to merrily laugh in the face of the unknown?
Enlightened Journey.name: Enlightened Journey
Enlightened Journey.start: Speak to [[Auguste]] on the island of [[Entrana]].
Enlightened Journey.ironman: * [[File:Ironman chat badge.png]] [[File:Farming icon.png|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 30 [[Farming]] (boostable) required to grow a [[Willow Tree (Farming)|willow tree]] for the willow branch * [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The player visits [[Entrana]]
Enlightened Journey.items:
*3 unnoted [[papyrus]]
*1 [[ball of wool]]
*A full [[Potatoes|sack of potatoes]] (item is called [[Potatoes(10)]]) (there are potatoes growing in [[Entrana]] in the house east of Auguste, bring another [[empty sack]] if picking here)
*8 [[empty sack]]s – bring 9 sacks if planning to fill one with [[potatoes]] on [[Entrana]].
*1 unlit [[candle]] or [[black candle]] (can be obtained during quest by stealing candles in Entrana church)
*[[Yellow dye]]
*[[Red dye]]
*10 unnoted [[silk]]
*A [[bowl]] (obtainable during quest)
*At least 10 unnoted normal [[logs]]
*A [[tinderbox]]
*12 unnoted [[willow branch]]es (buy from the [[Grand Exchange]], or plant a [[willow sapling]] and wait 4 hours.)
**Note: A [[willow seed]] is not required, nor is a [[basket of apples]] as payment (although planting one beforehand is faster); all players receive a [[Auguste's sapling|willow sapling]] and a basket of apples to pay to protect the tree from [[Auguste]] during the quest.
**[[Secateurs]] (only if planting the tree) (can also be exchanged from a [[Tool Leprechaun]] if placed there before)
**A [[rake]] (only if planting the tree) (can also be exchanged from a [[Tool Leprechaun]] if placed there before)
**A [[spade]] (only if planting the tree) (can also be exchanged from a [[Tool Leprechaun]] if placed there before)

Enter the Abyss.desc: In the [[Abyss]] miniquest, the player helps the [[Zamorak]]ians access the [[rune essence mine]]s so that they can craft their own runes. Previously, it had been a [[Saradomin]]ist secret, but the [[Mage of Zamorak]] asks for the player's help in learning it.
Enter the Abyss.name: Enter the Abyss
Enter the Abyss.start: Speak to the [[Mage of Zamorak]] at the end of the [[River Lum]] in the [[Wilderness]] (Roams levels 4-7).
Enter the Abyss.ironman: '''Warning:''' [[File:Hardcore_ironman_chat_badge.png]] Hardcore Ironmen should be extremely cautious as the miniquest is started by travelling to level 4-7 [[Wilderness]], with a chance of getting killed by other players.

Ernest the Chicken.requirements: *The ability to defend from a level 22 [[Skeleton]].
Ernest the Chicken.desc: Veronica is very worried. Her fiancé went into the big spooky manor house to ask for directions. An hour later and he's still not out yet.
Ernest the Chicken.name: Ernest the Chicken
Ernest the Chicken.start: Speak to [[Veronica]], south of [[Draynor Manor]] by the gate.
Ernest the Chicken.items:
* [[Spade]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Fish food]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Poison (item)|Poison]] (can be obtained during the quest)

Ethically Acquired Antiquities.requirements: *[[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 25 [[Thieving]] (unknown[[Category:Unknown boost status]]) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *Completion of the following quests: **[[Children of the Sun]] **[[Shield of Arrav]]
Ethically Acquired Antiquities.desc: Investigate a mysterious theft from the Fortis Grand Museum.
Ethically Acquired Antiquities.name: Ethically Acquired Antiquities
Ethically Acquired Antiquities.start: Inspect the [[Empty display (Xerna's Diadem)|empty display]] on the ground floor of the [[Grand Museum]] in [[Civitas illa Fortis]].

The Eyes of Glouphrie.requirements: *Completed [[The Grand Tree]] quest *[[File:Construction icon.png|link=Construction|alt=Construction]] 5 [[Construction]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 46 [[Magic]] (not boostable) (not required to start)
The Eyes of Glouphrie.desc: After you foiled a plan to destroy the Grand Tree things have been quiet in the gnome world. Brimstail has found a strange machine, though, built by [[Oaknock]] the Engineer during the Gnomes' Golden Age. What does the weird device do? Why on Gielinor was it built? If you agree to help this bookworm gnome get this confusing device working, you will learn a little about gnome magicks, gnome history, and you will start to uncover a new threat (or is it an old one?) to gnome security - a threat that is a lot harder to see ...
The Eyes of Glouphrie.kills: 6 x [[Evil creature]] that each have 1 HP
The Eyes of Glouphrie.name: The Eyes of Glouphrie
The Eyes of Glouphrie.start: Speak to [[Brimstail]] in his [[Brimstail's cave|cave]] south-west side of the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]], directly west of the bank near the [[Stronghold Slayer Cave]].
The Eyes of Glouphrie.ironman: [[File:Ironman chat badge.png]] For mud runes, either [[File:Runecraft icon.png|link=Runecraft|alt=Runecraft]] 13 [[Runecraft]] to create them, [[File:Hunter icon.png|link=Hunter|alt=Hunter]] 42 [[Hunter]] to catch essence implings, or [[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 33 [[Magic]] to earn points at the [[Mage Training Arena]] [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] [[Magic glue]] can be made before starting the quest by grinding the [[mud rune]] with the [[pestle and mortar]] and using it on a [[bucket of sap]], saving inventory space.
The Eyes of Glouphrie.items:
*[[Bucket of sap]] (If you do not have one, you can use a [[knife]] on any tree that looks pointy (evergreen shaped trees) with a [[bucket]] in your inventory)
*[[Mud rune]]
*[[Maple logs]]
*[[Oak logs]]
*[[Hammer]]
*[[Saw]]
*[[Pestle and mortar]]

Fairytale I - Growing Pains.requirements:
*Completion of the following quests:
**[[Lost City]]
**[[Nature Spirit]]
***[[The Restless Ghost]]
***[[Priest in Peril]]
*The ability to defeat a level 111 [[Tanglefoot]] with limited weaponry
Fairytale I - Growing Pains.desc: Recently, farmers around RuneScape have been noticing some trouble with their farming patches. They just don't seem to have the same yields as before. What could be the source of this malady?
Fairytale I - Growing Pains.name: Fairytale I - Growing Pains
Fairytale I - Growing Pains.start: Speak to [[Martin the Master Gardener]] by the pig pen in [[Draynor Village]].
Fairytale I - Growing Pains.ironman:
*Completion of [[Jungle Potion]] (to obtain [[proboscis]] if needed)
*Ironmen who do not have the necessary [[Herblore]] level to clean possible herbs required to bless the [[secateurs]] will need to visit the [[Zahur|herblore shop]] in [[Nardah]] to clean the grimy herbs.
Fairytale I - Growing Pains.items:
*[[Secateurs]] (obtainable in [[Sarah's Farming shop]] north-west of the quest start for 5 coins)
*[[Spade]] (obtainable multiple times during quest)
*[[Ghostspeak amulet]]
*[[Dramen staff]]
*[[Draynor skull]] (obtainable during quest)
*A combination of three items picked for you at random, see [[Fairytale I - Growing Pains#Blessed secateurs|list of potential items]].

Fairytale II - Cure a Queen.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[Fairytale I - Growing Pains]] ***[[Lost City]] ***[[Nature Spirit]] ****[[The Restless Ghost]] ****[[Priest in Peril]] '''Note:''' The following skill levels are required to complete the quest. These skills are '''not''' required to unlock access to [[fairy rings]], for which you only need to progress the quest up to a [[#Unlocking fairy rings|certain point]]. However, building fairy rings in the [[player-owned house]] requires full quest completion. *[[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 40 [[Thieving]] (not boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Farming icon.png|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 49 [[Farming]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 57 [[Herblore]] (boostable) (not required to start)
Fairytale II - Cure a Queen.desc:
The Fairy Queen should be awake and back in charge of the Lost City by now, but what is happening in Zanaris? Why hasn't the Fairy Godfather abdicated the throne?

What is happening to all the fairy inhabitants and where has Fairy Nuff gone? Can you rise to the challenge of using the fairy rings to search the other planes and Cure a Queen, in the second part of the Fairy Tale trilogy?
Fairytale II - Cure a Queen.name: Fairytale II - Cure a Queen
Fairytale II - Cure a Queen.start: Speak to [[Martin the Master Gardener]] by the pig pen in [[Draynor Village]].
Fairytale II - Cure a Queen.items:
*[[Dramen staff|Dramen]] or [[Lunar staff]]
*[[Vial of water]]
*[[Pestle and mortar]]
*[[Nuff's certificate]] (obtained during quest)

Family Crest.requirements: * [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 40 [[Mining]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 40 [[Smithing]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 59 [[Magic]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 40 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (not required to start) * The ability to defeat a level 170 [[Demons|demon]] (can be [[safespot]]ted)
Family Crest.desc: There is a man in [[Varrock]] who needs a bit of help. He is of noble heritage, but without his family's crest, he can't prove it. Unfortunately, his three sons took the crest with them when they left, scattering all across ''RuneScape''.
Family Crest.name: Family Crest
Family Crest.ironman: '''Warning:''' [[File:Hardcore ironman chat badge.png]] The player visits the [[Wilderness]] section of [[Edgeville Dungeon]] *For a [[swordfish]] purchasable from [[The Shrimp and Parrot]]: ** [[File:Fishing icon.png|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 50 [[Fishing]] (boostable) ** [[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 45 [[Cooking]] (boostable) *For a [[bass]] (a [[raw bass]] can be obtained from a [[Reward pool]]) : ** [[File:Fishing icon.png|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 46 [[Fishing]] (boostable) ** [[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 43 [[Cooking]] (boostable)
Family Crest.items:
* [[Shrimps]]
* [[Salmon]]
* [[Tuna]]
* [[Bass]]
* [[Swordfish]]
* [[Pickaxe]] - [[Adamant pickaxe|adamant]] or [[Rune pickaxe|rune]] (41+ Mining) highly recommended
* 2 [[Ruby|cut rubies]]
* [[Ring Mould]]
* [[Necklace Mould]]
* Any [[poison cure]] like [[Antipoison]] (you will lose this item)
* Means to cast all 4 [[Blast spells]]

The Feud.requirements: * [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 30 [[Thieving]] (not boostable) (required to start) * The ability to kill a level 70 [[Bandit champion|bandit]] and a level 75 [[Tough Guy|Menaphite]] (both can be safespotted).
The Feud.desc:
Ali Morrisane - RuneScape's self proclaimed 'greatest merchant' - is having difficulties. He is selling things at such a rate that he cannot keep his market stall in stock.

Word has it that he is on the lookout for someone; someone who can recruit some help from his home town Pollnivneach - a somewhat anarchic place, south of the Shantay Pass.
The Feud.name: The Feud
The Feud.start: Talk to [[Ali Morrisane]] east of the Gem Trader in northern [[Al Kharid]].
The Feud.items:
* 501+ [[coins]]
* [[Gloves]] - ([[Leather gloves]] and [[graceful gloves]] work, [[Barrows gloves]], [[ice gloves]], [[vambraces]] and [[Slayer gloves]] do '''not''' work!)
* [[Kharidian headpiece]] (can be bought from [[Ali Morrisane]])
* [[Fake beard]] (can be bought from [[Ali Morrisane]])
* 3 [[beer]]s (can be obtained during quest, bought from [[Ali the Barman]] for 2 coins each)
* [[Bucket]] or [[Ugthanki dung]] (can be obtained during quest, spawns at the location it is needed – bring three extra buckets, four total, if you plan on doing [[My Arm's Big Adventure]] as three Ugthanki dung are needed for that quest). One more might be needed for [[Forgettable Tale...]] (1/25 chance for each player).
* if you have the [[snake charm ]] in your bank already you will need to retrieve it

Fight Arena.requirements: *The ability to defeat level 44, 63 and 137 enemies (all can be [[safespot]]ted)
Fight Arena.desc:
The prosperous Servil family have been abducted by the infamous General Khazard. He plans to have the family battle for his entertainment in the Fight Arena.

Can you rescue the Servils before the tyrant has these innocent (not to mention wealthy) civilians slain?
Fight Arena.name: Fight Arena
Fight Arena.start: Talk to [[Lady Servil]]. She is west by south-west of the [[Ardougne Monastery|Monastery]] that is south of [[Ardougne]].

Fishing Contest.requirements: *[[File:Fishing icon.png|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 10 [[Fishing]] (not boostable) (required to start)
Fishing Contest.desc: The mountain Dwarves' home would be an ideal way to get across White Wolf Mountain safely. However, the Dwarves aren't too fond of strangers. They will let you through if you can bring them a trophy. The trophy is the prize for the annual Hemenster fishing competition.
Fishing Contest.name: Fishing Contest
Fishing Contest.start: Dwarves at the entrances to the tunnel that goes under [[White Wolf Mountain]].
Fishing Contest.items:
*[[Spade]]
*5 [[coins]] (10 if you buy a [[fishing rod]] from Jack)
*[[Fishing pass]] (obtained during quest)
*[[Garlic]] (obtainable during quest)
*[[Fishing rod]] (obtainable during quest), [[oily fishing rod]] does '''not''' work
*[[Red vine worm]] (obtainable during quest)

Forgettable Tale....requirements: *[[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 22 [[Cooking]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Farming icon.png|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 17 [[Farming]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *Completion of the following quests: **[[The Giant Dwarf]] **[[Fishing Contest]]
Forgettable Tale....desc:
Forgettable Tale of a Drunken Dwarf is part 2 in the [[Rise of the Red Axe]] series, focusing on the dwarves and their capital city of [[Keldagrim]]. After the events in [[The Giant Dwarf]], the [[Red Axe]] mining company has departed the city and set up a new headquarters in a remote underground location.

[[Veldaban]], the Commander of the [[Dwarven Black Guard]] in [[Keldagrim]], wants you to investigate the case and find out if the [[Red Axe]] is planning anything nefarious. The problem is, the only lead he's got is an extremely drunken and kebab obsessed dwarf.

Use your farming and brewing abilities to your advantage, then prepare to be perplexed by puzzles as you follow the trail to the [[Red Axe]]...
Forgettable Tale....name: Forgettable Tale...
Forgettable Tale....start: Talk to Commander [[Veldaban]] in the [[Dwarven Black Guard]] headquarters in [[Keldagrim]].
Forgettable Tale....items:
*~400 [[coins]]
*2 [[barley malt]] (no range in Keldagrim, plain barley has to be cooked elsewhere)
*2 [[buckets of water]]
*[[Seed dibber]] (no Tool leprechaun in Keldagrim) or partial completion of the [[Farming]] portion of the [[Barbarian Training]] [[miniquest]]
*[[Rake]] (obtainable during the quest)
*[[Ale yeast]] (or a [[Pot]] (obtainable during the quest) + 25 coins)
*[[Kebab]] (purchasable during quest for 1 coin)
*2 [[beer]]s (purchasable during quest for 1-2 coins each)
*[[Beer glass]] (obtainable during the quest)
*A random item from the list below (see list for details)

The Forsaken Tower.requirements:
*Completion of the following quests:
**[[Client of Kourend]]
***[[X Marks the Spot]]
The Forsaken Tower.desc: For thousands of years, the Wintertodt has remained safely sealed behind the great Doors of Dinh. Alas, despite the best attempts of the Lovakengj smiths and the Arceuus mages, the doors are failing. Only Dinh himself knew the secrets behind the creation of these doors. Without his knowledge, there may be nothing to stop the Wintertodt escaping and bringing ruin upon Kourend. It is up to you to recover this knowledge.
The Forsaken Tower.name: The Forsaken Tower

The Fremennik Exiles.requirements: *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 65 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 60 [[Slayer]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 60 [[Smithing]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Fishing icon.png|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 60 [[Fishing]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Runecraft icon.png|link=Runecraft|alt=Runecraft]] 55 [[Runecraft]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 60 [[Mining]] (boostable) (not required to start) *Completion of the following quests: **[[The Fremennik Isles]] ***[[The Fremennik Trials]] **[[Lunar Diplomacy]] ***[[Lost City]] ***[[Rune Mysteries]] ***[[Shilo Village]] ****[[Jungle Potion]] *****[[Druidic Ritual]] **[[Mountain Daughter]] **[[Heroes' Quest]] ***[[Dragon Slayer I]] ***[[Lost City]] ***[[Merlin's Crystal]] ***[[Shield of Arrav]]
The Fremennik Exiles.desc: The Fremennik bards often sing tales of the past. Of great battles, deadly foes and heroes long gone. However, in recent years, things have been much quieter in the Province, as there's increasingly less to sing about. All that is about to change though, as what starts off as a simple investigation soon leads to one of the greatest threats the Fremennik have ever seen.
The Fremennik Exiles.kills:
*[[Basilisk Youngling]] (level 53)
*[[Basilisk]] (level 61)
*[[Monstrous Basilisk (The Fremennik Exiles)|Monstrous Basilisk]] (level 135)
*[[Typhor]] (level 218)
*[[The Jormungand]] (level 363)
The Fremennik Exiles.name: The Fremennik Exiles
The Fremennik Exiles.items: *[[Combat equipment]] *[[Mirror shield]] *2 [[Kegs of beer]] (cannot be obtained in Rellekka during quest, buy from [[Thora the Barkeep]] before starting the quest) *1 [[Molten glass]] *100 [[Astral rune]]s *[[Pet rock]] *[[Fishing rod]] or [[fly fishing rod]] *[[Fremennik shield]] (this is '''not''' the tradeable [[Neitiznot shield]]) **Alternatively, get it from [[Bardur]] AFTER being exiled, for either 150,000 '''or''' for free using a [[Ring of charos (a)]] **Recommended: [[Rune thrownaxe]]s or [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 85 [[Agility]] to get to [[Bardur]] in the [[Waterbirth Island Dungeon]] *[[Ice gloves]] or [[Smiths gloves (i)]] *[[Hammer]] *[[Glassblowing pipe]] *3 [[Lunar bar|Lunar bars]] or [[Lunar ore|ores]]. Alternatively a [[pickaxe]] to obtain them (requires [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 60 [[Mining]] (boostable)). *[[Seal of Passage]] (if the [[Fremennik diaries|elite Fremennik diaries]] aren't completed)

The Fremennik Isles.requirements: *Completion of [[The Fremennik Trials]] *[[File:Construction icon.png|link=Construction|alt=Construction]] 20 [[Construction]] (boostable) (not required to start) '"`UNIQ--ref-0000000F-QINU`"' *The ability to kill a level 122 [[Ice Troll King|Troll King]] (Damage can be reduced) and, separately, 10 rock throwing [[ice troll]]s in a [[multicombat area]].
The Fremennik Isles.desc:
Sibling rivalry can get messy - more so when the siblings are Fremennik princes with a point to prove. The islands of Jatizso and Neitiznot were set up by two brothers who hated each other, and they have been at loggerheads ever since. But now there is a new threat from trolls in the north...

Can you prove your loyalty to both brothers and save the islanders from a fate as troll food? Your skills as a Fremennik warrior, a bridge builder and... a jester will be tested on the islands.
The Fremennik Isles.name: The Fremennik Isles
The Fremennik Isles.start: Speak to [[Mord Gunnars]] at the northernmost dock of [[Rellekka]].
The Fremennik Isles.ironman: *[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 56 [[Woodcutting]] Required to make a Neitiznot shield with a [[hammer]] and one [[bronze nail]] *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 46 [[Crafting]] Required to make yak-hide armour with a [[needle]] and a [[thread]] *An [[axe]] [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The player will need to hand 17 items in at once.
The Fremennik Isles.items: *A [[raw tuna]] (obtainable during quest, with 35 fishing or bought from the shop) *Either 8 [[tin ore]]s, 7 pieces of [[coal]], or 6 [[mithril ore]]s (depends on your [[Mining]] level; level 1 will require tin ore, 2-54 will require coal, and 55-99 require mithril ore). '''Note:''' The ores can be noted. *9 [[rope]]s (obtainable during quest with [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 30 [[Crafting]]) **If the [[Neitiznot shield]] is already purchased, only 8 ropes are required. *A [[knife]] *8 [[split log]]s (obtainable during the quest with 56 Woodcutting and an axe) *a [[Neitiznot shield]] (or 56 Woodcutting, a [[hammer]] and a [[bronze nail]]) *[[Yak-hide armour (top)|Yak-hide armour top]] and [[Yak-hide armour (legs)|legs]] (or 46 Crafting, a [[needle]] and two [[thread]]) *5000 [[coins]] (optional) *[[Silly jester costume]] (obtainable during quest)

The Fremennik Trials.requirements: *If crafting the [[lyre]]: ** [[File:Fletching icon.png|link=Fletching|alt=Fletching]] 25 [[Fletching]] (boostable) (not required to start) ** [[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 40 [[Woodcutting]] (boostable) (not required to start) ** [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 40 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (not required to start) * '''OR''' ** Players can kill [[Lanzig]], [[Borrokar]], [[Lensa]] or [[Freidir]] to obtain the lyre ''(1/17 chance)'' * Ability to defeat a level-69 [[Draugen]] * Ability to defeat a [[Koschei|fairly strong warrior]] without [[armour]], [[weapons]], or [[spells]]
The Fremennik Trials.desc:
Council workmen have at last found the time to make repairs to the footbridge that connects Kandarin with the Barbarian town of Rellekka.

Do you have what it takes to impress the barbarians who live there, and perhaps be welcomed as an honorary member of their clan?
The Fremennik Trials.kills:
* [[Koschei the deathless]] (first three forms)
* [[Draugen]] ''(level 69)''
'''OPTIONAL'''
* [[Lanzig]], [[Borrokar]], [[Lensa]] or [[Freidir]] ''(level 48)'' (multiple times)
The Fremennik Trials.name: The Fremennik Trials
The Fremennik Trials.start: Speak to [[Brundt the Chieftain]] (located in the longhall) in [[Rellekka]].
The Fremennik Trials.ironman: * [[File:Fishing icon.png|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 76 [[Fishing]] (boostable) is required to fish for [[raw shark]]s. Alternative methods to obtain one are: ** [[Rufus' Meat Emporium]] in [[Canifis]] sells a single [[raw shark]]. ** [[Frankie's Fishing Emporium]] in [[Port Piscarilius]] sells [[raw shark]]. ** [[River troll]]s in the [[Enchanted Valley]] drop them commonly, but require access to [[fairy rings]]. ** [[Waterfiend]]s, combat level 115, rarely drop noted [[raw shark]]. ** [[Mogre]]s, combat level 60, require completion of [[Skippy and the Mogres]], [[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 32 [[Slayer]] (boostable), and [[fishing explosives]] to attack. They can rarely drop a [[raw shark]]. ** [[Wintertodt]] can drop a [[raw shark]] after [[File:Fishing icon.png|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 43 [[Fishing]], though it will be very rare, but chances increase with Fishing level. * [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] Sections of this quest have strict inventory requirements: ** [[#Thorvald the Warrior|Thorvald the Warrior]]: No weapons, armour, or runes. (A [[Looting bag]] is not allowed, regardless of its contents) ** [[#Peer the Seer|Peer the Seer]]: No items '''at all''' equipped or in your inventory.
The Fremennik Trials.items:
* 5,252 [[coins]]
* [[Beer]] (obtainable during quest)
* [[Tinderbox]]
* Either a [[raw shark]], [[raw manta ray]], or [[raw sea turtle]]
* If crafting the lyre yourself:
** Woodcutting [[axe]]
** [[Knife]]
** [[Potato]] (obtainable during quest)
** [[Onion]] (obtainable during quest)
** [[Cabbage]] (obtainable during quest)

The Frozen Door.requirements: * Completion of [[Desert Treasure I]] * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 70 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Hitpoints icon.png|link=Hitpoints|alt=Hitpoints]] 70 [[Hitpoints]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Ranged icon.png|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 70 [[Ranged]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Strength icon.png|link=Strength|alt=Strength]] 70 [[Strength]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]])
The Frozen Door.kills:
* [[Kree'arra]] ''(level 580)''
* [[General Graardor]] ''(level 624)''
* [[Commander Zilyana]] ''(level 596)''
* [[K'ril Tsutsaroth]] ''(level 650)''

Alternatives:

*[[Flight Kilisa]] ''(level 159)''
*[[Wingman Skree]] ''(level 143)''
*[[Flockleader Geerin]] ''(level 149)''
*[[Sergeant Strongstack]] ''(level 141)''
*[[Sergeant Steelwill]] ''(level 142)''
*[[Sergeant Grimspike]] ''(level 142)''
*[[Bree]] ''(level 146)''
*[[Starlight]] ''(level 149)''
*[[Growler]] ''(level 139)''
*[[Tstanon Karlak]] ''(level 145)''
*[[Zakl'n Gritch]] ''(level 142)''
*[[Balfrug Kreeyath]] ''(level 151)''
The Frozen Door.name: The Frozen Door
The Frozen Door.start: Receive an [[important letter]] from a [[Messenger (The Frozen Door)|messenger]].
The Frozen Door.items:
* [[Mith grapple]]
* A [[Crossbow (weapon)|crossbow]]
* 2 [[rope]]s to reach [[Saradomin's Encampment]]; one-time only
* A [[hammer]] or [[dragon warhammer]]

The Garden of Death.requirements: *[[File:Farming icon.png|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 20 [[Farming]] (not boostable) (required to start)
The Garden of Death.desc:
In our newest Twisted Tale, you’ll piece together a long-lost language and unravel the mystery of some ancient ruins. Welcome, adventurer, to The Garden of Death.

This quest contains no dialogue and focuses solely on environmental storytelling, so make sure that you set aside some time and prepare to be fully immersed in the world around you!
The Garden of Death.name: The Garden of Death
The Garden of Death.start: Search the tent at the campsite found east of the chasm at the southern end of the [[Kebos Lowlands]].

Garden of Tranquillity.requirements: *[[File:Farming icon.png|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 25 [[Farming]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *Completion of the following quests: **[[Creature of Fenkenstrain]] ***[[Priest in Peril]] ***[[The Restless Ghost]]
Garden of Tranquillity.desc:
'Queen of Varrock seeks experienced gardener to help construct a garden of peace and serenity as surprise for husband.

Only serious Farmers need apply. Peasants welcome (although not that welcome). Tools not supplied.

Please note: under no circumstances are the contents of this message to be disclosed to Rollie – um, one means King Roald.'
Garden of Tranquillity.name: Garden of Tranquillity
Garden of Tranquillity.start: Speak to Queen [[Ellamaria]] in the garden of [[Varrock Palace]].
Garden of Tranquillity.ironman: *([[File:Ironman chat badge.png|link=Ironman mode]]) All seeds needed for the quest can be bought from [[Olivia]] in Draynor. * [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] Inventory space can be saved by creating the [[rune dust]] ahead of time: use the [[hammer]] on the [[rune essence|rune]]/[[pure essence]] to create [[rune shards]], then use the [[pestle and mortar]] on those to create [[rune dust]]. The [[hammer]] and [[pestle and mortar]] can then be safely discarded since they play no further role in the quest.
Garden of Tranquillity.items:
*[[Ring of charos]]
*All [[tool leprechaun]] tools
**A [[rake]]
**A [[seed dibber]] (or partial completion of the [[Farming]] portion of the [[Barbarian Training]] [[miniquest]])
**A [[spade]]
**[[Secateurs]] ([[magic secateurs]] work)
**A [[watering can]]
**A [[gardening trowel]]
*2 [[plant cure]]s
*A [[marigold seed]] (2 recommended in case of failure)
*3+ [[cabbage seed]]s (6 recommended to plant in both allotments to increase chance of survival)
*3+ [[onion seed]]s (6 recommended to plant in both allotments to increase chance of survival)
*A [[hammer]]
*A [[rune essence|rune]]/[[pure essence]]
*A [[pestle and mortar]]
*A [[filled plant pot]]
*2 [[ultracompost]]/[[supercompost]]/[[compost]] (note: [[Bottomless compost bucket]] will not work for these two required composts. The quality of these 2 composts do not matter.)

Gertrude's Cat.desc: Gertrude has lost her cat Fluffs and desperately wants to find her. Can you help bring her home?
Gertrude's Cat.name: Gertrude's Cat
Gertrude's Cat.start: Go to [[Gertrude]]'s house which is just west of [[Varrock]].
Gertrude's Cat.items:
* [[Bucket of milk]]
* 100 [[coins]]
* [[Seasoned sardine]] (Bought from the [[Grand Exchange]]) or alternatively:
** [[Raw sardine]] (Caught or bought from [[Gerrant's Fishy Business.]])
** [[Doogle leaves]] (South of [[Gertrude]]'s house)

Getting Ahead.requirements: *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 30 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Construction icon.png|link=Construction|alt=Construction]] 26 [[Construction]] (not boostable) (required to start)
Getting Ahead.desc: Gordon and Mary are two small-town farmers with a big problem – some heinous beastie keeps taking their livestock! Luckily they've hit upon a solution. They just need some brave adventurer to venture into the creature's lair and bring them back its head. We can't envisage any complications with such a routine matter, right?
Getting Ahead.name: Getting Ahead
Getting Ahead.start: Speak to [[Gordon]] on [[Gordon and Mary's farm|his farm]] south of the [[Farming Guild]].
Getting Ahead.items:
*[[Bear fur]], [[grey wolf fur]], or [[Fur]] (a [[Grizzly bear]] and [[bear cub]] spawn west of the farm and two [[black bear]]s spawn east of the farm)
*[[Soft clay]] or a [[pickaxe]] you can use
** [[Clay rocks]] are found in the [[Kebos Lowlands mine]] passed during the quest;
** Gordon's house has a water source and a bucket spawn;
** There is a [[Bronze pickaxe]] spawn at the mine, stuck in some rocks.
*[[Hammer]] (obtainable near the cattle gate)
*[[Saw]] (obtainable in the shed north of the house)
*2 normal [[plank]]s (obtainable near the cave entrance)
*At least 6 [[nails]] of any kind (iron nails can be found in the workbench north of the house, and more than 6 is recommended in case you bend a few)
*[[Knife]] (obtainable on the kitchen table in the house)
*[[Red dye]] (obtainable from the [[Shelves (Getting Ahead)|shelves]] in the house)
*[[Pot of flour]] (obtainable upstairs in the house)
*[[Needle]] (obtainable upstairs in the house)
*[[Thread]] (obtainable upstairs in the house)

Ghosts Ahoy.requirements: * Completed [[Priest in Peril]] * Completed [[The Restless Ghost]] * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 25 [[Agility]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 20 [[Cooking]] (boostable) (not required to start)
Ghosts Ahoy.desc: East of [[Canifis]] is a ghost port. Not meaning that it's deserted. It's full of ghosts! For some reason, they're stuck in ''Gielinor'', but some aren't happy with that. Can you help?
Ghosts Ahoy.name: Ghosts Ahoy
Ghosts Ahoy.start: Talk to [[Velorina]] in [[Port Phasmatys]]. Can use a charter ship for a little over 1k gp in Port Sarim talking to [[Trader Stan]] on the southern-most dock.
Ghosts Ahoy.ironman: [[File:Ultimate_ironman_chat_badge.png]] [[Nettle tea]] and [[bucket of milk]] can be combined before the quest starts to save inventory space
Ghosts Ahoy.items:
* Some amount of [[Ecto-tokens]]:
** 31 [[Ecto-token]]s (20 with [[ring of charos (a)]])
** OR 25 Ecto-tokens (10 with ring) using [[charter ship]]s
** OR 1 bone, 1 pot, and 1 bucket for every 5 ecto-tokens required (see [[Ghosts_Ahoy#Pre-quest: obtaining ecto-tokens|Pre-quest]] for more info)
* ~400 [[Coins]]
* [[Ghostspeak amulet]]
* [[Bucket of milk]]
* [[Silk]]
* 3 colours of [[dye]] (The dye colours you will need are random. If you want to save a trip, have 3 [[Red dye|red]], 3 [[Blue dye|blue]], and 3 [[yellow dye]]s. That way, you can mix whatever colours you end up needing.)
*[[Spade]]
*[[Oak longbow]]
*[[Knife]] (can be purchased from the Canifis general store)
*[[Needle]] (can be purchased from the Canifis general store)
*[[Thread]] (can be purchased from the Canifis general store)
* One extra [[bucket of slime]] for colouring the bed sheet (can be purchased from a [[Charter ship]] crewmember at the port).
* [[Nettle tea]] (prepared ahead of time, within a bowl) ''or'' items to make nettle tea:
** A [[tinderbox]] and a [[log]] of which you have the [[Firemaking]] level to light. Tinderbox can be purchased from the general store during quest
**[[Gloves]] (must be closed fingered - [[Slayer gloves]], [[Ranger gloves]], [[Infinity gloves]], [[Moonclan gloves]], [[Granite gloves]], [[Lunar gloves]] and [[Beekeeper's gloves]] won't work)
**[[Nettles]] (can be obtained during the quest)
**[[Bowl of water]] (empty bowl can be purchased during quest -- the [[gold bowl]] won't work)
