The Giant Dwarf.requirements: * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 12 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 16 [[Firemaking]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 33 [[Magic]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 14 [[Thieving]] (boostable) (not required to start)
The Giant Dwarf.desc:
Five hundred years have passed since the rule of King Alvis, saviour of Keldagrim and victim of his own inventions.

He founded the Consortium: the gathering of Mining companies that were to serve the monarchy. But, eventually, the monarchy came to serve the Consortium.

By the time of his death, the monarchy was all but abolished. Now the Kings in Keldagrim are but a distant memory... with only the statue of King Alvis to remind the people of the old days, the dark days.

So begins the Rise of the Red Axe, the new multi-part storyline centred around the dwarves and their capital of Keldagrim. The first quest, The Giant Dwarf, introduces the city and the powerful business Consortium that rules the dwarven realm. Discover weird goings-on, narrowly escape from falling chunks of rock, ride around in minecarts and... make sure you don't bump into the wrong person on the way to the city!
The Giant Dwarf.name: The Giant Dwarf
The Giant Dwarf.start: The [[Keldagrim]] mines east of [[Rellekka]] and north of the [[Mountain Camp]]. Follow the dwarven statues to the underground river.
The Giant Dwarf.items:
* 200 [[coins]] for the clothes
* Means to cast [[Telekinetic Grab]] ([[air rune|air]] and [[law rune]])
* [[Logs]] (most logs will work, however, arctic pine, redwood & coloured logs do not work)
* [[Tinderbox]]
* [[Coal]] (obtainable during the quest with 30 [[Mining]])
* [[Iron bar]]
* 3 cut [[sapphire]]s 
* Various [[ores]] and [[bar]]s (mostly obtainable during the quest, see below)
* [[Redberry pie]] (unless you have previously given [[Thurgo]] a pie for free—outside the [[The Knight's Sword]] quest)

Goblin Diplomacy.desc: There's a disturbance in the Goblin Village. Help the goblins solve their dispute so the world doesn't have to worry about rioting goblins. Aim: to help the goblins decide which colour they will wear.
Goblin Diplomacy.name: Goblin Diplomacy
Goblin Diplomacy.start: Speak to [[General Bentnoze]] or [[General Wartface]] in [[Goblin Village]].
Goblin Diplomacy.items:
* 3 sets of [[Goblin mail]] (obtained during the quest)
* 1 [[Blue dye]] (or 2 [[woad leaves]] and 5 coins to obtain a blue dye from [[Aggie]])
** Offer 20 coins to [[Wyson the gardener]] and he will give you two woad leaves
* 1 [[Orange dye]] – created by combining [[red dye]] with [[yellow dye]]
** 1 [[Red dye]] (or 3 [[redberries]] and 5 coins to obtain a red dye from [[Aggie]])
** 1 [[Yellow dye]] (2 [[onion]]s and 5 coins to obtain a yellow dye from [[Aggie]])

The Golem.requirements: * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 20 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 25 [[Thieving]] (boostable) (not required to start)
The Golem.desc:
Deep in the desert stand the ruins of the once great city of Uzer, where a lone survivor, an ancient clay golem, forever paces back and forth. It is badly damaged, and its mind cannot rest until it has completed the task for which it was created.

It is up to you to uncover the secret of the lost city, and add the final chapter to a story started in the violence of the Third Age.
The Golem.name: The Golem
The Golem.start: Talk to the [[clay golem]] in the ruins of [[Uzer]], east of the [[Shantay Pass]] in the [[Kharidian Desert]].
The Golem.items:
* [[Vial]]
* [[Pestle and mortar]]
* [[Papyrus]] (can be bought from [[Ali Morrisane]] for 10gp)
* 4 [[soft clay]] (or a [[bracelet of clay]] and a [[pickaxe]] to mine north-west of the ruins)
* [[Phoenix feather]] (can be obtained north-west of the ruins)
* Means to enter the desert (such as the [[Shantay pass (item)|Shantay pass]], [[Teleport tablets]] or [[Teleport scrolls|scrolls]], [[Fairy rings]] or the [[Pharaoh's sceptre]])

The Grand Tree.requirements: * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 25 [[Agility]] (boostable) (not required to start) * The ability to defeat a level 172 [[Black demon (The Grand Tree)|Black demon]] (safespottable for Ranged and Magic or melee using a [[halberd]]).
The Grand Tree.desc: The [[Grand Tree]], which shelters the majority of the small gnome population of ''RuneScape'', is dying. Is it human sabotage or an inside job? Help [[King Shareen]] to find the true cause and save the tree gnomes from an uncertain fate.
The Grand Tree.kills: * [[Black demon (The Grand Tree)|Black demon]] ''(level 172)'' (can be safespotted)
The Grand Tree.name: The Grand Tree
The Grand Tree.start: Talk to [[King Narnode Shareen]] in the [[Grand Tree]].
The Grand Tree.items: * 1,000 [[coins]], unless you have helped [[Femi]] or completed [[Tree Gnome Village]] and plan to use spirit trees.

The Great Brain Robbery.requirements: *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 16 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) '"`UNIQ--ref-00000000-QINU`"' *[[File:Construction icon.png|link=Construction|alt=Construction]] 30 [[Construction]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Prayer icon.png|link=Prayer|alt=Prayer]] 50 [[Prayer]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *Must have completed the following quests: **[[Creature of Fenkenstrain]] **[[Cabin Fever]] ***[[Pirate's Treasure]] ***[[Rum Deal]] ****[[Priest in Peril]] ****[[Zogre Flesh Eaters]] *****[[Big Chompy Bird Hunting]] *****[[Jungle Potion]] ******[[Druidic Ritual]] **[[Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Pirate Pete]] ***[[Recipe for Disaster/Another Cook's Quest]] ****[[Cook's Assistant]] *Access to a [[player-owned house]] [[workshop]] and [[crafting table]] '''or''' the [[Grand Exchange]] *Be able to kill a level 190 monster that can disable [[Prayer]]s (can be safespotted without taking damage).
The Great Brain Robbery.desc: The peaceful contemplation of the monks of [[Harmony Island]] has been disturbed by such rude interruptions as an invasion of zombie pirates and the theft of their brains! The evil zombie pirates have returned with a new scheme, and it's up to you to try to re-mind these poor priests before the sinister [[Mi-Gor]] completes his experiments...
The Great Brain Robbery.name: The Great Brain Robbery
The Great Brain Robbery.items:
*[[Fishbowl helmet]]
*[[Diving apparatus]] ''(obtain these from [[Murphy]] in [[Port Khazard]] if you've lost them; talk to him 2 times, 1st time for helmet and 2nd time for apparatus.)''
*10 [[wooden cat]]s – partial completion of The Great Brain Robbery is required to make these yourself, however they are tradable and available at the [[Grand Exchange]]
**4 [[oak plank]]s, a [[hammer]], and a [[saw]] (if you are building your own [[crafting table 1|crafting table]] and do not already have one; build in the [[Clockmaking space]] of the [[Workshop]])
**10 [[plank]]s (if making your own wooden cats)
**10 pieces of fur: [[fur]], [[bear fur]] or [[grey wolf fur]] (if making your own wooden cats) ''(wolf fur can be obtained during quest by killing [[Canifis townsfolk]]. [[Baraek]] sells them for 20 gold each. Furs from [[Hunter]] monsters will not work)''
*A [[hammer]] (Note: [[Imcando hammer]] does not work)
*About 100 [[nails]] ''(38 are needed, but some—especially [[Bronze nails|bronze]] or [[Iron nails|iron]]—may bend)''
*8 normal [[plank]]s (18 if making the [[wooden cat]]s instead of buying them from the [[Grand Exchange]])
*[[Holy symbol]]
*[[Ring of charos]] ''(if lost, can be re-obtained during quest by pickpocketing [[Fenkenstrain]])''

Grim Tales.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[Witch's House]] *[[File:Farming icon.png|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 45 [[Farming]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 52 [[Herblore]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 58 [[Thieving]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 59 [[Agility]] (boostable) (not required to start) '"`UNIQ--ref-0000000E-QINU`"' *[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 71 [[Woodcutting]] (boostable) (not required to start) *Ability to defeat a level 138 cloud giant—[[Glod]]
Grim Tales.desc:
"Once upon a time in a land far, far away..." Sylas, a collector of items both wondrous and unusual seeks out the latest additions to his trove with a somewhat unusual prize for the finder.

Terrors and towers await; fierce battles with giant beasts; striding boldly to rescue a dwarf in distress! Not a quest for the meek or faint-hearted, prepare yourself for a feast of fairy-tale fun with rewards a-plenty! The Brothers Grimm could never have foretold a tale such as this...
Grim Tales.name: Grim Tales
Grim Tales.start: Talk to [[Sylas]] in [[Taverley]], just south of the [[Portal (Player-owned house)|house portal]].
Grim Tales.items:
*2 [[Tarromin potion (unf)]] ''or'' 2 [[vials of water]] and 2 [[tarromin]]s
*[[Seed dibber]] ([[Tool leprechaun|leprechaun]] is nearby). You will need this even with a partial completion of the [[Farming]] portion of the [[Barbarian Training]] [[miniquest]]
*[[Watering can]] with at least 1 dose (can also be stored with the leprechaun)
*Any [[axe]]
*[[Leather gloves]] (optional) (obtainable during quest)
*High healing [[food]]
*Good [[armour]] and a [[weapon]] ([[Ranged]] or [[Magic equipment]] recommended if you have low melee levels)

The Hand in the Sand.requirements: *[[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 17 [[Thieving]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 49 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (required to start)
The Hand in the Sand.desc: Bert the Sandman in Yanille is in a spot of bother. A [[Sandy hand|mysterious severed hand]] has appeared in his sand box. Help find out whose hand it is and, more to the point, how it got in Bert's sand box.
The Hand in the Sand.name: The Hand in the Sand
The Hand in the Sand.start: Talk to [[Bert]] in [[Yanille]], near the [[sand pit]].
The Hand in the Sand.ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png|Ultimate Ironman]] The player briefly visits [[Entrana]]. [[File:Ironman chat badge.png|Ironmen]] [[White berries]] (acquired by [[File:Farming icon.png|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 59 [[Farming]] (boostable), [[monster]] drops, [[cave crawler]]s are the easiest, or a spawn at the [[Wilderness]] [[Lava Dragon Isle]]. Alternatively, you can get them from Isafdar, north of the Elf Tracker. With 40 Agility they can also be obtained as a drop from [[Chaos druid warrior]] in the Yanille Agility Dungeon)
The Hand in the Sand.items:
*[[Beer]] (can be obtained during quest)
*About 150 [[coins]]
*1 empty [[vial]]
*[[Redberries]] (Purchasable during the quest from the [[Food Store]] in [[Port Sarim]])
*[[White berries]]
*[[Lantern lens]]
*5 [[earth rune]]s (can be bought from [[Betty]] for 20 gp)
*[[Bucket of sand]] (obtainable during quest if you bring a [[bucket]])

Haunted Mine.requirements: * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Priest in Peril]] * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 35 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (not required to start) * The ability to defeat a level 95 enemy * Access to [[Abandoned Mine]]
Haunted Mine.desc:
Recent forays into Morytania by some of Saradomin's more fanatical supporters have unearthed murky rumours concerning an abandoned mine in the south.

Legend speaks of an unusual material, hidden in the depths of the mines, that is somehow linked to the desolation and fear that now surrounds the place. Do you have the nerve to find out more, and enter the haunted mines of Morytania?
Haunted Mine.name: Haunted Mine
Haunted Mine.start: Speak to the [[Zealot]] at the mines in [[Morytania]] on the path to Mort'ton.
Haunted Mine.items:
* A [[chisel]] (can be acquired during the quest)
* A [[Zealot's Key]] (Pickpocket from Zealot)

Hazeel Cult.requirements: Able to defeat a level 13 cultist (this applies only if you're taking Ceril's side)
Hazeel Cult.desc: Discover the truth behind the Carnillean family fortune. Decide for yourself whether to aid the Carnilleans in retrieving stolen goods, or join the Hazeel cult members in their mission to resurrect the infamous Lord Hazeel.
Hazeel Cult.name: Hazeel Cult
Hazeel Cult.start: Central [[Ardougne]], south of [[King Lathas]]' [[Ardougne Castle|castle]]. Talk to [[Ceril Carnillean]].

The Heart of Darkness.requirements: *[[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 55 [[Mining]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 48 [[Thieving]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 48 [[Slayer]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 46 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (required to start) *Completion of the following quests: **[[Twilight's Promise]] ***[[Children of the Sun]]
The Heart of Darkness.desc: Uncover the secrets of a mysterious cult and unlock a new dungeon.
The Heart of Darkness.kills:
* Several [[Emissary Brawler]]s ''(levels 74 and 86)''
* Several [[Emissary Conjurer]]s ''(level 71)''
* [[Prince Itzla Arkan]] ''(level 167)''
* [[Amoxliatl]] ''(level 263)''
The Heart of Darkness.name: The Heart of Darkness
The Heart of Darkness.start: Speak to [[Prince Itzla Arkan]] at [[the Teomat]].
The Heart of Darkness.ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] You will need 3-4 empty inventory slots at multiple parts of the quest.

Heroes' Quest.requirements: * A partner * [[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] 55 [[Quest points]] (required to start) * [[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 53 [[Cooking]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Fishing icon.png|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 53 [[Fishing]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 25 [[Herblore]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 50 [[Mining]] (boostable) (not required to start) * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Shield of Arrav]] ** [[Lost City]] ** [[Merlin's Crystal]] ** [[Dragon Slayer I]]
Heroes' Quest.desc: Prove you are worthy to enter the Heroes' Guild. To prove your status as a hero you will need to obtain a number of items. There are many challenges standing between you and these items.
Heroes' Quest.kills:
* [[Ice Queen]] ''(level 111)'' (unless you already have Ice Gloves)
* [[Entrana firebird]] ''(level 2)''
* [[Jailer]] ''(level 47, optional)''
* [[Grip]] ''(level 22)'' (for Phoenix Gang members only)
Heroes' Quest.name: Heroes' Quest
Heroes' Quest.start: Speak to [[Achietties]] by the entrance to the [[Heroes' Guild]], between [[Taverley]] and [[Burthorpe]].
Heroes' Quest.ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The player briefly visits [[Entrana]].
Heroes' Quest.items:
* [[Ice gloves]] (obtainable during the quest) or [[Smiths gloves (i)]]
* [[Fishing rod]] (obtainable during the quest)
* [[Fishing bait]] (obtainable during the quest)
* [[Dusty key]] (obtainable during the quest; if travelling to [[Taverley Dungeon]] for the [[lava eel]], without 70 [[Agility]]) '''OR''' a [[knife]] or [[slash weapon]] (if travelling to the [[Lava Maze]] for the [[lava eel]])
* [[Harralander potion (unf)]] (or a [[harralander]] and a [[vial of water]])
* [[Pickaxe]]
'''If you are a [[Black Arm Gang]] member''' (Note: If you are returning to the mansion after the quest to help another player, you do not need the black armour anymore):
* [[Black full helm]]
* [[Black platebody]]
* [[Black platelegs]]
'''If you are a [[Phoenix Gang]] member:'''
* Some form of [[Ranged]] or [[Magic]] attack method (if using a [[Toxic Blowpipe]] make sure it is set to Longrange)

His Faithful Servants.desc: The Strange Old Man at the Barrows in Morytania has been acting even stranger than usual...
His Faithful Servants.kills:
* [[Verac the Defiled]] (level 115)
* [[Dharok the Wretched]] (level 115)
* [[Ahrim the Blighted]] (level 98)
* [[Torag the Corrupted]] (level 115)
* [[Karil the Tainted]] (level 98)
* [[Guthan the Infested]] (level 115)
His Faithful Servants.name: His Faithful Servants
His Faithful Servants.start: Speak to the [[Strange Old Man]] wandering in the [[Barrows]], east of [[Mort'ton]].
His Faithful Servants.items:
* Combat equipment to defeat the [[Barrows Brothers]]
* [[Spade]]

Holy Grail.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[Merlin's Crystal]] *[[File:Attack icon.png|link=Attack|alt=Attack]] 20 [[Attack]] (not boostable) (not required to start) *Must be able to defeat a level 120 [[Black Knight Titan]] (can be [[safespot]]ted or [[flinch]]ed)
Holy Grail.desc: King Arthur is sending out his knights on a quest for the famous Holy Grail. If you are a Knight of the Round Table go to King Arthur for further orders.
Holy Grail.name: Holy Grail
Holy Grail.ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The player briefly visits [[Entrana]].

Hopespear's Will.requirements: * Started [[The Restless Ghost]] * Completion of [[Desert Treasure I]] * Completion of [[Fairytale II - Cure a Queen]] * Completion of [[Land of the Goblins]] * [[File:Prayer icon.png|link=Prayer|alt=Prayer]] 50 [[Prayer]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]])
Hopespear's Will.desc: Help an old goblin spirit return the remains of his successors to the lost goblin homeland.
Hopespear's Will.name: Hopespear's Will
Hopespear's Will.start: Speak to [[Hopespear]] in the crypt of the [[Goblin Temple]].
Hopespear's Will.items:
* [[Ghostspeak amulet]]
* [[Ring of visibility]] or [[Ring of shadows]]
* [[Goblin potion]]
* [[Dramen staff|Dramen]] or [[lunar staff]] (unless the [[Lumbridge & Draynor Diary]] has been fully completed)
* Food and potions to defeat 5 enemies without armour, weapons, or magic

Horror from the Deep.requirements: * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 35 [[Agility]] (boostable) (not required to start) * Completion of [[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] [[Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl]]
Horror from the Deep.desc:
The lighthouse protecting Kandarin's north-western coastline has mysteriously stopped operating, and contact with the lighthouse keeper Jossik has been lost.

The Council would greatly appreciate it if somebody could discover for them what has happened to this most vital landscape feature.
Horror from the Deep.kills:
* [[Dagannoth]] ''(level 100)''  ''(can be completely safespotted)'' 
* [[Dagannoth Mother]] ''(level 100)''  ''(can no longer be 100% safespotted - ensure you can protect yourself from ranged attacks if nothing else)''
Horror from the Deep.name: Horror from the Deep
Horror from the Deep.start: Speak with [[Larrissa]], who is outside the [[Lighthouse]], north of [[Barbarian Outpost]].
Horror from the Deep.items:
*[[Fire rune]]
*[[Air rune]]
*[[Water rune]]
*[[Earth rune]]
*Any [[sword]] or [[longsword]] that you are willing to lose (except [[rusty sword]] and [[prop sword]])
*Any [[arrow]] (except [[ogre arrows]] and [[training arrows]])
*[[Molten glass]]
*[[Tinderbox]]
*[[Hammer]]
* 60 [[steel nails]]
* 2 regular [[plank]]s (can be obtained from [[Barbarian Outpost]])
*[[Swamp tar]]
*Means to deal melee and ranged damage
*Means to deal damage with [[air spell|air]], [[water spell|water]], [[earth spell|earth]] and [[fire spells]]

Icthlarin's Little Helper.requirements: * Completion of [[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] [[Gertrude's Cat]] * The ability to defeat a level 91 monster.
Icthlarin's Little Helper.desc:
In the deep south of the desert, unrest is brewing... The cities of the [[Menaphites]] have barred their gates to all. An unsettling desert wanderer may know of a secret entrance though, to [[Sophanem]] - the city of the dead.

Will you become Icthlarin's Little Helper by entering? Enter into a titanic struggle for the soul of the high priest of Icthlarin in a land where the cat is top dog.
Icthlarin's Little Helper.kills:
* [[Possessed Priest]] ''(level 91)''
* One of the level 75–81 guardians (randomly chosen):
** [[Apmeken (monster)|Apmeken]] ''(level 75)''—uses [[Magic]]
** [[Crondis (monster)|Crondis]] ''(level 75)''—uses Magic
** [[Scabaras (monster)|Scabaras]] ''(level 75)''—uses [[Melee]]
** [[Het (monster)|Het]] ''(level 81)''—uses Melee
Icthlarin's Little Helper.name: Icthlarin's Little Helper
Icthlarin's Little Helper.start: Speak to the [[wanderer]] in the camp west of the [[Agility Pyramid]].
Icthlarin's Little Helper.items:
* [[cat|Regular]] or [[overgrown cat|overgrown cat]], [[hellcat]] or [[kitten]]. No food is required as the kitten can stay in your inventory for the most part, or automatically go in/out of your inventory.
* [[Tinderbox]]
* [[Willow log]]
* [[Bag of salt]] (can be bought from any [[Slayer Master]], other players, or the [[Grand Exchange]]) '''or''' an empty [[bucket]] to obtain a [[pile of salt]] in Sophanem
* [[Bucket of sap]] (use a [[knife]] on an [[evergreen tree]] or a regular tree with the description "a commonly found tree" with a bucket in your inventory)
* Full [[waterskin]] to give away (can be bought for 30 coins at Shantay pass)
* [[Linen]] (Can be bought on The Grand Exchange or bought from [[Raetul]] in Sophanem for 30 coins during the quest)
* Means to enter the desert. (Such as the [[Shantay pass (item)|Shantay pass]], [[Teleport tablets]] or [[Teleport scrolls|scrolls]], [[Fairy rings]] or the [[Pharaoh's sceptre]])

Imp Catcher.desc: The Wizard Grayzag has summoned hundreds of little imps. They have stolen a lot of things belonging to the Wizard Mizgog including his magic beads.
Imp Catcher.name: Imp Catcher
Imp Catcher.start: Speak to [[Wizard Mizgog]] on the top floor of the [[Wizards' Tower]].

In Aid of the Myreque.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[In Search of the Myreque]] ***[[Nature Spirit]] ****[[Priest in Peril]] ****[[The Restless Ghost]] *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 25 [[Agility]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 25 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 15 [[Mining]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 7 [[Magic]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]])
In Aid of the Myreque.desc:
After the attack on the Myreque by Vanstrom Klause and with the deaths of both Sani and Harold, Veliaf is counting on you to help. Now that the Myreque freedom fighters' base camp has been revealed, they'll need to move on and set up base somewhere else.

Veliaf has heard of a little known village south of Mort'ton, referred to as 'Burgh de Rott'. This could be just the place to set up operations to strike back against the evil of Lowerniel Vergidiyad Drakan and his Vampyric overlordship in Morytania. And who knows what other secrets about Morytania and its dark past will be revealed?
In Aid of the Myreque.kills:
*[[Gadderanks]] ''(level 35)''
*2 [[Vampyre Juvinate]]s ''(level 54)''
*2 [[Vampyre Juvinate]]s ''(level 75)'' '''or''' 4 level 50s depending on route taken
In Aid of the Myreque.name: In Aid of the Myreque
In Aid of the Myreque.start: Go to [[Canifis]] and down the ladder behind the pub there, through the secret wall and squeeze past the stalagmite on the east side of the cave. Speak to [[Veliaf Hurtz]].
In Aid of the Myreque.ironman: * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 50 [[Smithing]] (boostable) or obtaining [[Mithril bar]] as a drop.
In Aid of the Myreque.items:
*A [[Silver weaponry|silver weapon]] to damage vampyres, which includes:
** A [[Silver sickle (b)|blessed silver sickle]] (obtained during [[Nature Spirit]])
** A [[Silver sickle|normal silver sickle]]
** A [[blessed axe]] (obtained during [[Animal Magnetism]])
** A [[wolfbane dagger]] (obtained during [[Priest in Peril]], which is a prerequisite for this quest)
** [[Silverlight|Silver-]], [[Darklight|Dark-]], [[Arclight]] or [[Emberlight]]
** Any weapon whilst wearing an [[Efaritay's aid]]

*[[Food]]
*A [[spade]]
*A [[bucket]] (up to 5 recommended)
*Any [[pickaxe]]
*A [[hammer]]
*11 [[plank]]s (Only regular planks will work.)
*44 [[nails]] (42 are obtainable during the quest)
*[[Swamp paste]]
*10 [[raw mackerel]] or 10 [[Snail meat]]s (depending on what is asked)
*10 [[bronze axe]]s
*4 [[tinderbox]]es
*2 [[steel bar]]s
*[[Coal]]
*[[Soft clay]]
*[[Rope]]
*A [[silver bar]]
*A [[mithril bar]]
*A [[sapphire]]
*On the [[standard spellbook]] for [[Lvl-1 Enchant]]:
**A [[cosmic rune]]
**A [[water rune]]
*Optional to give to [[Ivan Strom]] ('''''Strongly'' recommended if you don't have a high [[combat level]]''' 85+):
**A [[steel med helm]]
**A [[steel chainbody]]
**[[Steel platelegs]]
**A [[silver sickle]]
**15 cooked [[salmon]], [[snail]]s, [[Cooked slimy eel|slimy eel]]s, or [[stew]]

In Search of Knowledge.requirements: None - but a high [[combat level]] is recommended.
In Search of Knowledge.desc: Assist [[Brother Aimeri]] in uncovering the mysteries that lie in the [[Forthos Dungeon]].
In Search of Knowledge.name: In Search of Knowledge
In Search of Knowledge.start: [[Brother Aimeri]], towards the south-eastern end of the [[Forthos Dungeon]].
In Search of Knowledge.items:
* [[Combat equipment]]
* 5 pieces of food (must be meat, fish or vegetables)
* A [[slash weapon]] or [[knife]] to cut through webs

In Search of the Myreque.requirements: * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Nature Spirit]] *** [[Priest in Peril]] *** [[The Restless Ghost]] * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 25 [[Agility]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * The ability to defeat a level 97 foe ([[safespot]]table)
In Search of the Myreque.desc: Canifis is experiencing an upsurge in new faces and a new stranger has appeared with a job to track down some local heroes known only as "The Myreque". The Myreque are fighting a desperate battle against the darkness of Morytania and he wishes to take them weapons to aid in the battle. Can you help him out?
In Search of the Myreque.name: In Search of the Myreque
In Search of the Myreque.start: Speak to [[Vanstrom Klause]] at the [[Hair of the Dog]] tavern in [[Canifis]].
In Search of the Myreque.items:
* A [[steel longsword]]
* 2 [[steel sword]]s
* A [[steel mace]]
* A [[steel warhammer]]
* A [[steel dagger]]
* 225 [[steel nails]]
*:'''Note:''' It takes 9 [[steel bar]]s to make all of steel items required (excluding nails, which can be purchased at the [[Sawmill]]; including nails, the amount is 24 steel bars). 39 [[Smithing]] is needed to smith these steel items. To make it a bit easier to obtain these as an Ironman, one can buy the two swords, longsword, and dagger from the [[Varrock Swordshop]], mace from [[Flynn's Mace Market]] in Falador and the warhammer from Keldagrim's [[Vigr's Warhammers]].
* A [[Druid pouch]] containing at least 5 charges
*:'''Note:''' The pouch takes 3 per fill (need 6 [[Mort myre fungus]] or 3 [[Mort myre pear]] or [[Mort myre stem]] to have enough charges).
* A [[hammer]] or [[Imcando hammer]]
* 6 [[plank]]s
* 10 [[coins]] ''or'' a [[ring of charos (a)]]

Into the Tombs.desc:
Long ago, the people of the Kharidian Desert lived prosperous, luxurious lives, under the watchful eyes of their beloved gods.

All that changed when Amascut, the Goddess of Rebirth, became corrupted. She was reborn as The Devourer, intent on consuming every living soul in existence.

Deep within the desert, an ancient tomb has long hidden a great power – and The Devourer is determined to harness it at any cost.

If she succeeds, all hope is lost. You must traverse the tomb's many obstacles and foil her evil plans... before it's too late.
Into the Tombs.kills:
* '''Note:''' This section assumes the raid level is 0 (no invocations).
* [[Akkha]] (level 337)
* [[Ba-Ba]] (level 359)
* [[Kephri]] (level 341)
* [[Zebak]] (level 371)
* [[Tumeken's Warden]] (level 489)
* [[Elidinis' Warden]] (level 489)
Into the Tombs.name: Into the Tombs
Into the Tombs.start: Talk to [[Maisa]] inside [[Jaltevas Pyramid|Osmumten's tomb]] at the [[Necropolis]].

Jungle Potion.requirements: * Completion of [[Druidic Ritual]] * [[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 3 [[Herblore]] (boostable) (not required to start) * The ability to defend against level 53 [[Jogre]]s and level 46 [[Harpie Bug Swarm]]s.
Jungle Potion.desc: [[Trufitus Shakaya]] of the [[Tai Bwo Wannai Village]] requires that you collect five special jungle herbs for a potion so he can commune with his Gods.
Jungle Potion.name: Jungle Potion

King's Ransom.requirements: *[[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 45 [[Magic]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Defence icon.png|link=Defence|alt=Defence]] 65 [[Defence]] (not boostable) (required to start) *Completion of the following quests: **[[Black Knights' Fortress]] **[[Holy Grail]] ***[[Merlin's Crystal]] **[[Murder Mystery]] **[[One Small Favour]] ***[[Rune Mysteries]] ***[[Shilo Village]] ****[[Jungle Potion]] *****[[Druidic Ritual]]
King's Ransom.desc:
Life has been quiet at the Sinclair Mansion since you discovered the murderer... too quiet. So quiet, in fact, that the family has gone!

Suspicions are running high that the Sinclairs' recent departure is tied to the disappearance of King Arthur and his knights. But time is running short and clues are scarce, will you crack the case in time?
King's Ransom.name: King's Ransom
King's Ransom.items:
*[[Granite]] (any size)
*[[Telekinetic Grab]] runes (1 [[air rune]] and 1 [[law rune]]) (can be obtained during the quest)
*Full [[black armour]] ([[Black full helm]], [[Black platebody|platebody]], and [[Black platelegs|platelegs]]/[[Black plateskirt|plateskirt]])—'''Note:''' Trimmed versions of black armour will work. (h) versions will '''not''' work
*A [[bronze med helm]] (can be purchased from [[Peksa]]'s [[Helmet Shop.]] in the [[Barbarian Village]], or picked up inside [[Draynor Manor]] near the exit)
*An [[Iron chainbody]] (Both the [[Iron Chainbody]] and the [[Bronze med helm]] can be bought upstairs in the [[Warrior Guild Armoury]]. If you can't access the [[Warriors' Guild]] you can get an [[Iron Chainbody]] from [[Wayne's Chains]] in Southern [[Falador]], [[Horvik's Armour Shop]] in central [[Varrock]], or the [[Grand Exchange]])
*[[Animate rock scroll]] (obtainable during the quest). Note: if you have it in your bank, either destroy it or take it with you. You won't be able to receive another from [[Wizard Cromperty]] otherwise.

A Kingdom Divided.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[The Depths of Despair]] **[[The Queen of Thieves]] **[[The Ascent of Arceuus]] **[[The Forsaken Tower]] **[[Tale of the Righteous]] **The above quests all require the following quests to be completed: ***[[Client of Kourend]] ****[[X Marks the Spot]] *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 54 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 52 [[Thieving]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 52 [[Woodcutting]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 50 [[Herblore]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 42 [[Mining]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 38 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 35 [[Magic]] (not boostable) (required to start)
A Kingdom Divided.desc:
Great Kourend: a land of wealth, comfort and security. Across its five cities, the people of this Kingdom work to bring peace and prosperity. However, all is not as it seems. Beneath this delicate façade lies an uncomfortable truth: the kingdom of Great Kourend is A Kingdom Divided.

Since the death of the last king, [[Great Kourend]] has been ruled by the [[Kourend Council]]. Under the watchful gaze of the Council, Kourend has enjoyed a golden age of progression. But not all of its citizens are happy, and, spurred by the recent arrest of Councillor [[Sophia Hughes]], allegations of corruption are growing.

However, the political games of the Council may be the least of Kourend's concerns. A darker power is gathering in the Kingdom - one that could change the face of Gielinor forever...
A Kingdom Divided.kills:
* [[Judge of Yama]] (Level 168)
* 2 [[Assassin (A Kingdom Divided)|Assassins]] (Level 132)
* [[Lizardman brute]] (Level 75)
* [[Xamphur]] (level 239)
* [[Barbarian Warlord]] (Level 91)
A Kingdom Divided.name: A Kingdom Divided
A Kingdom Divided.start: Speak to [[Martin Holt]] at the entrance to [[Kourend Castle]] in [[Kingstown]].
A Kingdom Divided.items:
* Normal spellbook, and runes to cast a [[Fire spells|fire spell]] ([[fire bolt]] or better)
* Any [[axe]]
* A [[defence potion]] (3 or 4 doses)
* [[Volcanic sulphur]]
* [[Molten glass]]
* A [[dark essence block]] or a [[pickaxe]] and [[chisel]] (the latter is found at the mine) to obtain one

The Knight's Sword.requirements: * [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 10 [[Mining]] (boostable) (not required to start) * The ability to run from [[combat level|level]] 57 [[ice warrior]]s and level 53 [[ice giant]]s could help.
The Knight's Sword.desc: Sir Vyvin's squire is in trouble. He has accidentally lost Sir Vyvin's ceremonial sword. Help him find a replacement without Sir Vyvin finding out.
The Knight's Sword.name: The Knight's Sword
The Knight's Sword.start: Speak to the [[squire]] in the courtyard of the [[White Knights' Castle]] in [[Falador]].
The Knight's Sword.ironman: * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 15 [[Smithing]] (not needed if obtaining iron bar from drops) * [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 15 [[Mining]] (not needed if obtaining iron bar from drops) * [[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 10 [[Cooking]] (Pie dish can be found easily in the kitchen of Varrock Palace, and can be cooked there as well. Best to come here after speaking to [[Reldo]]) or partial completion of [[Perilous Moons]] to purchase a Redberry pie from [[Yarnio]] For ironmen to obtain the iron bars, head to the trees located in level 18 Wilderness next to the bears west of the Graveyard of Shadows. A safer alternative is to kill [[dwarf|dwarves]] in the mines under Falador. For [[Members]] accounts that wish to avoid combat entirely, there is an iron bar that spawns inside [[Thurid's Brain Buckets]]. This requires completion of the [[Children of the Sun]] quest in order to gain access to [[Varlamore]].
The Knight's Sword.items:
* [[Redberry pie]] (not [[half a redberry pie]]), (Members can purchase one from [[Romily Weaklax]] in the [[Cooks' Guild]])
* 2 [[iron bar]]s (4 if you want your own [[blurite sword]]) (one spawns west of the [[Graveyard of Shadows]] in the [[Wilderness]])
* [[Blurite ore]] (2 if you want your own blurite sword; it is obtained/obtainable during the quest) (If you plan on doing Falador easy diary AND making a second sword, mine a third blurite ore [members only])
** Any [[pickaxe]] (one spawns in south Falador)

Lair of Tarn Razorlor.requirements: *[[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 40 [[Slayer]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *The [[Haunted Mine]] quest is required to access [[Tarn's Lair]].
Lair of Tarn Razorlor.desc: This miniquest is to kill [[Tarn Razorlor]] and retrieve his diary. Using his diary on a [[salve amulet]] will enchant it increasing its attack and strength bonuses by 5%.
Lair of Tarn Razorlor.kills: Level 69 mutant [[Tarn]], followed by a level 69 ghost [[Tarn]]
Lair of Tarn Razorlor.name: Lair of Tarn Razorlor
Lair of Tarn Razorlor.start: Enter the Lair of Tarn Razorlor.
Lair of Tarn Razorlor.items: *100 [[coins]] required each time you use the banker [[Odovacar]] (optional)

Land of the Goblins.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[Another Slice of H.A.M.]] ***[[Death to the Dorgeshuun]] ****[[The Lost Tribe]] *****[[Goblin Diplomacy]] *****[[Rune Mysteries]] ***[[The Giant Dwarf]] ***[[The Dig Site]] **[[Fishing Contest]] *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 38 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Fishing icon.png|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 40 [[Fishing]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 45 [[Thieving]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 48 [[Herblore]] (not boostable) (required to start)
Land of the Goblins.desc: The most ancient goblin legends speak of Yu'biusk, the far-off land that saw the origin of the goblin race. Now, one goblin has had a vision of this land and believes it is Zanik's destiny to lead all goblins to live there in peace and safety - but Zanik will not be able to realise her destiny without your help.
Land of the Goblins.name: Land of the Goblins
Land of the Goblins.ironman: * [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The player needs to unequip all items in addition to carrying the required items.
Land of the Goblins.items:
* A [[Light sources#Light sources|light source]]
* [[Toadflax potion (unf)]]
* [[Goblin mail]] (obtainable during quest)
* [[Yellow dye]]
* [[Blue dye]]
* [[Orange dye]]
* [[Purple dye]]
* [[Black dye]] ([[black mushroom]] obtainable during quest)
** An empty [[vial]] and a [[pestle and mortar]] if making the black dye during the quest
* [[Fishing rod]] ([[Oily fishing rod]] will not work)
* [[Raw slimy eel]]
* 5 [[coins]]

Legends' Quest.requirements: '''Note:''' Only the Quest points requirement must be met to start this quest. If you do not have the skill requirements, you may be unable to continue at certain points until you meet them. * [[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] 107 [[Quest points]] (required to start) * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 50 [[Agility]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 50 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 45 [[Herblore]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 56 [[Magic]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 52 [[Mining]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Prayer icon.png|link=Prayer|alt=Prayer]] 42 [[Prayer]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 50 [[Smithing]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Strength icon.png|link=Strength|alt=Strength]] 50 [[Strength]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 50 [[Thieving]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 50 [[Woodcutting]] (boostable) (not required to start) * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Family Crest]] ** [[Heroes' Quest]] *** [[Shield of Arrav]] *** [[Lost City]] *** [[Merlin's Crystal]] *** [[Dragon Slayer I]] ** [[Shilo Village]] *** [[Jungle Potion]] **** [[Druidic Ritual]] ** [[Underground Pass]] *** [[Biohazard]] **** [[Plague City]] ** [[Waterfall Quest]] * The ability to defeat a level 187 demon
Legends' Quest.desc: Only the elite are allowed to call themselves a Legend of ''RuneScape''. Do you have what it takes to make it into the guild?
Legends' Quest.kills:
* [[Ranalph Devere]] ''(level 92)'' — 2 times
* [[Irvig Senay]] ''(level 100)'' — 2 times
* [[San Tojalon]] ''(level 106)'' — 2 times
* [[Nezikchened]] ''(level 187)'' — 3 times
Legends' Quest.name: Legends' Quest
Legends' Quest.start: Talk to the [[Legends' Guard]]s just outside of the [[Legends' Guild]].
Legends' Quest.items:
* Any [[machete (weapon)|machete]] (can be obtained during the quest - a regular one can be found by searching the cupboards next to [[Radimus Erkle]])
* 2 [[gold bar]]s (6 in case you fail or want more [[gold bowl]]s)
* [[Hammer]]
* [[Rope]]
* [[rune axe|Rune]], [[dragon axe|Dragon]] or [[Infernal axe]]
* [[Lockpick]] (2 in case you fail) ([[Strange old lockpick]] does not work)
* [[Pickaxe]]
* [[Vial of water]]
* [[Ardrigal]] (obtainable during the quest)
* [[Snake weed]] (obtainable during the quest)
* One of each cut gem up to diamond:
** [[Sapphire]]
** [[Emerald]]
** [[Ruby]]
** [[Diamond]]
** [[Opal]]
** [[Jade]]
** [[Red topaz]]
* [[Soul rune]]
* [[Mind rune]]
* 2 [[law runes]]
* [[Earth rune]]
* [[Unpowered orb]] and runes to cast any [[Charge Orb]] once (requires the [[standard spellbook]] equipped - two casts are needed if taking the "long path" during the second fight with the demon)
* [[Charcoal]] (2-3 in case it breaks -- obtainable during the quest if travelling via Shilo Village)
* 3 [[Papyrus]] (4-5 in case one is torn -- obtainable during the quest if travelling via Shilo Village or from the spawn on Radimus's desk)

Lost City.requirements: *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 31 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 36 [[Woodcutting]] (boostable) (not required to start) *Ability to kill a level 101 [[Tree spirit (Lost City)|Tree spirit]] with limited [[armour]] and [[weapons]].
Lost City.desc: Can you find the legendary lost city of [[Zanaris]]?
Lost City.kills:
* [[Tree spirit (Lost City)|Tree Spirit]] ''(level 101)'' (Safespottable)  
* Multiple [[Zombie (Entrana Dungeon)|Zombies]] ''(level 25)'' (for a [[bronze axe]])
Lost City.name: Lost City
Lost City.start: Go to [[Lumbridge Swamp]]. Talk to the campers there.
Lost City.ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The player is required to go to [[Entrana]].
Lost City.items:
* [[Knife]]
* [[Woodcutting]] [[axe]] (you will need to bank the axe before accessing [[Entrana]] -- you cannot use a blessed axe)

The Lost Tribe.requirements: * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Goblin Diplomacy]] ** [[Rune Mysteries]] * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 13 [[Agility]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 13 [[Thieving]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 17 [[Mining]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]])
The Lost Tribe.desc:
Sigmund is the advisor to the Duke of Lumbridge, but the duke does not always take his advice.

When part of the cellar wall collapses the duke insists the damage was caused by an earthquake, but Sigmund is worried about a monster attack.

If you investigate this mystery it will lead you through treacherous caves to uncover something lost by the Gods for thousands of years.
The Lost Tribe.name: The Lost Tribe
The Lost Tribe.items:
* [[Pickaxe]]
* [[Light source]] ('''Note:''' [[Candle]]s, [[torch]]es and [[oil lamp]]s can cause [[swamp gas]] explosions if going off-route, and need a tinderbox to stay lit)

Lunar Diplomacy.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: ** [[The Fremennik Trials]] ** [[Lost City]] ** [[Rune Mysteries]] ** [[Shilo Village]] *** [[Jungle Potion]] **** [[Druidic Ritual]] *[[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 5 [[Herblore]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 61 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Defence icon.png|link=Defence|alt=Defence]] 40 [[Defence]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 49 [[Firemaking]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 65 [[Magic]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 60 [[Mining]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 55 [[Woodcutting]] (not boostable) (required to start) *The ability to kill multiple level 111 monsters. *Access to each of the elemental [[runic altars]] ([[Air Altar|Air]], [[Fire Altar|Fire]], [[Water Altar|Water]], [[Earth Altar|Earth]])
Lunar Diplomacy.desc: Can you make it to Moonclan Island and make peace between the Moonclan and the Fremenniks?
Lunar Diplomacy.name: Lunar Diplomacy
Lunar Diplomacy.start: Speak to [[Lokar Searunner]] at the westernmost dock of [[Rellekka]].
Lunar Diplomacy.items:
*A [[tinderbox]]
*A few [[coins]] (1,000 is enough)
*A [[guam leaf]] (common drop from a [[Suqah]] during the quest)
*A [[marrentill]] (common drop from a Suqah during the quest)
*A [[pestle and mortar]]
*A [[hammer]]
*2 spools of [[thread]] (obtainable during quest)
*A [[needle]] (obtainable during quest)
*Any [[axe]] (bronze axe obtainable during quest)
*Any [[pickaxe]]
*A [[spade]]
*A finished [[bullseye lantern]] ('''NOT [[bullseye lantern (unf)|(unf)]] NOR [[bullseye lantern (empty)|(empty)]]'''. If you cannot obtain one, bring means to get to a [[lamp oil still]] instead. [[Swamp tar]] can be obtained during the quest.)
*All elemental talismans or their respective tiaras ([[Air talisman|Air]], [[Water talisman|Water]], [[Earth talisman|Earth]] and [[Fire talisman|Fire]], or an [[Elemental talisman]]), or access to the [[Abyss]], or the [[Guardians of the Rift]] minigame
*A [[dramen staff]]
*[[Combat]] equipment

Mage Arena I.requirements: *[[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 60 [[Magic]] (not boostable) (required to start)
Mage Arena I.kills: [[Kolodion#Demon|Kolodion]] in the form of a [[Black Demon]] (level 112)
Mage Arena I.name: Mage Arena I
Mage Arena I.start: Speak to [[Kolodion]] at the [[Mage Arena]] bank located in level 53 [[Wilderness]].
Mage Arena I.ironman: '''Warning:''' [[File:Hardcore ironman chat badge.png]] This quest requires travel to the deep, level 56 [[Wilderness]]. Caution must be taken not only getting to the arena but also during the [[miniquest]]. [[Player-killers]] are able to attack you while you are doing the minigame fight.
Mage Arena I.items:
*Runes or a [[powered staff]] to fight [[Kolodion]]
*Something to cut webs ([[knife]], [[slash weapon]] or any [[Wilderness sword]])

Mage Arena II.requirements: *Completion of [[Mage Arena I]] *[[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 75 [[Magic]] (not boostable) (required to start) *Cast [[Claws of Guthix]], [[Flames of Zamorak]], and [[Saradomin Strike]] each 100 times inside the Mage Arena.
Mage Arena II.desc: Can you defeat the followers of the gods?
Mage Arena II.name: Mage Arena II
Mage Arena II.start: Speak to [[Kolodion]] at the [[Mage Arena]] bank located in level 53 [[Wilderness]].
Mage Arena II.ironman: '''Warning:''' [[File:Hardcore ironman chat badge.png]] This quest requires travel to the deep, level 56 Wilderness, and can require travel through various multi-combat Wilderness areas as well. Beware of Player-killers at all times.
Mage Arena II.items:
*[[God staves]]
*Runes to cast [[god spells]] ([[Air rune|air]], [[Fire rune|fire]], and [[Blood rune|blood]])
*Item to cut webs ([[knife]], [[slash weapon]] or any [[Wilderness sword]])

Making Friends with My Arm.requirements: *[[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 66 [[Firemaking]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 72 [[Mining]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Construction icon.png|link=Construction|alt=Construction]] 35 [[Construction]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 68 [[Agility]] (boostable) (not required to start) *It is beneficial to have a higher [[Agility]] level. *Completion of the following quests: **[[My Arm's Big Adventure]] ***[[Eadgar's Ruse]] ****[[Druidic Ritual]] ****[[Troll Stronghold]] *****[[Death Plateau]] ***[[The Feud]] ***[[Jungle Potion]] **[[Swan Song]] ***[[One Small Favour]] ****[[Rune Mysteries]] ****[[Shilo Village]] ***[[Garden of Tranquillity]] ****[[Creature of Fenkenstrain]] *****[[Priest in Peril]] *****[[The Restless Ghost]] **[[Cold War]] **[[Romeo & Juliet]]
Making Friends with My Arm.desc:
My Arm, the troll from ''My Arm's Big Adventure'', must embark on another journey of discovery. This time, you'll be escorting him to Weiss, a newly discovered troll town in the far north of the world, so he can share his wisdom ''*cough*'' with the inhabitants, in exchange for learning about their inventions.

Life's journeys can take us to some strange places, but My Arm is about to face the greatest adventure of all - true love. Plus, they'd like him to kill the Wise Old Man of Draynor Village, which doesn't sound like a clever move. Can you help My Arm get a grip on the situation and woo the fair Snowflake over the objections of her father, Mother? Or will My Arm be left to a loveless life of loneliness?
Making Friends with My Arm.name: Making Friends with My Arm
Making Friends with My Arm.start: Talk to [[Burntmeat]] in the [[Troll Stronghold (location)|Troll Stronghold's]] kitchen.
Making Friends with My Arm.items:
*[[Saw]]
*[[Bolt of cloth]]
*5 [[mahogany plank]]s
*[[Cadava berries]]
*[[Bucket of water]] (obtainable during quest)
*[[Rope]] (obtainable during quest)
*[[Pickaxe]] (obtainable during quest)
*[[Hammer]] (obtainable during quest)
*[[Combat equipment]] (preferably [[Melee]] or [[Ranged]])
*[[Climbing boots]] (if not using Trollheim teleports)

Making History.requirements:
*Completion of the following quests:
**[[Priest in Peril]]
**[[The Restless Ghost]]
Making History.desc: A secluded outpost has served the City of Ardougne for generations, playing stage to many exceptional events. Its current occupant wants to employ your skills to construct its true history before time runs out and history itself is wiped away!
Making History.name: Making History
Making History.start: Talk to [[Jorral]] in the [[outpost]] north-west of [[West Ardougne]].
Making History.ironman: *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 24 [[Crafting]] (if making own [[sapphire amulet (u)]])
Making History.items:
*[[Spade]]
*[[Sapphire amulet]]
*[[Ghostspeak amulet]] or [[Morytania legs 2]] or higher
*A way to enter [[Port Phasmatys]]
**Completion of [[Ghosts Ahoy]] ''or''
**2 [[ecto-token]] ''or''
**1 [[bone]], 1 [[pot]] and 1 [[bucket]] to earn 5 ecto-tokens (you still only need two) ''or''
**4,100 gold for a [[Charter ship]] to [[Port Phasmatys]] (cheaper depending upon where you travel from and if you use [[ring of charos]]).

Meat and Greet.requirements:
* Completion of the following quests:
** [[Children of the Sun]]
Meat and Greet.desc: Bring the joy of kebabs to the land of Varlamore.
Meat and Greet.name: Meat and Greet
Meat and Greet.start: Talk to [[Emelio]] at his home in [[Outer Fortis]].

Merlin's Crystal.requirements:
Must be able to defeat a level 39 enemy.
You do not need to have an attack level of 20 to free Merlin, you can 'Use' Excalibur on the crystal to free him.
Merlin's Crystal.desc: The wizard [[Merlin]] has been trapped in a magical crystal by the witch [[Morgan Le Faye]]. So far, King Arthur hasn't been able to figure out how to free his mentor from his crystal prison. Can you help?
Merlin's Crystal.name: Merlin's Crystal
Merlin's Crystal.items:
*[[Bread]]
*[[Tinderbox]]
*[[Bucket of wax]] (obtainable during the quest with [[Insect repellent]], a bucket spawns near the beekeeper)
*[[Bat bones]] (obtainable during the quest)

Misthalin Mystery.desc: A woman cries as a man lays dying, desperately they beg you to stop a cryptic killer before their friends suffer a similar fate.
Misthalin Mystery.name: Misthalin Mystery
Misthalin Mystery.start: Speak to [[Abigale]] (or [[Hewey]], who sits next to her) in the south-eastern corner of [[Lumbridge Swamp]], near the [[fishing spots]].
Misthalin Mystery.items:
* [[Bucket]] (obtainable during quest)
*[[Tinderbox]] (obtainable during quest)
*[[Knife]] (obtainable during quest)

Monk's Friend.requirements: The ability to run past two level 14 thieves, and one level 26.
Monk's Friend.desc: A monk's child has had their blanket stolen. Find the thieves' den and return the blanket, then help Brother Omad organise the drinks for the child's birthday party.
Monk's Friend.name: Monk's Friend
Monk's Friend.start: Speak to [[Brother Omad]] at the [[Ardougne Monastery]] south of [[East Ardougne]].
Monk's Friend.items:
* [[Jug of water]]
* Regular [[logs]] or a regular [[plank]]

Monkey Madness I.requirements:
* Completion of the following quests:
** [[The Grand Tree]]
** [[Tree Gnome Village]]
* The ability to defeat a level 195 [[Jungle Demon]]
Monkey Madness I.desc:
The King of the northern Gnomes, Narnode Shareen, is once again in need of your help. He recently decided to send an envoy of his Royal Guard, the 10th squad, to oversee the decommissioning of the Gnome owned ship-building facilities on the eastern coast of [[Karamja]].

It has been quite some time since the 10th squad were dispatched and they have been deemed missing in action. It will be up to you, should you decide to help, to find out what fate befell the 10th squad and if possible, track them down.

If only it were so simple. Sinister forces have begun to spread through the Gnome hierarchy and threaten to unleash an unknown terror upon the world. Far across the land, the fires of vengeance are being stoked once again. Can you unravel the mystery behind the deception? Can you separate the truth from the lies? Can you decide for yourself what is real and what is not?
Monkey Madness I.name: Monkey Madness I
Monkey Madness I.start: Talk to [[King Narnode Shareen]] in the [[Grand Tree]].
Monkey Madness I.ironman: * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 40 [[Smithing]] (boostable) (to make the gold bar if not dropped by a monster) or [[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 33 [[Magic]] (boostable) (to telegrab a gold bar from [[Varrock west bank]] basement.) A gold bar is also a reward from [[The Digsite]], [[Goblin Diplomacy]], and [[Waterfall Quest]]
Monkey Madness I.items:
* A [[gold bar]]
* An empty inventory slot
* A [[ball of wool]]
* [[Monkey bones]] or [[Monkey corpse|corpse]] from [[Karamja]] (obtainable during quest)

Monkey Madness II.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[Enlightened Journey]] ***Balloon flight route to [[Gnome Stronghold]] must be unlocked to start the quest. **[[The Eyes of Glouphrie]] **[[Recipe for Disaster/Freeing_King_Awowogei|Recipe for Disaster]] (Freeing King [[Awowogei]]) ***[[Monkey Madness I]] ****[[The Grand Tree]] ****[[Tree Gnome Village]] **[[Troll Stronghold]] ***[[Death Plateau]] **[[Watchtower]] *[[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 69 [[Slayer]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 70 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Hunter icon.png|link=Hunter|alt=Hunter]] 60 [[Hunter]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 55 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 55 [[Thieving]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 60 [[Firemaking]] (not boostable) (required to start) (for [[Gnome Stronghold]] [[Balloon transport system#Grand Tree|Route]]) It is beneficial to have a high [[Combat]] and [[Agility]] level.
Monkey Madness II.desc:
Glough, the war criminal set on eradicating humans and overthrowing Gielinor, has escaped the watch of the Grand Tree gnomes.

With a history of leaving large-scale conflicts and warfare in his wake, Glough must be tracked down and stopped. King Narnode Shareen needs your help.
Monkey Madness II.name: Monkey Madness II
Monkey Madness II.start: Talk to [[King Narnode Shareen]] in the [[Grand Tree]]. (You must have '''all the requirements''' to start the quest).
Monkey Madness II.ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The player briefly visits [[Entrana]].
Monkey Madness II.items:
*A [[lemon]]
*[[Grapes]]
*A [[pestle and mortar]]
*A [[pickaxe]] (if you choose the tanking route)
*[[Logs]]
*A [[light source]]
*A [[hammer]] (obtainable on island)
*A [[chisel]] (obtainable on island)
*An [[m'speak amulet]]
*A [[monkey talisman]] (obtainable on island)
*A [[ninja monkey greegree]] (small or medium)
*A [[slash weapon]] (to slash webs if you choose the tanking route - [[Wilderness sword]] of any tier recommended for this due to 100% web slash ability).
*The [[Translation book]] from [[The Grand Tree]]. If you have lost it a replacement can be obtained from King Narnode during the quest.

Mountain Daughter.requirements: * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 20 [[Agility]] (boostable) (not required to start) '"`UNIQ--ref-00000009-QINU`"' * The ability to defeat a level 70 [[The Kendal|monster]] (can be [[safespot|safespotted]])
Mountain Daughter.desc: Ages ago, a small tribe of people split off from the Fremennik in Rellekka and decided to inhabit the mountains to the east of town. There they lived as nomads for many years, but now the chieftain of the camp has lost his daughter and will not move on before she has been found. Has she run away, has she been eaten by trolls, or is there something more sinister going on? Only you can find out.
Mountain Daughter.name: Mountain Daughter
Mountain Daughter.start: Talk to [[Hamal the Chieftain]] in the [[Mountain Camp]] east of [[Rellekka]]. To get in, take the path north of the [[Golden Apple Tree]] and use a [[rope]] on the rock behind the guard (see below for more details).
Mountain Daughter.items:
* [[Rope]]
* [[Pickaxe]]
* [[Axe]]
* [[Plank]]
* [[Staff]] or a [[pole]] (obtainable during the quest, [[Dramen Staff]] does not work, but [[elemental staves]] and [[Lunar staff]] do work)
* [[Gloves]] (excluding: [[Slayer gloves|Slayer]], [[Mystic gloves|Mystic]], [[Ranger gloves|Ranger]], [[Moonclan gloves|Moonclan]], [[Lunar gloves|Lunar]], [[vambraces]], and random event apparel)

Mourning's End Part I.requirements: *[[File:Ranged icon.png|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 60 [[Ranged]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 50 [[Thieving]] (not boostable) (required to start) *The ability to defeat a level 11 enemy with your combat stats set to 20 each. *Completion of the following quests: **[[Roving Elves]] ***[[Regicide]] ****[[Underground Pass]] *****[[Biohazard]] ******[[Plague City]] ***[[Waterfall Quest]] **[[Big Chompy Bird Hunting]] **[[Sheep Herder]]
Mourning's End Part I.desc:
It seems at last Arianwyn has need of your skills.

He believes there is more to the Mourners than meets the eye and he wishes for you to find out just what they're up to. Can you gain the trust of the Mourners?
Mourning's End Part I.kills: [[Mourner]] ''(level 11) (will decrease all combat skills to 20, including [[Hitpoints]])''
Mourning's End Part I.name: Mourning's End Part I
Mourning's End Part I.start: Talk to [[Eluned]] inside the elven woods of [[Isafdar]].
Mourning's End Part I.ironman: [[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 75 [[Woodcutting]] (boostable) for [[Magic log]] ''(if chopping)'' Magic logs can also be obtained from the [[Reward Cart]] after defeating the [[Wintertodt]] skilling boss, requiring [[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 50 [[Firemaking]] (not boostable) to participate.
Mourning's End Part I.items: *[[Bear fur]] (can be obtained during the quest near Jorral's Outpost) *2 [[silk]] *Each of these [[dye]]s: [[red dye|red]], [[yellow dye|yellow]], [[green dye|green]], and [[blue dye|blue]] (can be bought during the quest for 6 coins each). ** You may want to bring additional dyes to collect multiple coloured toads in case you miss when firing the device. *[[Bucket of water]] (can be bought from the general store in LLetya during the quest, and used on the well) *[[Feather]] *[[Rotten apple]] ('''must''' be the rotten apple on the ground north of the [[Mourner Headquarters]] in [[West Ardougne]], obtainable during the quest) *[[Toad crunchies]] or [[Premade t'd crunch]] *[[Magic logs]] *[[Leather]] *[[Ogre bellows]] (obtainable during the quest) *[[Barrel of naphtha]], or 5-9 [[coal]] to make one *7 empty inventory spaces for the [[Mourner gear]]

Mourning's End Part II.requirements:
*Completion of the following quests:
**[[Mourning's End Part I]]
***[[Roving Elves]]
****[[Regicide]]
*****[[Underground Pass]]
******[[Biohazard]]
*******[[Plague City]]
****[[Waterfall Quest]]
***[[Big Chompy Bird Hunting]]
***[[Sheep Herder]]
Mourning's End Part II.desc:
This chapter of the quest takes our hero deep under the mountains of Arandar to put a stop to the evil plans of the mourners.

If our hero is to succeed, they must solve one of the most complicated puzzles in all of Gielinor.
Mourning's End Part II.kills: None (but powerful level 73 [[Shadow (Temple of Light)|shadows]] are aggressive to players inside the temple)
Mourning's End Part II.name: Mourning's End Part II
Mourning's End Part II.ironman: ''Optional:'' [[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 90 [[Slayer]] to kill [[dark beasts]] for a [[death talisman]] ''or'' completion of [[Temple of the Eye]] to be able to participate in [[Guardians of the Rift]], where a [[catalytic talisman]] may be obtained randomly from the [[rewards guardian]].
Mourning's End Part II.items:
*Full [[mourner gear|mourner clothes]]
*A [[chisel]] (one can be found in the house south of the Mourner HQ)
*A [[death talisman]]/[[death tiara|tiara]], [[catalytic talisman]]/[[catalytic tiara|tiara]], [[Runecraft cape]]  or [[Mourning's End Part II#The Death Altar|50 junk items]]
*[[Rope]]

Murder Mystery.desc: Old man Sinclair has been found dead in his mansion! Unfortunately, the local authorities are having some trouble figuring out who's the guilty party. Maybe the unbiased eye of a passing adventurer will be of help.
Murder Mystery.name: Murder Mystery
Murder Mystery.start: The [[Sinclair Mansion]], north along the path between [[Seers' Village]] and [[Camelot]]. Talk to one of the guards around the mansion.

My Arm's Big Adventure.requirements: *[[File:Farming icon.png|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 29 [[Farming]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 10 [[Woodcutting]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) '"`UNIQ--ref-0000000F-QINU`"' *Completion of the following quests: **[[Eadgar's Ruse]] ***[[Druidic Ritual]] ***[[Troll Stronghold]] ****[[Death Plateau]] **[[The Feud]] **[[Jungle Potion]] *At least 60% favour in the [[Tai Bwo Wannai Cleanup]] [[minigame]] before starting this quest - this will be subtracted from the total favour **Acquiring 100% Tai Bwo Favour rating is a requirement for the [[Medium Karamja Diary]]. If completion of the medium diary is desired, it is recommended to get 100% prior to starting this quest
My Arm's Big Adventure.desc: Trolls love goutweed. They love it so much that they've picked it all, and now they can't get any more. However, in his smelly kitchen in the Troll Stronghold, Burntmeat the cook has heard a rumour that goutweed is growing once again, for anyone who's got the skill to farm it. Can you teach his young assistant - a simple troll known as My Arm - to grow the precious goutweed? Will you overcome My Arm's stubbornness and ignorance to earn yourself Burntmeat's reward? Dare you accompany My Arm on this uniquely trollish expedition?
My Arm's Big Adventure.name: My Arm's Big Adventure
My Arm's Big Adventure.start: The kitchen, deep in the [[Troll Stronghold (location)|Troll Stronghold]]. Talk to [[Burntmeat]].
My Arm's Big Adventure.items:
*[[Bucket]] (can be obtained during the quest, south of the cooking pot on [[Death Plateau (location)|Death Plateau]])
*3 [[Ugthanki dung]], or the following materials to gather it:
**[[Red hot sauce]] (obtainable in [[Pollnivneach]]) '''or''' the [[Camulet]] (from [[Enakhra's Lament]] quest)
**[[Spade]]
**3 additional [[bucket]]s
*Several farming supplies, which can be stored by any [[Tool Leprechaun]] and withdrawn from the [[Tool Leprechaun (Larry)|Trollheim Tool Leprechaun]] - except for Supercompost, these may also be purchased from this Leprechaun:
**7 [[Supercompost]] (must be Supercompost, one extra can be used later rather than the plant cure so 8 total) (He doesn't sell supercompost)
**[[Spade]]
**[[Rake]]
**[[Seed dibber]]
**[[Plant cure]]

Nature Spirit.requirements:
* Completion of [[Priest in Peril]]
* Completion of [[The Restless Ghost]]
Nature Spirit.desc:
After saving the holy man Drezel, he's seeking some assistance again.
This time he has a special request for any adventurous sorts to search for the Druid 'Filliman Tarlock' and brave the terrors that infest the swamp of Mort Myre.
Nature Spirit.name: Nature Spirit
Nature Spirit.start: Speak to [[Drezel]] under the Paterdomus Temple near the [[River Salve]].
Nature Spirit.ironman: * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 18 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (in order to create a [[silver sickle]])
Nature Spirit.items:
* [[Silver sickle]] - either purchase it from the [[Grand Exchange]], or make it with a [[silver bar]] and [[sickle mould]] in a furnace at 18 [[Crafting]]. Ironmen can buy a [[silver bar]] from the [[Silver merchant]] in [[Ardougne]].
* [[Ghostspeak amulet]]
* 6 empty inventory spaces

A Night at the Theatre.requirements:
*Completion of the following quests:
**[[A Taste of Hope]]
***[[Darkness of Hallowvale]]
****[[In Aid of the Myreque]]
*****[[In Search of the Myreque]]
******[[Nature Spirit]]
*******[[Priest in Peril]]
*******[[The Restless Ghost]]
A Night at the Theatre.desc: The Mysterious Stranger lurks outside of the mighty Theatre of Blood, the centrepiece of Ver Sinhaza. This shadowy figure has a new request for you – to humiliate a vampyre noble by the name of Lady Verzik Vitur. Take on the challenges that lie within the Theatre to reach her and bring a blush to her bloodless face!
A Night at the Theatre.kills:
*[[Vyrewatch]] (Level 105)
*Several venomous [[araxyte]] (Levels 96 and 146) (can be avoided)
*[[Hespori (A Night at the Theatre)|Hespori]] (Level 302)
*[[The Maiden of Sugadinti]] 
*[[Pestilent Bloat]]
*[[Nylocas Vasilias]]
*[[Sotetseg]]
*[[Xarpus]]
*[[Verzik Vitur]]
A Night at the Theatre.name: A Night at the Theatre
A Night at the Theatre.start: You can start this quest by talking to the Mysterious Stranger inside Ver Sinhaza, south-east of Meiyerditch.
A Night at the Theatre.items:
*[[Ivandis flail]] or [[Blisterwood flail]]
*[[Saw]] ([[crystal saw]] also works)
*[[Ghostspeak amulet]] ([[Morytania legs 2]] or better also work)
*Any [[axe]] besides the [[blessed axe]]

Observatory Quest.desc: The Observatory in south-west Ardougne has been ransacked by a family of nearby goblins. Can you help the professor to rebuild it?
Observatory Quest.kills: * [[Goblin guard]] ''(level 42)'' (Optional – can simply be trapped behind a column)
Observatory Quest.name: Observatory Quest
Observatory Quest.start: Talk to the [[Observatory professor]] in the [[Observatory]] Reception Room north of [[Castle Wars]].

Olaf's Quest.requirements: *Completion of [[The Fremennik Trials]] *[[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 40 [[Firemaking]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 50 [[Woodcutting]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *The ability to defeat a level 100 monster
Olaf's Quest.desc: Poor Olaf Hradson. He has to live up to such expectations. His ancestors sailed all over the world, and now he has to go out and prove himself their equal. If only he could read a map... If only he could sail... If only he hadn't crashed! Can you help a depressed and soggy Fremennik regain his pride, and possibly the lost treasure of his grandfather?
Olaf's Quest.name: Olaf's Quest
Olaf's Quest.start: Speak to [[Olaf Hradson]] by the isthmus leading to the [[Rellekka Hunter area]].
Olaf's Quest.items:
*Any [[woodcutting]] [[axe]]
*[[Tinderbox]]
*[[Spade]]
*6 [[Rope]]s (can be obtained during the quest)
*4 free [[inventory]] slots (10 if not bringing your own ropes)

One Small Favour.requirements: * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Rune Mysteries]] ** [[Shilo Village]] *** [[Jungle Potion]] **** [[Druidic Ritual]] * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 36 [[Agility]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 25 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 18 [[Herblore]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 30 [[Smithing]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]])
One Small Favour.desc:
If you're new to Shilo Village after solving the mystery (or even if you did it some time ago), you may like to check out Yanni Salika's antiques shop.

He's a busy chap, revamping antique items, checking out new stock from potential adventurers and maybe he'll have a small<sup>(1)</sup> favour to ask of you? Probably nothing particularly large, Yanni isn't a demanding<sup>(2)</sup> person, should hardly take you any time<sup>(3)</sup> at all really, something to do when you have a spare moment.

That's assuming there aren't any complications.

1: - Perception of the word "small" may be open to interpretation.

2: - In a recent vote, Yanni Salika was only voted the second most demanding person in Shilo Village.

3: - As everyone knows, time is relative.
One Small Favour.name: One Small Favour
One Small Favour.start: Speak to [[Yanni Salika]] in [[Shilo Village (location)|Shilo Village]].
One Small Favour.items:
* 4 [[steel bar]]s
* [[Bronze bar]]
* [[Iron bar]]
* [[Chisel]] (Obtainable during the quest)
* The ingredients required to make a [[Guthix rest]]:
** 2 [[Guam leaves]]
** [[Marrentill]]
** [[Harralander]]
** [[Bowl of hot water]] (Obtainable during the quest)
** [[Empty cup]] (Obtainable during the quest)
* [[Hammer]] (Obtainable during the quest)
* 5 [[pigeon cage|pigeon cages]] (Obtainable during the quest)
** '''Note:''' The pigeons do not need to be let out of the cages.
* [[Pot]] (Obtainable during the quest)
* [[Soft clay]] (Obtained during the quest)
* Two of each of the following gems HIGHLY RECOMMENDED: (Two of each gem are obtained uncut during the quest but must be cut before using, with a high chance to crush them)
** [[Opal]]
** [[Jade (gem)|Jade]]
** [[Red topaz]]
** [[Sapphire]]

The Path of Glouphrie.requirements: * Completion of the following quests: ** [[The Eyes of Glouphrie]] *** [[The Grand Tree]] ** [[Waterfall Quest]] ** [[Tree Gnome Village]] * [[File:Strength icon.png|link=Strength|alt=Strength]] 60 [[Strength]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 56 [[Slayer]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 56 [[Thieving]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Ranged icon.png|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 47 [[Ranged]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 45 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (required to start)
The Path of Glouphrie.desc: King Bolren has a new pet. Unfortunately, it's another watcher, like the ones unmasked in the Tree Gnome Stronghold during The Eyes of Glouphrie. Has Glouphrie been watching the Tree Gnome Village, too? If you investigate further you'll find out more about Glouphrie, the history of the gnomes (and their unusual monarchy) and maybe you'll get within a hair's breadth of the lost city of Arposandra...
The Path of Glouphrie.name: The Path of Glouphrie
The Path of Glouphrie.start: Speak to [[King Bolren]] in the [[Tree Gnome Village (location)|Tree Gnome Village]].
The Path of Glouphrie.ironman: * [[File:Fletching icon.png|link=Fletching|alt=Fletching]] 59 [[Fletching]] (boostable) to make a [[mith grapple]] * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 59 [[Smithing]] (boostable) to make a [[mith grapple tip]] '''OR''' * [[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 35 [[Firemaking]] (not boostable) for [[Barbarian Firemaking]], to access the [[Ancient Cavern]], and the means to defeat level 132 enemies for a 1/42.67 chance at a [[mith grapple]] drop (ideally the [[skeleton brute]]).
The Path of Glouphrie.items:
* [[Key (Tree Gnome Village Dungeon)|Tree Gnome Village Dungeon key]] (unless [[Roving Elves]] has been started)
* Combat equipment and some food
* [[Mith Grapple]]
* Any [[Crossbow_(weapon)|crossbow]]
* [[Gnome amulet|Gnome amulet]]

Perilous Moons.requirements: * [[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 48 [[Slayer]] (not boostable) (required to start) * [[File:Hunter icon.png|link=Hunter|alt=Hunter]] 20 [[Hunter]] (not boostable) (required to start) * [[File:Fishing icon.png|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 20 [[Fishing]] (not boostable) (required to start) * [[File:Runecraft icon.png|link=Runecraft|alt=Runecraft]] 20 [[Runecraft]] (not boostable) (required to start) * [[File:Construction icon.png|link=Construction|alt=Construction]] 10 [[Construction]] (not boostable) (required to start) *Completion of the following quests: ** [[Twilight's Promise]] *** [[Children of the Sun]]
Perilous Moons.desc:
Beneath the steep and jagged cliffs of Ralos' Rise sits the dwarven town of Cam Torum. Its strong fortifications have kept it safe through all of Varlamore's history... but now the inhabitants face a new challenge.

Lurking below the surface is an ancient temple, built to contain powerful entities. Now, the earth has been disturbed – and the dwarves need your help to keep these strange beings contained!
Perilous Moons.kills:
* [[Sulphur Nagua (Perilous Moons)|Sulphur Nagua]] (level 98)
* [[Blue Moon]] (level 329)
* [[Blood Moon]] (level 329)
* [[Eclipse Moon]] (level 329)
Perilous Moons.name: Perilous Moons
Perilous Moons.start: Speak to [[Zuma]] or [[Attala]] at the entrance to [[Cam Torum]].
Perilous Moons.items:
* [[Knife]] (obtainable during quest)
* [[Big fishing net]] (obtainable during quest)
* [[Rope]] (obtainable during quest)
* [[Pestle and mortar]] (obtainable during quest)
* Combat equipment for multiple [[PvM]] encounters.

Pirate's Treasure.requirements: Able to defeat or run away from a [[Combat level]] 4 [[gardener]].
Pirate's Treasure.desc: Redbeard Frank knows the location of pirate treasure, but he'll only part with the knowledge for a bottle of [[Karamjan rum]].
Pirate's Treasure.name: Pirate's Treasure
Pirate's Treasure.start: Speak to [[Redbeard Frank]] at the northernmost dock at [[Port Sarim]], just outside [[The Rusty Anchor]].
Pirate's Treasure.items:
*[[Karamjan rum]] (obtainable during the quest for 30 coins)
*[[White apron]] (obtainable during the quest in Port Sarim at [[Gerrant's Fishy Business.]])
*60 [[coins]] (only 30 is needed if using a [[Ring of charos|Ring of charos(a)]])
*10 [[banana]]s (obtainable during the quest)
*[[Spade]] (obtainable during the quest)

Plague City.desc: The western part of Ardougne has been shut off as a deadly plague sweeps through the people. However, a young woman who went in to try to help those stricken by the illness has disappeared and her parents have become worried.
Plague City.name: Plague City
Plague City.start: Talk to [[Edmond]], living next to the wall surrounding [[West Ardougne]], north of [[Ardougne Castle]].
Plague City.ironman:
* [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The [[hangover cure]] can be made before the quest starts by combining milk, chocolate dust, and snape grass to conserve inventory space.
*The [[hangover cure]] itself is an '''untradeable item''' so if preparing for Group Ironman, do not premake these as you will be unable to share them with your group through Group Storage or Trading.
Plague City.items: * [[Dwellberries]] (Spawns in [[McGrubor's Wood]], squeeze through the loose railing, use ALS, or [[Telekinetic Grab]] them. They can be bought from [[Heckel Funch]] or [[Hudo]] in the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]] or grown with 36 [[Farming]].) *[[Rope]] (Purchasable in the [[East Ardougne]] [[general store]], [[Port Khazard]] [[general store]], [[Ned]], or a spawn in [[Karamja]] general store.) *[[Spade]] (One spawns near Edmond.) *4 [[Bucket of water|buckets of water]] (Can be used one-by-one, there is a [[water source]] and [[bucket]] spawn near Edmond) *[[Hangover cure]] or the ingredients to make one: **[[Chocolate dust]] ***[[Chocolate bar]] ***[[Knife]] or [[pestle and mortar]] **[[Bucket of milk]] (Obtained by using a bucket on a [[dairy cow]], one is north of [[Ardougne]], or bought from [[Hudo]] or [[Heckel Funch]].) **[[Snape grass]] (Spawns west of the [[Crafting Guild]] or the peninsula north-east of [[Hosidius]]. It can be grown at 61 [[Farming]]. Can also be obtained from killing [[Tribesmen]] in [[Karamja]].) *[[Picture]] of [[Elena]] (Inside Alrena and Edmond's house)

A Porcine of Interest.desc:
Ah, the Falador Farm - filled with cabbages, cows, and even a sleepy sheepdog. A peaceful place, where you can learn to churn butter, give a dog a bone, or purchase various Farming supplies. What was once a place of happiness, joy and wholesome dairy goods has of late become dominated by a vile presence. Each morning Sarah wakes to find her crops destroyed, her cows cowering, and her loyal sheepdog looking... sheepish.

She's had enough, but she thinks she's got the culprit on the trot. Can you help her track down... A Porcine of Interest?
A Porcine of Interest.name: A Porcine of Interest
A Porcine of Interest.start: Read the town [[Notice board (Draynor Village)|notice board]] in [[Draynor Village]], behind [[Fortunato]]'s [[Wine Shop]].
A Porcine of Interest.items:
* [[Rope]]
* [[Knife]] or a [[slash weapon]] (except [[abyssal whip]], [[abyssal tentacle]], or [[dragon claws]]) (obtainable during the quest)

Priest in Peril.desc: Recently contact has been lost with the temple to Saradomin on Misthalins' Eastern border. [[King Roald]] would be very interested to know what has caused this lack of communication, and seeks an adventurer willing to report back to him on the situation.
Priest in Peril.kills:
* [[Temple guardian]] dog ''(level 30) You cannot use [[Magic]].'' A [[Ring of recoil]] will not register that you killed the [[Temple guardian]] without inflicting at least 1 damage yourself.
* [[Monk of Zamorak]] ''(level 30).'' A [[Ring of recoil]] will not allow key drops without inflicting at least 1 damage yourself.
