Priest in Peril.name: Priest in Peril
Priest in Peril.start: Speak to [[King Roald]] in the [[Varrock Palace]].
Priest in Peril.items:
* 50 unnoted [[rune essence]] or [[pure essence]] (can be mined by talking to [[Aubury]] in [[Varrock]], after completing [[Rune Mysteries]]. All 50 essence does not have to be of the same type.)
* [[Bucket]] (spawns above the Varrock Castle's kitchen in the north-easternmost room (go to the kitchen, and climb up the stairs))

Prince Ali Rescue.requirements: The ability to get past [[aggressive]] [[combat level]] 26 [[jail guard]]s.
Prince Ali Rescue.desc: Prince Ali of Al Kharid has been kidnapped by the scheming Lady Keli. You are hired to stage a rescue mission.
Prince Ali Rescue.name: Prince Ali Rescue
Prince Ali Rescue.start: Speak to [[Hassan]] in the palace at [[Al Kharid]].
Prince Ali Rescue.items:
*[[Soft clay]]
*3 [[balls of wool]]
*[[Yellow dye]] or 2 [[onion]]s and 5 [[coins]]
*[[Redberries]]
*[[Ashes]]
*[[Bucket of water]] or [[jug of water]] (obtainable during quest)
*[[Pot of flour]]
*[[Bronze bar]]
*[[Pink skirt]]
*3 [[beer]]s
*[[Rope]] (can be bought during the quest at [[Ned]] for 18 [[coins]] or 4 [[balls of wool]])
*At least 100 [[coins]]

The Queen of Thieves.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[Client of Kourend]] ***[[X Marks the Spot]] * [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 20 [[Thieving]] (not boostable) (required to start)
The Queen of Thieves.desc: The gangs of Kourend have recently been uniting under a mysterious figure called the Queen of Thieves, somewhere in Port Piscarilius. This novice quest tasks the player with infiltrating the gangs of Kourend in order to find the Queen of Thieves.
The Queen of Thieves.name: The Queen of Thieves
The Queen of Thieves.start: Speak to [[Tomas Lawry]] outside the [[Port Piscarilius]] bank.
The Queen of Thieves.items: * [[Stew]] ''(Cooking ingredients can be obtained during quest for 6 [[coins]]. Requires 25 [[cooking]])''

Rag and Bone Man I.desc: Everybody needs some body, and the Odd Old Man knows exactly which bits of those bodies he needs. Can you help him finish his extensive and extremely creepy collection?
Rag and Bone Man I.name: Rag and Bone Man I
Rag and Bone Man I.start: Speak to the [[Odd Old Man]], located at the end of the northern path in central [[Silvarea]].
Rag and Bone Man I.items:
*8 [[coins]] for 8 [[pot of vinegar|pots of vinegar]] (bring 68 coins if walking to and from [[Karamja]] for boat fare)
*8 [[pot]]s
*8 [[logs]] of any type (or an [[axe]] to obtain them)
*[[Tinderbox]]
*[[Light source]] (a lantern is highly preferred)

Rag and Bone Man II.requirements: *[[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 40 [[Slayer]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Defence icon.png|link=Defence|alt=Defence]] 20 [[Defence]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) to wield a [[mirror shield]] to kill a [[basilisk]] (though not necessary; see below) *Completed [[Rag and Bone Man I]] (required to start) *Completed [[Skippy and the Mogres]] (not required to start) *Completed [[Horror from the Deep]] or partial completion of [[The Fremennik Trials]] (not required to start) *Partial completion of [[Creature of Fenkenstrain]] (not required to start) *Partial completion of [[Waterfall Quest]] (not required to start) *The ability to kill several high-level monsters
Rag and Bone Man II.desc: An archeological bone gathering quest. Requires the start and/or completion of multiple quests. Lots of creatures and animals necessary to be scavenged for specific bones, that will then need to be cleaned and given to the [[Odd Old Man]] for his marvelous collection of bone remains.
Rag and Bone Man II.name: Rag and Bone Man II
Rag and Bone Man II.start: Speak to the [[Odd Old Man]], located at the end of the northern path in central [[Silvarea]].
Rag and Bone Man II.items: *27 [[pot]]s *27 [[jugs of vinegar]] (bought from [[Fortunato]] for 27 coins) *27 sets of [[logs]] (any logs - normal logs can be obtained on the path just below the [[Odd Old Man]]'s hut if you bring an [[axe]]). *[[Tinderbox]] *[[Light source]] *[[Dusty key]] (if under [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 70 [[Agility]]) *[[Rope]] *Combat gear to kill [[zogre]]s (an [[ogre composite bow]] with [[brutal arrow]]s or runes for [[Crumble Undead]] casts is advised) '''Slayer equipment:''' *[[Ice cooler]]s *[[Fishing explosive]]s *[[Mirror shield]] or [[V's shield]] (unless using a workaround - see guide for how to get around using this)

Ratcatchers.requirements:
*Completion of the following quests:
**[[Icthlarin's Little Helper]]
***[[Gertrude's Cat]]

*Access to [[Keldagrim]] 
**[[The Giant Dwarf]] started
Ratcatchers.desc:
Gertrude knows of some ratcatchers in Varrock, pay her a visit and she may tell you of their whereabouts. Perhaps they could show you and your cat a few pointers about rat catching.

Enter the subterranean world of the rat catchers and discover more of your cat's true potential.
Ratcatchers.kills: None, but your cat will have to fight the [[King rat]]
Ratcatchers.name: Ratcatchers
Ratcatchers.items:
*Any type of [[cat]] or [[hellcat]] (for most of the quest, a cat with a high successful [[rat catch rate]] is recommended, and [[overgrown cat]]s cannot be used there -- during the [[Ratcatchers#Hooknosed Jack|Hooknosed Jack part]] of the quest, any cat with strong [[Cat#Combat_stats|combat stats]] is recommended)
*4 [[cheese]] (or 4 [[Poisoned cheese]])
*[[Rat poison]] (if cheese is not already poisoned; can be found in the [[Clock Tower Basement]]), or made during the quest with the following items:
**[[Vial|Empty vial]]
**Cleaned [[kwuarm]] (grimy will not work; [[Zahur]] in [[Nardah]] cleans grimy herbs for 200 coins)
**[[Red spiders' eggs]]
*Cleaned [[marrentill]] (grimy will not work)
*[[Unicorn horn dust]]
*[[Bucket of milk]]
*[[Catspeak amulet]] (unless [[Dragon Slayer II]] is completed)
*[[Pot of weeds]] (use an [[empty pot]] with [[weeds]])
*[[Tinderbox]]
*101 [[coins]] (or 51 [[coins]] with a [[ring of charos (a)]])
*[[Snake charm]] (obtained from [[The Feud]] or during the quest)
*1 free inventory space

Recipe for Disaster.requirements: '''To start the quest and finish the [[Recipe for Disaster/Another Cook's Quest|first chapter]]:''' *[[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 10 [[Cooking]] Recipe for Disaster.desc:
The cook in Lumbridge has a surprisingly small number of ingredients on hand in his kitchen, possibly as a result of an endless stream of newcomers with light fingers, taking anything that isn't nailed down from his kitchen.

Luckily, in the past, a kind [[Cook's Assistant]] was willing to help him in his culinary duties, but a problem has now appeared that could spell... a '''Recipe For Disaster'''!

Almost all members may attempt to solve his tricky predicament, and be rewarded accordingly, but only the very elite of Questers will be able to put an end to his problem permanently!
Recipe for Disaster.kills:
*[[Icefiend]] ''(level 13)'' (only if you lack [[ice gloves]])
*5 [[Mudskipper]]s ''(level 30/31)''
*[[Crab]] ''(level 21/23)''
*[[Evil Chicken]] ''(level varies)'' (see below)
*[[Black dragon]] ''(level 227)''
*[[Big Snake]] ''(level 84)''
*[[Zombie monkey]] ''(levels 82/129)''
*[[Monkey guard]] ''(level 167)''
*[[Ninja monkey]] ''(level 86)''
*[[Agrith-Na-Na]] ''(Level 146)''
*[[Flambeed]] ''(level 149)''
*[[Karamel]] ''(level 136)''
*[[Dessourt]] ''(level 121)''
*[[Gelatinnoth Mother]] ''(level 130)''
*[[Culinaromancer]] ''(level 75)''
Recipe for Disaster.name: Recipe for Disaster
Recipe for Disaster.start: Speak to the [[Cook (Lumbridge)|Cook]] in the kitchen of [[Lumbridge Castle]].
Recipe for Disaster.items:
'''To start the quest and finish the [[Recipe for Disaster/Another Cook's Quest|first chapter]]:'''
*[[Eye of newt]]
*[[Greenman's ale]]
*[[Rotten tomato]]
*Any [[fruit blast]] excluding a [[premade fr' blast]]
*[[Ashes]]
'''To complete all chapters of the quest:'''
*About 320 [[coins]] ''(or 120 if you have the activated [[Ring of charos]])''
*[[Bowl of water]] ''(an [[empty bowl]] can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*[[Bucket of water]] ''(an [[Bucket|empty bucket]] can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*3 [[buckets of milk]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*2 [[eggs]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*[[Orange]]
*[[Banana]] ''(obtainable during the quest)''
*Any [[dye]] '''except''' red, yellow, or orange
*[[Spice]] or [[gnome spice]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*[[Gloves]] ''([[ice gloves]] are preferred)''
*[[Charcoal]]
*[[Fishing bait]]
*[[Fishbowl]]
*2 [[bread]]
*[[Pestle and mortar]]
*[[Needle]]
*3 [[bronze wire]]s
*[[Cake tin]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*4 [[Asgarnian ale]] ''(6 recommended)''
*Any [[cat]] except an [[overgrown cat]] ''(you'll be [[chase|chasing rats]], so a [[wily cat]] is recommended)''
*Several bowls of [[stew]] ''(9 at most)''
*[[Raw chompy]] ''(several recommended in case of burning)''
*[[Raw chicken]]
*[[Raw cod]]
*[[Iron spit]]
*Regular [[logs]]
*[[Tinderbox]]
*[[Ball of wool]]
*[[Ogre bellows]] ''(obtainable during the quest)''
*[[Ogre bow]] and several [[ogre arrows]] ''(10 is enough)''
*2 [[pots of flour]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*[[Pot of cornflour]] ''(or raw [[sweetcorn]] and an [[empty pot]])''
*[[Pot of cream]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*Any [[axe]]
*Any [[pickaxe]]
*Any [[machete]]
*[[Knife]]
*[[Dramen staff]] and [[Dramen branch|branch]]
*[[M'speak amulet]]
*[[gorilla greegree|Gorilla]], [[ninja greegree|ninja]] and [[zombie greegree]] ''(or 3000 [[coins]] and combat equipment if making the greegrees during the quest)''
*[[Monkey nuts]] ''(or 3 [[coins]])''
*[[Rope]]

Recipe for Disaster/Defeating the Culina.requirements: *[[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] 175 [[Quest points]] (required to start) *Completion of the following quests: **[[Desert Treasure I]] ***[[The Dig Site]] ***[[Temple of Ikov]] ***[[The Tourist Trap]] ***[[Troll Stronghold]] ****[[Death Plateau]] ***[[Priest in Peril]] ***[[Waterfall Quest]] **[[Horror from the Deep]] ***[[Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl]] miniquest **[[Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Evil Dave|Freeing Evil Dave]] **[[Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Goblin generals|Freeing the Goblin generals]] **[[Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Lumbridge Guide|Freeing the Lumbridge Guide]] **[[Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Mountain Dwarf|Freeing the Mountain Dwarf]] **[[Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Pirate Pete|Freeing Pirate Pete]] **[[Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Sir Amik Varze|Freeing Sir Amik Varze]] **[[Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Skrach Uglogwee|Freeing Skrach Uglogwee]] **[[Recipe for Disaster/Freeing King Awowogei|Freeing King Awowogei]] *The ability to defeat '''all''' enemies without [[Prayer]]
Recipe for Disaster/Defeating the Culina.desc: The Culinaromancer has retreated through the portal back to his own dimension, where he'll be ready to cause more trouble. Aris has said that you too must go through the portal to finish him off.
Recipe for Disaster/Defeating the Culina.name: Recipe for Disaster/Defeating the Culinaromancer
Recipe for Disaster/Defeating the Culina.start: Release each member of the council from the Culinaromancer's spell.
Recipe for Disaster/Defeating the Culina.items:
*[[Ice gloves]] ''for defeating Flambeed''
*[[Menaphite remedy]] or [[restore potion]]s ''since Karamel will lower your stats''
*Certain armour and weapons for each boss
*Good healing food, such as [[shark]]s

Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Evil Dave.requirements: *[[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 25 [[Cooking]] (boostable) (not required to start) '"`UNIQ--ref-00000022-QINU`"' *Completion of the following quests: **[[Gertrude's Cat]] **[[Recipe for Disaster/Another Cook's Quest]] ***[[Cook's Assistant]] **[[Shadow of the Storm]] ***[[Demon Slayer]] ***[[The Golem]]
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Evil Dave.desc: Evil Dave needs some kind of spicy stew. You will need Evil Dave's help for this one. He lives in his mother's basement...
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Evil Dave.name: Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Evil Dave
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Evil Dave.start: Inspect [[Evil Dave]] in the Lumbridge Castle Dining Room.
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Evil Dave.items:
*Any [[cat]] except an [[overgrown cat]] (note that each cat has a different effective [[rat catch rate]] -- [[kitten]]s or [[lazy cat]]s are not recommended)
*Several bowls of [[stew]] (9 at most)

Recipe for Disaster/Freeing King Awowoge.requirements: *[[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 70 [[Cooking]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 48 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (not required to start) *Completion of the following quests: **[[Monkey Madness I]] ***[[The Grand Tree]] ***[[Tree Gnome Village]] **[[Recipe for Disaster/Another Cook's Quest]] ***[[Cook's Assistant]] *The ability to defeat a level 84 [[Big Snake]]
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing King Awowoge.desc: Awowogei needs his favourite food, but nobody seems to know what it is. Maybe you should go talk to him in his palace.
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing King Awowoge.kills:
*[[Big Snake]] ''(level 84) - (recommended to kill several as they burn often when cooking)''
*'''To obtain the greegrees:'''
**[[Zombie monkey]] ''(levels 82/129)''
**[[Monkey guard]] ''(level 167)''
**[[Ninja monkey]] ''(level 86)''
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing King Awowoge.name: Recipe for Disaster/Freeing King Awowogei
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing King Awowoge.items:
*[[M'speak amulet]]
*[[Karamjan monkey greegree]] (unless you already have another greegree)
*[[Gorilla greegree|Gorilla]], [[Ninja monkey greegree|Ninja monkey]] and [[Zombie monkey greegree]] (can be obtained during the quest with a [[Monkey Talisman]] each)
*[[Banana]] (can be obtained during the quest)
*[[Monkey nuts]] or around 10 [[coins]] to buy some.
*[[Rope]]
*[[Knife]] or [[slashing]] weapon
*[[Pestle and mortar]]

Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Pirate Pete.requirements: *[[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 31 [[Cooking]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * Completion of the following quests: **[[Recipe for Disaster/Another Cook's Quest]] ***[[Cook's Assistant]] *The ability to defeat 5 level 30 monsters.
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Pirate Pete.desc: Pirate Pete needs a fishcake to be protected. Talk to the Lumbridge Cook to learn how to make one.
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Pirate Pete.name: Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Pirate Pete
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Pirate Pete.ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] This quest has a weight limit. *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 42 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (If crafting a [[fishbowl]] yourself or by completing [[Rum Deal]]) *[[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 4 [[Smithing]] (boostable) (To make the bronze wire.)
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Pirate Pete.items:
*A [[raw cod]] (It's highly recommended to get at least 3 of all the ingredients, as the Fishcake can burn)
*A [[pestle and mortar]]
*[[Bread]] (at least 3 recommended)
*A [[knife]]
*A [[fishbowl]] (empty)
*A [[needle]]
*3 [[bronze wire]]

Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Sir Amik Var.requirements: *[[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] 107 [[Quest points]] (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *Access to the [[Kharazi Jungle]] **Started [[Legends' Quest]] *Completion of the following quests: **[[Family Crest]] **[[Heroes' Quest]] ***[[Shield of Arrav]] ***[[Lost City]] ***[[Merlin's Crystal]] ***[[Dragon Slayer I]] **[[Recipe for Disaster/Another Cook's Quest]] ***[[Cook's Assistant]] **[[Shilo Village]] ***[[Jungle Potion]] ****[[Druidic Ritual]] **[[Underground Pass]] ***[[Biohazard]] ****[[Plague City]] **[[Waterfall Quest]] *The ability to defeat a level 227 [[Black dragon]]
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Sir Amik Var.desc: Sir Amik Varze requires a crème brulee supreme. Talk to the Cook to learn how to make one in this complicated but fun subquest.
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Sir Amik Var.kills:
*[[Evil Chicken (Recipe for Disaster)|Evil Chicken]] ''(level varies)'' (see below)
*[[Black dragon]] ''(level 227)''
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Sir Amik Var.name: Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Sir Amik Varze
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Sir Amik Var.ironman:
[[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The player visits [[Entrana]]
[[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] Advised to collect your [[dramen branch]] beforehand as the [[brulee]] does not appear on death piles.
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Sir Amik Var.items: *[[Bucket of milk]] (can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]]) *[[Pot of cream]] (can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]]) *[[Pot of cornflour]] ** [[Sweetcorn]] (Can be obtained south of [[Civitas illa Fortis]] in [[Varlamore]] without [[File:Farming icon.png|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 20 [[Farming]] (boostable)) *[[Vanilla pod]] or tools to get one: ** Any [[axe]] (the [[Blessed axe]] will not work!) ** Any [[machete]] (as well as [[Radimus notes]] if you haven't completed [[Legends' Quest]]) *[[Dramen staff]] or [[Lunar staff]] to enter [[Zanaris]] if the [[Lumbridge_&_Draynor_Diary#Elite|Elite Lumbridge & Draynor diary]] has not been completed. *[[Dramen branch]] to make cinnamon *[[Pestle and mortar]] *[[Ice gloves]] *[[Raw chicken]]

Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Skrach Uglog.requirements: *[[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 41 [[Cooking]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 20 [[Firemaking]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *Completion of the following quests: **[[Big Chompy Bird Hunting]] **[[Recipe for Disaster/Another Cook's Quest]] ***[[Cook's Assistant]]
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Skrach Uglog.desc: To protect Skrach Uglogwee from the Culinaromancer, you need to feed him a cooked jubbly bird, the most delicious type of Chompy in the Feldip Hills. You need to talk to [[Rantz]] to learn how to get one.
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Skrach Uglog.name: Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Skrach Uglogwee
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Skrach Uglog.ironman: *[[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 17 [[Smithing]] (boostable) for an [[iron spit]] without access to [[Weiss]]
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Skrach Uglog.items:
*[[Axe]] (a [[blessed axe]] will not work)
*[[Raw chompy]] (bring several if you have a low cooking level)
*[[Iron spit]] (made on an anvil with an [[iron bar]])
*[[Logs]] (can be obtained during the quest)
*[[Tinderbox]]
*[[Pickaxe]]
*[[Ogre bellows]] (can be obtained during the quest)
*[[Ball of wool]]
*[[Ogre bow]] or [[comp ogre bow]] (can be purchased from Rantz during the quest for at most 600 [[coins]])
*[[Ogre arrows]] Chisel, knife, wolf bones and feathers if you are making your own ogre arrows ([[Brutal arrows]] also work if using a comp ogre bow)

Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Goblin g.requirements:
Completion of the following quests:
*[[Recipe for Disaster/Another Cook's Quest]]
**[[Cook's Assistant]]
*[[Goblin Diplomacy]]
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Goblin g.desc: The goblin generals need a food that they'll both eat. Find a chef in [[Goblin Village]] to learn how to make it.
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Goblin g.name: Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Goblin generals
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Goblin g.start: Inspect one of the goblin generals in the Lumbridge Castle dining room.
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Goblin g.items:
*[[Bread]]
*[[Orange slices]]
** Use a [[Knife|knife]] on an [[orange]]
*Either [[blue dye|blue]], [[black dye|black]], [[green dye|green]] or [[purple dye]] (purple dye spawns directly east of the [[spirit tree]] at the [[Khazard Battlefield]], south of the [[Ardougne Castle]])
*[[Spice]] or [[Gnome spice]] (can be bought or stolen from the [[Ardougne market]], bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]] or bought in the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]])
*[[Fishing bait]]
*[[Bucket of water]]
*[[Charcoal]] or [[Ground charcoal]] (buy in [[Shilo Village (location)|Shilo Village]], [[Jiminua's Jungle Store]] or [[Gunslik's Assorted Items]].)

Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Lumbridg.requirements: *[[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 40 [[Cooking]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *Completion of the following quests: **[[Big Chompy Bird Hunting]] **[[Biohazard]] ***[[Plague City]] **[[Demon Slayer]] **[[Murder Mystery]] **[[Nature Spirit]] ***[[Priest in Peril]] ***[[The Restless Ghost]] **[[Recipe for Disaster/Another Cook's Quest]] ***[[Cook's Assistant]] **[[Witch's House]]
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Lumbridg.desc: You need a [[cake of guidance]] to protect the Lumbridge Guide. Wizard Traiborn in the Wizards' Tower can teach you how to make one.
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Lumbridg.name: Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Lumbridge Guide
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Lumbridg.items: *A [[bucket of milk]] *An [[egg]] *A [[pot of flour]] *A [[cake tin]] (All required items can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]]) '''Recommended:''' *[[Grouping]] teleport to [[Guardians of the Rift]] [[minigame]] *[[Necklace of passage]] or access to [[fairy rings]] (DIS) and a [[Lunar staff|Lunar]]/[[Dramen staff]] (for quick transportation to [[Wizards' Tower]])

Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Mountain.requirements:
*Completion of the following quests:
**[[Another Cook's Quest]]
***[[Cook's Assistant]]
**[[Fishing Contest]]
*The ability to defeat a level 13 [[icefiend]] if you don't have the [[ice gloves]].
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Mountain.desc: To save the dwarf, you will need a special dwarven rock cake. Only his father in the tunnel under [[White Wolf Mountain]] knows how to make one.
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Mountain.name: Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Mountain Dwarf
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Mountain.start: Inspect the frozen dwarf in the Lumbridge Castle dining room to start the quest.
Recipe for Disaster/Freeing the Mountain.items:
*[[Bucket of milk]] (can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])
*[[Pot of flour]] (can be bought from the Culinaromancer's chest)
*[[Egg]] (can be bought from the Culinaromancer's chest)
*[[Bowl of water]] (a [[bowl]] and [[sink]] can be found in the kitchen of [[Lumbridge Castle]])
*4 [[Asgarnian ale]]s (can be bought during the quest at the [[Rising Sun Inn]] in [[Falador]])
**Recommended to bring at least 2 additional ales in case Rohak sobers up 
*306 [[coins]] (300 + 1 coin per ale, 100 instead of 300 if you choose to bring an [[activated ring of charos]])
** Bring additional coins if buying the other ingredients or bringing additional ales
*[[Gloves]], If not using gloves make sure to bring [[Telekinetic Grab]] spell runes (''[[Ice gloves]] are the best, but other gloves will work fine too'')

*2 [[eggs]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*[[Orange]]
*[[Banana]] ''(obtainable during the quest)''
*Any [[dye]] '''except''' red, yellow, or orange
*[[Spice]] or [[gnome spice]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*[[Gloves]] ''([[ice gloves]] are preferred)''
*[[Charcoal]]
*[[Fishing bait]]
*[[Fishbowl]]
*2 [[bread]]
*[[Pestle and mortar]]
*[[Needle]]
*3 [[bronze wire]]s
*[[Cake tin]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*4 [[Asgarnian ale]] ''(6 recommended)''
*Any [[cat]] except an [[overgrown cat]] ''(you'll be [[chase|chasing rats]], so a [[wily cat]] is recommended)''
*Several bowls of [[stew]] ''(9 at most)''
*[[Raw chompy]] ''(several recommended in case of burning)''
*[[Raw chicken]]
*[[Raw cod]]
*[[Iron spit]]
*Regular [[logs]]
*[[Tinderbox]]
*[[Ball of wool]]
*[[Ogre bellows]] ''(obtainable during the quest)''
*[[Ogre bow]] and several [[ogre arrows]] ''(10 is enough)''
*2 [[pots of flour]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*[[Pot of cornflour]] ''(or raw [[sweetcorn]] and an [[empty pot]])''
*[[Pot of cream]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
*Any [[axe]]
*Any [[pickaxe]]
*Any [[machete]]
*[[Knife]]
*[[Dramen staff]] and [[Dramen branch|branch]]
*[[M'speak amulet]]
*[[gorilla greegree|Gorilla]], [[ninja greegree|ninja]] and [[zombie greegree]] ''(or 3000 [[coins]] and combat equipment if making the greegrees during the quest)''
*[[Monkey nuts]] ''(or 3 [[coins]])''
*[[Rope]]

Recruitment Drive.requirements:
*Completion of the following quests:
**[[Black Knights' Fortress]]
**[[Druidic Ritual]]
Recruitment Drive.desc: The Temple Knights of Saradomin, a secret organisation founded many centuries ago by Saradomin himself, are currently looking to expand their ranks with some new blood. After the successful thwarting of the Black Knights' plans to take over Asgarnia, and with the personal recommendation of Sir Amik, you have now been offered the chance to apply for membership in this organisation... but are you up to the challenge?
Recruitment Drive.name: Recruitment Drive
Recruitment Drive.start: Speak to [[Sir Amik Varze]] on the 2nd floor[UK]3rd floor[US] of the [[White Knights' Castle]]'s western tower in [[Falador]].
Recruitment Drive.ironman:
[[File:Hardcore ironman chat badge.png]] You will lose your Hardcore ironman status if you die to Sir Leye.
[[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] This quest requires an empty inventory and no items worn.

Regicide.requirements: * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Underground Pass]] *** [[Biohazard]] **** [[Plague City]] * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 10 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 56 [[Agility]] (boostable) (not required to start) * The ability to defeat a level 110 [[Tyras guard]] (can be [[safespotted]])
Regicide.desc:
Continuing the Plague City series, the Regicide Quest takes you beyond the 'Well of Voyage' to a new realm.

King Lathas will employ you once again, this time for the grim task of disposing of his brother.

Upon travelling to the realm you will find yourself surrounded by new and strange plants, animals and even a new race.

Once there, you will see that everything is not as serene as it first appears.
Regicide.name: Regicide
Regicide.start: Talk to [[King Lathas]] on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of [[Ardougne Castle]].
Regicide.ironman: * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 10 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (to make a [[strip of cloth]])
Regicide.items: * 5 [[coal]] in the bank (although at least 25 is recommended; you may bring the coal noted to save you a bank trip) * [[Bow]] and some [[arrows]] (or [[fire arrows|lit fire arrows]] if you already have some.) * 2 [[rope]]s (3 in case you fail) * [[Spade]] * [[Limestone]] (or a [[pickaxe]] and [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 10+ [[Mining]]). Note that [[limestone brick]]s will '''not''' work. * [[Tinderbox]] * [[Strip of cloth]] (made on a [[loom]] with 4 [[balls of wool]]; '''not''' a [[bolt of cloth]] - you can use the [[loom]] at the [[Iorwerth Camp]] or at the [[Falador]] farm) * [[Pestle and mortar]] * [[Gloves]], the list on [[Quicklime]] shows all gloves that work. * [[Pot]] (obtainable during quest) * [[Cooked rabbit]] (obtainable during quest) or [[roast rabbit]]

The Restless Ghost.requirements: Capable of killing or running away from a [[combat level]] 13 [[skeleton]].
The Restless Ghost.desc: A ghost is haunting [[Lumbridge]] graveyard. The priest of the Lumbridge church of [[Saradomin]] wants you to find out how to get rid of it.
The Restless Ghost.name: The Restless Ghost
The Restless Ghost.start: Speak to [[Father Aereck]] in the chapel south-east of [[Lumbridge Castle]].

The Ribbiting Tale of a Lily Pad Labour.requirements: * [[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 15 [[Woodcutting]] (not boostable) (required to start) * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Children of the Sun]]
The Ribbiting Tale of a Lily Pad Labour.desc: Solve a ribbiting dispute and gain access to a new [[Special_patches#Special_tree_patches|hardwood Farming patch]].
The Ribbiting Tale of a Lily Pad Labour.name: The Ribbiting Tale of a Lily Pad Labour Dispute
The Ribbiting Tale of a Lily Pad Labour.items: * Any axe (a [[bronze axe]] is obtainable during the quest)

Rogue Trader.requirements:
Completion of following quests:
*[[The Feud]]
*[[Rune Mysteries]]
*[[Icthlarin's Little Helper]] - gives access to [[Sophanem]]
**[[Gertrude's Cat]]
Rogue Trader.items:
*3 [[dyes]] of any colour (to unlock [[Menaphite clothing]]) OR 3 animal pelts of the same kind (to unlock the [[Desert outfit]]). This includes [[cowhide]], [[grey wolf fur]], [[snakeskin]], [[bear fur]], or [[wool]] (not [[balls of wool]])
*At least 100 coins (for street urchin)
Rogue Trader.name: Rogue Trader

Romeo & Juliet.desc: [[Romeo]] and [[Juliet]] are desperately in love, but Juliet's father doesn't approve. Help them to find a way to get married and live happily ever after.
Romeo & Juliet.name: Romeo & Juliet

Roving Elves.requirements: * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Regicide]] *** [[Underground Pass]] **** [[Biohazard]] ***** [[Plague City]] ** [[Waterfall Quest]] * The ability to defeat a level 84 enemy unarmed, with [[Glarial's Tomb#Restricted items|heavy restrictions]] * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 56 [[Agility]] (boostable) (not required to start), unless travelling with a [[charter ship]] to the elven woods
Roving Elves.desc: Deep in the elven forests of Isafdar, live a duo of roving elves: Islwyn a grumpy, old elf who dislikes humans and his companion, [[Eluned]], who is a beautiful, friendly, young female elf with a kind heart. In this quest, you are challenged to overcome Islwyn's prejudice against humans and alleviate the burdens of the past.
Roving Elves.kills: * [[Moss Guardian]] ''(level 84)'' (has to be killed with [[Glarial's Tomb#Restricted items|restricted items]], can be [[flinched]])
Roving Elves.name: Roving Elves
Roving Elves.start: Talk to [[Islwyn]] inside the elven woods of [[Isafdar]].
Roving Elves.ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] You must briefly visit Glarial's Tomb which has [[Glarial's Tomb#Restricted items|significant item restrictions]]. Items dropped outside the tomb may be picked back up within three minutes.
Roving Elves.items:
* [[Glarial's pebble]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Key (Waterfall Dungeon)|Key]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Spade]]
* [[Rope]]

Royal Trouble.requirements: *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 40 [[Agility]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 40 [[Slayer]] (boostable) (not required to start) * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Throne of Miscellania]] *** [[Heroes' Quest]] **** [[Shield of Arrav]] **** [[Lost City]] **** [[Merlin's Crystal]] **** [[Dragon Slayer I]] *** [[The Fremennik Trials]]
Royal Trouble.desc: It's tough being a regent of a small island kingdom, especially when the [[King Vargas|king]] has declared war while you were adventuring. Something is up in [[Miscellania]] and [[Etceteria]], so you'd better find out what before both kingdoms end up in royal trouble.
Royal Trouble.name: Royal Trouble
Royal Trouble.start: Go to [[Miscellania]] and speak to [[Advisor Ghrim]] in the castle.
Royal Trouble.items:
*5 [[coal]] (obtainable during the quest with a [[pickaxe]], which will also be obtainable)
*2 [[rope]] (obtainable from crates during the quest)
*1 [[plank]] (obtainable from a spawn during the quest)

Rum Deal.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[Zogre Flesh Eaters]] ***[[Big Chompy Bird Hunting]] ***[[Jungle Potion]] ****[[Druidic Ritual]] **[[Priest in Peril]] *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 42 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Fishing icon.png|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 50 [[Fishing]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Farming icon.png|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 40 [[Farming]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Prayer icon.png|link=Prayer|alt=Prayer]] 47 [[Prayer]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 42 [[Slayer]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *The ability to kill a [[combat level]] 150 [[Evil spirit|monster]] (can be [[safespotted]])
Rum Deal.desc: Zombie pirates have arisen on [[Braindeath Island]], and they don't look friendly! Production of 'rum' has stopped, and the pirate brewers are running scared. Can you overcome the horde of drunken, undead pirates? Can you even get to the island without getting a splitting headache?
Rum Deal.name: Rum Deal
Rum Deal.start: [[Pirate Pete]], at a dock due north of [[Port Phasmatys]].
Rum Deal.items:
*[[Rake]] (obtainable during the quest)
*[[Seed dibber]] (obtainable during the quest) or partial completion of the [[Farming]] portion of the [[Barbarian Training]] [[miniquest]]
*[[Bucket]] (obtainable during the quest)
*At least 47 [[prayer points]] for the ''[[Rum Deal#Evil spirits|Evil spirits]]'' part of the quest

Rune Mysteries.desc: Recent research at the [[Wizards' Tower]] has found a way to create Runes for the first time in centuries. Assist the head wizard Sedridor in his research and he too may teach you these secrets!
Rune Mysteries.name: Rune Mysteries
Rune Mysteries.start: Speak to [[Duke Horacio]] on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of [[Lumbridge Castle]].

Scorpion Catcher.requirements: * [[File:Prayer icon.png|link=Prayer|alt=Prayer]] 31 [[Prayer]] (not boostable) (not required to start) * Completion of [[Alfred Grimhand's Barcrawl]] * The ability to run past level 172 [[black demon]]s and level 64 [[poison spider]]s
Scorpion Catcher.desc: Thormac the Sorcerer has a hobby involving scorpions. Unfortunately, three of them have escaped and managed to run far away. If you manage to find them all, he may just be able to perform an important service for you.
Scorpion Catcher.kills: * [[Jailer]] ''(level 47)'' if you need to acquire the [[dusty key]]
Scorpion Catcher.name: Scorpion Catcher
Scorpion Catcher.start: Speak to [[Thormac]] at the top floor of the [[Sorcerer's Tower]], south-east of the [[Ranging Guild]].
Scorpion Catcher.items: *[[Dusty key]] (obtainable during the quest) or [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 70 [[Agility]] (boostable).

Sea Slug.requirements: * [[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 30 [[Firemaking]] (boostable) (not required to start)
Sea Slug.desc:
Something strange is happening on the [[Fishing Platform]].
Missing fishermen and the presence of dozens of strange sea creatures gives cause for concern.
Investigate the platform, discover the truth before it's too late.
Sea Slug.name: Sea Slug
Sea Slug.items: * [[Swamp paste]] (made by mixing [[flour]] with [[swamp tar]] then cooking the mixture on a fire; can also be bought from a [[Trader crewmember]] for 75 coins, from [[Rasolo]] for 60 coins west of the [[Fishing Guild]], or from the [[Khazard General Store]] for 42 coins at full stock)

Secrets of the North.requirements: *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 69 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 64 [[Thieving]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Hunter icon.png|link=Hunter|alt=Hunter]] 56 [[Hunter]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *Completion of the following quests: **[[Making Friends with My Arm]] ***[[My Arm's Big Adventure]] ****[[Eadgar's Ruse]] *****[[Druidic Ritual]] *****[[Troll Stronghold]] ******[[Death Plateau]] ****[[The Feud]] ****[[Jungle Potion]] ***[[Swan Song]] ****[[One Small Favour]] *****[[Rune Mysteries]] *****[[Shilo Village]] ****[[Garden of Tranquillity]] *****[[Creature of Fenkenstrain]] ******[[Priest in Peril]] ******[[The Restless Ghost]] ***[[Cold War]] ***[[Romeo & Juliet]] **[[The General's Shadow]] ***[[Curse of the Empty Lord]], for full [[ghostly robes]] ****Started [[Desert Treasure I]], for the [[ring of visibility]] ***[[Fight Arena]] **[[Devious Minds]] ***[[Wanted!]] ****[[Recruitment Drive]] *****[[Black Knights' Fortress]] *****[[Druidic Ritual]] ****[[The Lost Tribe]] *****[[Goblin Diplomacy]] *****[[Rune Mysteries]] ****[[Priest in Peril]] ***[[Doric's Quest]] ***[[Enter the Abyss]] **[[Hazeel Cult]]
Secrets of the North.desc: Our story begins - as all good murder mysteries do - with a mysterious murder, and there's no shortage of suspects - in fact, you're one of them! Be prepared to form an uneasy alliance, dig up secrets best left buried deep, and walk away with more questions than answers...
Secrets of the North.name: Secrets of the North
Secrets of the North.start: The [[Carnillean Mansion]] in the south-west corner of [[East Ardougne]]
Secrets of the North.items:
*100 [[Coins]]
*[[Lockpick]] ([[Strange Old Lockpick]] does NOT work)
*[[Tinderbox]] (can be obtained during quest)

Shades of Mort'ton.requirements: * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Priest in Peril]] * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 20 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 15 [[Herblore]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 5 [[Firemaking]] (boostable) (not required to start) * Must be able to defeat 5 level-40 [[Loar Shade]]s. * Must be able to survive an onslaught when rebuilding the Temple (Being surrounded by many players makes this much easier). * Access to [[Mort'ton]]
Shades of Mort'ton.desc: The townsfolk of [[Mort'ton]] have some form of strange affliction and the town is full of Shades. Can you find some way to reverse this?
Shades of Mort'ton.name: Shades of Mort'ton
Shades of Mort'ton.start: Find the [[Diary (Shades of Mort'ton)|Diary of Herbi Flax]] on a shelf in a house at the village of [[Mort'ton]].
Shades of Mort'ton.items: * 5000+ [[coins]] (bring plenty of money just in case) * 2 [[Tarromin potion (unf)]] (made by adding 2 clean [[Tarromin]]s (obtainable during quest) to 2 [[Vial of water|vials of water]] (empty vials are obtainable during quest)) * [[Tinderbox]] * An [[axe]] for cutting pyre logs * 2 [[Ashes]] * Prior to building the temple, you need a [[hammer]] (1 coin at the [[general store]]). However, a regular hammer is insufficient to build the temple without a large group. An additional 13,000 coins (or 5,445 on the [[Grand Exchange]]) allows you to buy a [[Flamtaer hammer]] from Razmire, which is necessary to complete this part of the [[quest]] without a group.

Shadow of the Storm.requirements: *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 30 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *Completion of the following quests: **[[The Golem]] **[[Demon Slayer]] *The ability to defeat a level 100 demon
Shadow of the Storm.desc:
A sinister group of dark wizards is attempting to summon Agrith-Naar, a demon of exceptional mystical power. Rather than try to prevent them, a Saradominist priest asks the player to help summon the demon and then kill it once and for all.

But all is not as it seems...
Shadow of the Storm.name: Shadow of the Storm
Shadow of the Storm.start: Speak to [[Father Reen]], south of [[Al Kharid]] bank.
Shadow of the Storm.items:
*[[Silverlight]] (obtainable at start of quest)
*[[Strange implement]] (obtainable during quest)
*Any black outfit (minimum of 3 pieces, see [[Shadow_of_the_Storm#Starting_Out|below]] for the allowed gear — the dyed [[Silverlight]] '''does not''' count as a piece of black clothing)
**'''Note:''' You can make a [[black desert robe]] and [[black desert shirt|shirt]] during the quest if you brought a [[desert robe]] and [[desert shirt|shirt]]
*[[Black dye]] (from grinding a black mushroom using a pestle and mortar alongside a vial)
*[[Silver bar]]
*Means to enter the desert (such as the [[Shantay pass (item)|Shantay pass]], [[Desert amulet 2]], [[Teleport tablets]] or [[Teleport scrolls|scrolls]], [[Fairy rings]] or the [[Pharaoh's sceptre]])

Sheep Herder.desc: Dispose of plagued sheep and save Ardougne!
Sheep Herder.name: Sheep Herder
Sheep Herder.start: Speak to [[Councillor Halgrive]] outside of the [[East Ardougne]] church.

Sheep Shearer.desc: Fred the Farmer's sheep are getting mighty woolly. He will pay you to shear them.
Sheep Shearer.name: Sheep Shearer
Sheep Shearer.start: Speak to [[Fred the Farmer]] in the house by the [[sheep]] pen north of [[Lumbridge Castle]].
Sheep Shearer.items:
*20 [[balls of wool]] (unnoted)
or
*[[Shears]] to obtain [[wool]] to spin into balls of wool (obtained during the quest)

Shield of Arrav.requirements: A trustworthy friend or partner. Players can join the official [[chat-channel]] "OSRS SOA" to look for a partner.
Shield of Arrav.desc: Varrockian literature tells of a valuable shield, stolen long ago from the museum of [[Varrock]], by a gang of professional thieves. See if you can track down this shield and return it to the museum. You will need a friend to help you complete this quest.
Shield of Arrav.name: Shield of Arrav
Shield of Arrav.start: [[Varrock]] Palace library. Talk to [[Reldo]], the librarian, located at the northern end of [[Varrock Castle]].
Shield of Arrav.items:
*Phoenix Gang: 20 [[coins]]
*Black Arm Gang: 2 [[Phoenix crossbow]]s (obtained during the quest)

Shilo Village.requirements: * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Jungle Potion]] *** [[Druidic Ritual]] * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 20 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 32 [[Agility]] (boostable) (not required to start) * Must be able to defend from many [[Undead one]]s (level 61-73) and able to defeat three monsters that are about level 90.
Shilo Village.desc:
New areas in the southern part of Karamja Island have been discovered with a mysterious village.
Who knows what hidden treasures exist, and what dangers lurk to guard them?
Shilo Village.kills: * [[Nazastarool]] in 3 forms, levels 91, 68 and 93. [[Safespotting]] is possible.
Shilo Village.name: Shilo Village
Shilo Village.start: Talk to [[Mosol Rei]] outside of [[Shilo Village (location)|Shilo Village]] in the south part of [[Karamja]].
Shilo Village.ironman: * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 4 [[Smithing]] (boostable) (to make a [[bronze wire]])
Shilo Village.items:
* [[Spade]]
* A lit [[torch]] or [[candle]] ([[lantern]]s or a [[Firemaking cape]] don't work) (a [[bruma torch]] will work, but '''you will not get this item back''')
* [[Rope]]
* [[Bronze wire]] (can be made from scratch using the General Store and Anvil north of [[Tai Bwo Wannai]])
* [[Chisel]]
* 3 regular [[bones]] (obtainable during quest, only ''normal'' bones work; a spare is a good idea in case you bury one)
* [[Wampum belt]] (obtainable during quest)
''All required items (except for the bones and wire) can be bought at the [[general store]] in [[Tai Bwo Wannai]] for less than 100 coins.''
''Bones can be obtained from the [[chicken]] (Level 3) south of [[Trufitus]] past the rotten fence, or the [[hobgoblins]] just north-west of the fairy ring.''

Sins of the Father.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[Vampyre Slayer]] **[[A Taste of Hope]] ***[[Darkness of Hallowvale]] ****[[In Aid of the Myreque]] *****[[In Search of the Myreque]] ******[[Nature Spirit]] *******[[Priest in Peril]] *******[[The Restless Ghost]] *[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 62 [[Woodcutting]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Fletching icon.png|link=Fletching|alt=Fletching]] 60 [[Fletching]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 56 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 52 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Attack icon.png|link=Attack|alt=Attack]] 50 [[Attack]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 50 [[Slayer]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 49 [[Magic]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]])
Sins of the Father.desc: A darkness has fallen over Morytania. The Myreque freedom fighters have achieved their first major victory over the vampyres with the death of [[Ranis Drakan]]. However, their newly found hope is unlikely to last. After many years of absence, [[Lord Lowerniel Vergidiyad Drakan|Lord Lowerniel Drakan]], the vampyre overlord of Morytania, has finally emerged from his castle. He has but one goal. To avenge his brother and eradicate the Myreque once and for all.
Sins of the Father.kills:
*[[Kroy]] (level 133)
*[[Nail beast]] (level 143 & 67 twice)
*[[Vampyre Juvinate#Level 119|Vampyre Juvinate]] (level 119) twice
*[[Mutated Bloodveld]] (level 123)
*[[Damien Leucurte]] (level 204)
*[[Vampyre Juvenile]] (level 122)
*[[Vanstrom Klause]] (level 459)
Sins of the Father.name: Sins of the Father
Sins of the Father.start: Speak to [[Veliaf Hurtz]] outside the church in [[Slepe]].
Sins of the Father.items:
*Any [[axe]]
*[[Vyrewatch outfit]] ([[Vyrewatch top|top]], [[Vyrewatch legs|legs]], and [[Vyrewatch shoes|shoes]]) or 1,950 coins to purchase it from [[Trader Sven's Black-market Goods]] (can be obtained during quest)
*[[Ivandis flail]]
*[[Ruby]]
*[[Knife]] (can be obtained during quest)
*[[Chisel]]
*Runes for [[Lvl-3 Enchant]] (1 [[cosmic rune]], 5 [[fire rune]]s) or an [[enchant ruby or topaz]] tablet

Skippy and the Mogres.requirements: *[[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 20 [[Cooking]] (boostable) (not required to start)
Skippy and the Mogres.desc: Help a drunken man haunted by the curse of the Mogres.
Skippy and the Mogres.name: Skippy and the Mogres
Skippy and the Mogres.start: Speak to [[Skippy]] located south-east of the town of [[Rimmington]].
Skippy and the Mogres.items:
*[[Bucket of water]]
*[[Nettle tea]]
**[[Nettle-water]]
***[[Bowl of Water]]
***[[Nettles]] (more than one with low Cooking level, as it can fail due to over boiling)
****[[Gloves]] to pick the nettles ([[leather gloves]] are obtainable during the quest)
*[[Hangover cure]] or the ingredients to make one:
**[[Chocolate dust]]
***[[Chocolate bar]]
***[[Knife]] or [[pestle and mortar]]
**[[Bucket of milk]]
**[[Snape grass]]

Sleeping Giants.requirements: *[[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 15 [[Smithing]] (not boostable) (required to start)
Sleeping Giants.desc:
Ahh, giants. We all know them. Enormous humanoids hanging about Gielinor, simply minding their own business until some adventurer or another comes along to beat them up.

But how much do we really know about these giants? What do they think about? Where did they come from? Would they enjoy making massive swords in some kind of... gargantuan workshop?

All these questions, and more, will be answered in the quest Sleeping Giants! You'll help Kovac, a friendly giant who's discovered an ancient forge built to his giant-size proportions!
Sleeping Giants.name: Sleeping Giants
Sleeping Giants.start: Speak to [[Kovac]] at the [[Giants' Plateau]], east of [[Al Kharid]].
Sleeping Giants.ironman: [[File:Ultimate_ironman_chat_badge.png]] 20 empty inventory spaces needed to search a crate.
Sleeping Giants.items:
* 3 [[oak logs]]
* 1 [[wool]] ([[ball of wool]] will '''not''' work)
* 10 [[nails]]
* [[Hammer]] or [[Imcando hammer]] (Other types of hammers will not work)
* [[Chisel]]
* 1 [[bucket of water]] (Obtainable during quest) or [[ice gloves]]

Song of the Elves.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[Mourning's End Part II]] ***[[Mourning's End Part I]] ****[[Big Chompy Bird Hunting]] ****[[Sheep Herder]] ****[[Roving Elves]] *****[[Waterfall Quest]] *****[[Regicide]] ******[[Underground Pass]] *******[[Biohazard]] ********[[Plague City]] **[[Making History]] ***[[Priest in Peril]] ***[[The Restless Ghost]] **[[Druidic Ritual]] *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 70 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Construction icon.png|link=Construction|alt=Construction]] 70 [[Construction]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Farming icon.png|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 70 [[Farming]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 70 [[Herblore]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Hunter icon.png|link=Hunter|alt=Hunter]] 70 [[Hunter]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 70 [[Mining]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 70 [[Smithing]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 70 [[Woodcutting]] (not boostable) (required to start)
Song of the Elves.desc:
Our story begins with you, the hero, answering the call to adventure when Edmond, a resident of Ardougne, asks for your aid. By rescuing his daughter Elena from Plague City, the quarantined West Ardougne, you begin to unravel the mystery surrounding the disease. With her help, you discover the plague is a hoax - a plot by King Lathas to section off the West Ardougne. By confronting him, you find out this was done to protect the rest of Gielinor from the threat in the elven lands.

The king sends you on a mission to travel through the Underground Pass and help his ally, Lord Iorwerth, in eradicating his brother King Tyras who threatens to revive the mysterious Dark Lord. After an arduous journey through the pass, you meet with Iorwerth and his forces to end Tyras' evil once and for all.

Upon your return to Lathas you are intercepted by Arianwyn, a rebel elf who opposes Lord Iorwerth. He informs you of Lathas and Iorwerth's deception. They manipulated you into removing their final opposition and were now free to bring the Dark Lord back to Gielinor for their own intentions. You work with the elven rebellion to discover the purpose of the plague was to disguise the digsite of the long lost Temple of Light. An ancient place that is key to bringing back the Dark Lord.

To make amends for your past mistakes and put a halt in King Lathas' and Lord Iorwerth's plans, you solve the intricate light puzzle designed to protect the Death Altar within the temple. After sealing off the temple and preventing the return of the Dark Lord, it's now time to turn your attention to King Lathas and Lord Iorwerth to end their schemes once and for all in Song of the Elves.
Song of the Elves.kills:
*21 [[Mourner (Song of the Elves)|Mourners]] (level 24, 51 and 106)
*[[Paladin (Song of the Elves)|Paladin]] (level 49 and 118)
*[[Knight of Ardougne (Song of the Elves)|Knight of Ardougne]] (level 27 and 53)
*Several [[Iorwerth Archer]]s and [[Iorwerth Warrior|Warriors]] (level 90 and 108)
*[[Arianwyn]] (level 212)
*[[Essyllt]] (level 236)
*[[Fragment of Seren]] (level 494)
Song of the Elves.name: Song of the Elves

A Soul's Bane.requirements: The ability to defeat level 45+ enemies.
A Soul's Bane.desc: A rift in the ground has opened up releasing all manner of strange monsters into the lands near the Digsite. A sorrowful mother waits at the top of the rift for her long lost son, who has been missing for 25 years. You can journey down into the rift for an adventure full of twisted monsters all created from the mind of a young boy driven to madness through incarceration.
A Soul's Bane.name: A Soul's Bane
A Soul's Bane.start: Go east of [[Varrock]], through the gate by the [[Earth Altar]] and just south of there, speak to [[Launa]].

Spirits of the Elid.requirements: *[[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 33 [[Magic]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Ranged icon.png|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 37 [[Ranged]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 37 [[Mining]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 37 [[Thieving]] (boostable) (not required to start) *Ability to defeat three level 75 golems
Spirits of the Elid.desc:
The people in the desert village of Nardah have a problem. Their town well has dried up and any water they try to bring back to the town from the river mysteriously disappears before they can get it back.

The villagers suspect they have been cursed in some way. Can you unravel what is going on and save the village?
Spirits of the Elid.name: Spirits of the Elid
Spirits of the Elid.items:
*Runes for [[Telekinetic Grab]] (One law and one air rune)
*[[Needle]] (Note: a [[Costume needle]] will not work)
*1-2 [[thread]]
*[[Crush weapon]]
*[[Stab weapon]]
*[[Slash weapon]]
*[[Light source]]
*[[Knife]]
*[[Rope]]
*any [[Pickaxe]] that you have the Mining level to use (a [[Bronze Pickaxe]] can be obtained during the quest)
*[[Bow]] and [[arrow]]s (can be obtained during the quest); a [[crystal bow]] will also work

Swan Song.requirements: *[[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] 100 [[Quest points]] (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 66 [[Magic]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 62 [[Cooking]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Fishing icon.png|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 62 [[Fishing]] (boostable) (not required to start) *[[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 45 [[Smithing]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 42 [[Firemaking]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 40 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *Completion of the following quests: **[[One Small Favour]] ***[[Rune Mysteries]] ***[[Shilo Village]] ****[[Jungle Potion]] *****[[Druidic Ritual]] **[[Garden of Tranquillity]] ***[[Creature of Fenkenstrain]] ****[[Priest in Peril]] ****[[The Restless Ghost]] *The ability to defeat a [[combat level]] 170 monster, which is able to use [[Magic]], [[Melee]] and can drain [[Prayer]].
Swan Song.desc: Out on the edge of the known world, the Piscatoris Fishing Colony stands on the brink of disaster. Angry sea trolls are emerging from the sea and attacking the colonists, preventing them from harvesting the valuable monkfish that live in those waters. A highly experienced adventurer will be needed to drive back the trolls for good. The Colony's director, Herman Caranos, has a particular adventurer in mind: the notoriously amoral Wise Old Man of Draynor Village (allegations of his involvement in a spectacular bank robbery have never been substantiated). If you're in the mood for a bit of combat, jump on the boat on the west side of the Gnome Stronghold, speak to the Colony's director and prepare to fight alongside the Wise Old Man as he embarks on his final adventure - his ''swan song''.
Swan Song.kills:
*11 [[Sea troll]]s (1 each of levels 65/87/101 and 8 of level 79)
*[[Sea Troll Queen]] ''(level 170)''
Swan Song.name: Swan Song
Swan Song.start: The [[Piscatoris Fishing Colony]]. It can be reached via a boat trip from the river to the west of the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]].
Swan Song.ironman: Consider purchasing the necessary combination runes from the [[Rewards Guardian (Mage Training Arena)|Rewards Guardian]] in the [[Mage Training Arena]].

*10 [[lava rune]]s
*5 [[blood rune]]s

**A [[pot]], or
***a [[soft clay]] if making your own pot during quest, or
****a [[pickaxe]] (obtainable during the quest) if mining your own clay during quest
**A [[pot lid]], or
***a [[soft clay]] if making your own pot lid during quest (note: 2 [[soft clay]] needed if making both [[pot]] and [[pot lid]]), or
****a [[pickaxe]] (obtainable during the quest) if mining your own clay during quest

**a [[pickaxe]] (obtainable during the quest) if mining your own iron during quest
*1 set of [[logs]] of any kind, or
**an [[axe]] (obtainable during quest) if chopping your own [[logs]] during quest
