*A [[small fishing net]] (given to you during the quest if you do not have one)
*A [[brown apron]] (given to you during the quest if you do not have one)

Tai Bwo Wannai Trio.requirements: * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 15 [[Agility]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] 30 [[Cooking]] (not boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Fishing icon.png|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 5 [[Fishing]] (boostable) (not required to start) '"`UNIQ--ref-00000000-QINU`"' * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Jungle Potion]] *** [[Druidic Ritual]]
Tai Bwo Wannai Trio.desc:
In Jungle Potion, the Shaman Trufitus communed with the gods to determine the fate of his people.

Now, Timfraku, the Chief of Tai Bwo Wannai, wishes to see his people and family return to the abandoned village.

Help a depressed fisherman, encourage a raging hunter and satiate an eccentric priest in this extreme test of aptitude and patience!
Tai Bwo Wannai Trio.name: Tai Bwo Wannai Trio
Tai Bwo Wannai Trio.start: Talk to [[Timfraku]] in his house in [[Tai Bwo Wannai]].
Tai Bwo Wannai Trio.ironman: * [[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 34 [[Herblore]] (boostable) to create the [[agility potion]] * [[File:Fishing icon.png|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 65 [[Fishing]] (boostable) to catch [[raw karambwan]] (necessary if you burn the one given to you) * The ability to defeat a level 53 enemy (can be safespotted and the bones telegrabbed at the [[Ardougne Zoo]]) * Obtaining an [[iron spear]] or better. A [[steel spear]] spawns in the Ancient Prison in [[Neypotzli]] at the western wall. Alternatively, it may be bought from the [[Mount Karuulm Weapon Shop]], [[Fortis Blacksmith]] in [[Varlamore]], or dropped by enemies such as [[Moss Giant]]s, [[Jogres]], [[Tribesmen]], and [[Hobgoblins]].
Tai Bwo Wannai Trio.items:
* [[Knife]] or bladed weapon, such as a [[Sword]]
* [[Sliced banana]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Small fishing net]]
* [[Pestle and mortar]] (can be obtained during the quest for 6 gp)
* 2 [[Logs]] to quickly make [[Poison karambwan]] at fishing site and to cook [[Pasty jogre bones]] later in the quest
* [[Iron spear]] or better, which will be consumed during the quest. The following do not work: [[Black spear]], [[Zamorakian spear]], [[Leaf-bladed spear]], [[Gilded spear]] and [[bone spear]].
* [[Agility potion|Agility potion(4)]]
* [[Ranged]] [[equipment]], [[Magic]] [[equipment]], or a [[halberd]] to kill a [[monkey]] for a [[monkey corpse]] (melee does 0 damage to monkeys)
* [[Tinderbox]] (If you wish to avoid running back to the range in Brimhaven)
* [[Jogre bones]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Seaweed]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Karamjan rum]] or 30 coins to purchase (if obtaining the rum before starting, add the sliced banana or the rum will disappear when you leave the island)

A Tail of Two Cats.requirements:
*Completion of the following quests:
**[[Icthlarin's Little Helper]]
***[[Gertrude's Cat]]
A Tail of Two Cats.desc:
Missing: small black cat, answers to the name of Bob.

Last seen on the 19th of Bennath. Please contact Unferth in Burthorpe.
A Tail of Two Cats.name: A Tail of Two Cats
A Tail of Two Cats.start: Talk to [[Unferth]] at his house in [[Burthorpe]].
A Tail of Two Cats.items: *[[Cat]] or [[kitten]] ([[Hellcat]]s work. Be sure to bring [[fish]] for your kitten if you're using one.) *[[Catspeak amulet]] *5 [[death rune]]s *[[Chocolate cake]] (made with [[cake]] and [[chocolate bar]] or [[chocolate dust]] with 50 [[File:Cooking icon.png|link=Cooking|alt=Cooking]] ) *[[Logs]] *[[Tinderbox]] *[[Bucket of milk]] *[[Shears]] *4 [[potato seed]]s *[[Rake]] *[[Seed dibber]] (or partial completion of the [[Farming]] portion of [[Barbarian Training]]) *[[Vial of water]] *[[Desert shirt]] (obtainable during quest) or [[Druid's robe top]] (The [[desert outfit]] does not work) *[[Desert robe]] (obtainable during quest) or [[Druid's robe]] (The [[desert outfit]] does not work)

Tale of the Righteous.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[Client of Kourend]] ***[[X Marks the Spot]] *[[File:Strength icon.png|link=Strength|alt=Strength]] 16 [[Strength]] (not boostable) (required to start) *[[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 10 [[Mining]] (not boostable) (required to start)
Tale of the Righteous.desc: Over a thousand years ago, King Shayzien VII ordered an expedition to Mount Quidamortem. The expedition never returned and it was assumed that all members perished in the field. However, a recent discovery suggests this may not have been the case. Phileas Rimor is the descendant of the expedition leader and he is desperate to discover the truth. Join him and delve into a conspiracy a thousand years in the making in "Tale of the Righteous".
Tale of the Righteous.name: Tale of the Righteous
Tale of the Righteous.start: Speak to [[Phileas Rimor]] in his house west of [[The Cloak and Stagger]] tavern in [[Shayzien]].
Tale of the Righteous.items:
*A [[pickaxe]]
*A [[ranged]] weapon with ammunition. Darts and throwing knives also work.
*Runes for 2-3 casts of any [[magic]] [[combat spell]]
*A [[melee]] weapon of any kind ([[pickaxe]] will work)
*[[Rope]]

A Taste of Hope.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[Darkness of Hallowvale]] ***[[In Aid of the Myreque]] ****[[In Search of the Myreque]] *****[[Nature Spirit]] ******[[Priest in Peril]] ******[[The Restless Ghost]] *[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 48 [[Crafting]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 45 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Attack icon.png|link=Attack|alt=Attack]] 40 [[Attack]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 40 [[Herblore]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *[[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 38 [[Slayer]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]])
A Taste of Hope.desc: For many years, the Myreque have fought back against the reign of the Drakans. To many, they act as a glimmer of hope in an otherwise miserable existence. In recent times, the Myreque have been beset by disaster, with numerous members meeting a gruesome end at the hands of Vanstrom Klause, the brutal henchman of the Drakans. However, while the Myreque may be in their darkest hour, hope still remains. Thanks to a recent discovery in the laboratories deep beneath Meiyerditch, the Myreque may have finally found a way to take the fight to the vampyres.
A Taste of Hope.name: A Taste of Hope
A Taste of Hope.start: Speak to [[Garth (Theatre of Blood)|Garth]] in [[Ver Sinhaza]] by the entrance to the [[Theatre of Blood]].
A Taste of Hope.items:
*1,000 [[coins]] (More if taking [[Andras]]' boat from the [[Ectofuntus]], 10,000 each trip)
*[[Knife]] or [[sickle]]
*[[Emerald]]
*[[Chisel]]
*Either:
**3 [[air rune]]s, 1 [[cosmic rune]] and having your magic set to the [[standard spells|standard Spellbook]]
**An [[enchant emerald or jade]] [[tablet]]
*[[Rod of ivandis]] (can be obtained during the quest)
*[[Pestle and mortar]] (can be obtained during the quest)
*[[Vial of water]] (obtained during the quest)
*[[Weapons]] and [[armour]]

Tears of Guthix.requirements: * [[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] 43 [[Quest points]] (required to start) * [[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 49 [[Firemaking]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 20 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (not required to start) '"`UNIQ--ref-00000000-QINU`"' * [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 20 [[Mining]] (boostable) (not required to start)
Tears of Guthix.desc: Deep in the caves in the [[Lumbridge Swamp]] is an enchanted place where the tears shed by [[Guthix]] when it saw the destruction [[Saradomin]] and [[Zamorak]] had caused with their wars flow from the very walls. These tears are said to have magical properties to help players gain deeper understanding of the world. However, the cave is guarded by a loyal serpent named [[Juna]] who blocks passage from everyone. However, she has grown bored from three thousand years of sitting in the dark cave and wishes to hear stories of life above. Maybe you could come to some sort of arrangement...?
Tears of Guthix.name: Tears of Guthix
Tears of Guthix.start: Talk to [[Juna]], deep inside the [[Lumbridge Swamp Caves]].
Tears of Guthix.ironman: *A [[bullseye lantern]] (to create the required [[sapphire lantern]]), obtainable through one of the following: **Purchase from [[Miltog]] for 600 gp (after [[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] [[Death to the Dorgeshuun]]) **[[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 49 [[Smithing]] (boostable) to create a [[bullseye lantern (unf)]] **[[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 35 [[Crafting]] To complete [[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] [[Haunted Mine]] to kill [[Skeleton_(Tarn's_Lair)#Low_level|Skeleton]] in [[Tarn's Lair]] **[[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 36 [[Thieving]] (boostable) for pickpocketing [[Cave goblin (Dorgesh-Kaan)|cave goblins]] (after [[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] [[Death to the Dorgeshuun]]) for a bullseye lantern. **[[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 35 [[Slayer]] (boostable) to kill [[wall beast]]s for a [[bullseye lantern (unf)]] **Item spawn in Darkmeyer (after [[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] [[Sins of the Father]])
Tears of Guthix.items:
* Lit [[sapphire lantern]] (use a cut [[sapphire]] on a [[bullseye lantern]] or on a [[bullseye lantern (unf)]]), make sure to use a [[tinderbox]] on it as [[Juna]] is busy
** [[Swamp tar]] to fill an empty [[sapphire lantern]] using the [[chemist]] in [[Rimmington]] or the [[lamp still]] in [[Dorgesh-Kaan]]
* [[Chisel]]
* [[Tinderbox]]
* [[Pickaxe]]
* [[Rope]] (if you have not yet entered the [[Lumbridge Swamp Caves]])

Temple of Ikov.requirements: * [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 42 [[Thieving]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Ranged icon.png|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 40 [[Ranged]] (not boostable) (not required to start) '"`UNIQ--ref-00000000-QINU`"' * The ability to defeat a level 84 enemy with Ranged
Temple of Ikov.desc: A mysterious stranger called Lucien asks you to go on a mission deep under the Temple of Ikov in central Kandarin. He wants you to retrieve an artefact known as the Staff of Armadyl. After you retrieve it, the quest doesn't stop there... Are you on the side of good or evil?
Temple of Ikov.kills:
* [[Fire Warrior of Lesarkus]] ''(level 84)''
* [[Guardian of Armadyl]] ''(level 43)'' - only if siding with Lucien
* [[Lucien]] ''(level 14)'' - only if siding with the Guardians of Armadyl
Temple of Ikov.name: Temple of Ikov
Temple of Ikov.start: Speak to [[Lucien]] at the [[Flying Horse Inn]] in the north-west corner of [[East Ardougne]].
Temple of Ikov.ironman:
* [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] 20 unnoted items need to be delivered at once. 
* [[Yew longbow]]s can be obtained as a rare drop from [[young impling]]s.
** [[Darts]] or [[Throwing knife|throwing knives]] can be used in place of it with [[Ice arrow]]s equipped in order to deal damage to [[Fire Warrior of Lesarkus]]. Since [[Ice arrow]]s don't have a level restriction, 40 range is an optional completion requirement.
Temple of Ikov.items:
* Any [[bow]] capable of firing [[ice arrows]] ([[yew bow]] or better) '''or''' any [[Ranged#Weapons|thrown weapon]]
* 20 unnoted [[limpwurt root]]s
* [[Light source]]

Temple of the Eye.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[Enter the Abyss]] ***[[Rune Mysteries]] *[[File:Runecraft icon.png|link=Runecraft|alt=Runecraft]] 10 [[Runecraft]] (not boostable) (required to start)
Temple of the Eye.desc: The Abyss: a deadly realm filled with ancient power. The secrets of this plane have long eluded the denizens of the Wizards' Tower, though some would give anything to properly uncover them. One of these wizards is Persten. While many in the Tower aren't convinced by her unorthodox methods, a recent discovery means she may now hold the key to the knowledge they crave the most. However, nothing is simple when the Abyss is involved, and Persten won't be able to get to the bottom of her discovery without your help...
Temple of the Eye.name: Temple of the Eye
Temple of the Eye.start: [[Wizard Persten]] north of [[Al Kharid]], near the gate from [[Lumbridge]].
Temple of the Eye.items:
* [[Bucket of water]]
* [[Chisel]] (obtainable during quest) 
* [[Pickaxe]] (obtainable during quest)

The Curse of Arrav.requirements: * [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 64 [[Mining]] non boostable * [[File:Ranged icon.png|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 62 [[Ranged]] * [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 62 [[Thieving]] * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 61 [[Agility]] * [[File:Strength icon.png|link=Strength|alt=Strength]] 58 [[Strength]] * [[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 37 [[Slayer]] *Completion of the following quests: ** [[Defender of Varrock]] *** [[Shield of Arrav]] *** [[Temple of Ikov]] *** [[Below Ice Mountain]] *** [[Family Crest]] *** [[Garden of Tranquillity]] **** [[Creature of Fenkenstrain]] ***** [[Priest in Peril]] ***** [[The Restless Ghost]] *** [[What Lies Below]] **** [[Rune Mysteries]] *** [[Romeo & Juliet]] *** [[Demon Slayer]] ** [[Troll Romance]] *** [[Troll Stronghold]] **** [[Death Plateau]]
The Curse of Arrav.desc: The icy waste to the north of the troll country is as mysterious as any land in Gielinor, no less because of the interest the Mahjarrat take in it. Elias White thinks that he might have found a way for you to discover more about this strange area to the north. Uncover more of the mysteries of the Mahjarrat and learn about the dark magic that was used to enslave Arrav for these last few millennia.
The Curse of Arrav.name: The Curse of Arrav
The Curse of Arrav.start: Speak to [[Elias White]] at the [[Uzer Oasis]].
The Curse of Arrav.items:
*3 [[dwellberries]]
*[[Ring of life]]
*Any [[pickaxe]]
*Any [[Crossbow (weapon)|crossbow]] (except the [[love crossbow]])
*[[Mith grapple]]
*[[Insulated boots]]

The Enchanted Key.name: The Enchanted Key
The Enchanted Key.start: Begin this mini-quest by getting your [[enchanted key (item)|enchanted key]]. If lost, it can be reclaimed from the [[silver merchant]] in [[East Ardougne]] for 500 coins.
The Enchanted Key.items:
*[[Enchanted key (item)|Enchanted key]] (remove from your [[steel key ring]] if you previously put it there)
*[[Spade]]

The General's Shadow.requirements:
*[[Curse of the Empty Lord]], for full [[ghostly robes]]
**Started [[Desert Treasure I]], for the [[ring of visibility]]
*[[Fight Arena]]
The General's Shadow.name: The General's Shadow
The General's Shadow.start: Speak to the ghost of [[General Khazard]] roaming around the woods south-east of [[Rellekka]].
The General's Shadow.items: *40 coins (70 coins if using boat to Karamja) *[[Shantay pass (item)|Shantay pass]] (or access to [[fairy ring]]s, code BIQ) *[[Ghostspeak amulet]] (Morytania legs will not work) *All pieces of the [[Ghostly robes]] set *A [[ring of visibility]]

Throne of Miscellania.requirements:
* Completion of the following quests:
** [[Heroes' Quest]]
*** [[Shield of Arrav]]
*** [[Lost City]]
*** [[Merlin's Crystal]]
*** [[Dragon Slayer I]]
** [[The Fremennik Trials]]
Throne of Miscellania.desc:
Rumours have been coming back from Miscellania that all is not well, it is said that the king has been turned into a monster!

An exceptional hero is required to investigate. Experience in ruling kingdoms, wooing royalty and negotiating peace would be an advantage.
Throne of Miscellania.name: Throne of Miscellania
Throne of Miscellania.start: Talk to [[King Vargas]] in the [[Miscellania Castle]]. Take the longboat from [[Rellekka]] to access [[Miscellania]].
Throne of Miscellania.items:
* [[Iron bar]]
* Any non-silver [[ring]] you are willing to lose ''(not [[Onyx ring|onyx]]/[[Dragonstone ring|dragonstone]]/[[Explorer's ring|explorer]]/[[Beacon Ring|beacon]]/[['perfect' ring]]/[[Ring of nature|nature]]/[[Pineapple ring|pineapple]]/[[Fremennik rings|fremennik]])''
* '''At least one''' of these tools in order to gain favour: A [[pickaxe]], an [[axe]] ''(if 45 [[Woodcutting]])'', a [[rake]] ''(if 10 [[Farming]] and 35 [[Herblore]], obtainable during quest for 15 gp)'', a [[harpoon]] or [[lobster pot]]
* [[Logs]] (obtainable during the quest if you bring an axe)

The Tourist Trap.requirements: * [[File:Fletching icon.png|link=Fletching|alt=Fletching]] 10 [[Fletching]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 20 [[Smithing]] (boostable) (not required to start) * The ability to defeat a level 47 enemy
The Tourist Trap.desc:
South of Al Kharid a new desert pass has opened up, leading to the dangers of the Kharid desert.
Equip your desert garb and make sure your waterskin is full before heading off into the trackless dunes in search of desert adventure.
The Tourist Trap.name: The Tourist Trap
The Tourist Trap.start: Speak to [[Irena]] by the [[Shantay Pass]], south of [[Al Kharid]].
The Tourist Trap.ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] You need to unequip your armour and weapons, and require two empty slots in addition to that. Failing dialogue will require 15 empty inventory spaces.
The Tourist Trap.items:
'''Note that all of the required items can be bought from [[Shantay]] at the [[Shantay Pass]].'''
* Full [[Desert clothing]] ([[Desert shirt|shirt]], [[Desert robe|robe]] and [[Desert boots|boots]] required). You '''will''' lose them. (Black desert robes, Black desert robe, and Black desert shirt does not work)
* A [[hammer]]
* 1 [[Bronze bar]] (recommended to bring at least 2 additional bars, 24-96% chance to succeed based on Smithing level)
* 10 [[feather]]s (recommended to bring 30-50 feathers, 24-99% chance to succeed based on Fletching level)
* Means to enter the desert. (Such as the [[Shantay pass (item)|Shantay pass]],  [[Desert amulet 2]], [[Teleport tablet]] or [[Teleport scrolls|scrolls]], [[Fairy rings]] or the [[Pharaoh's sceptre]])

Tower of Life.requirements: *[[File:Construction icon.png|link=Construction|alt=Construction]] 10 [[Construction]] (not boostable) (required to start)
Tower of Life.desc: The construction of a mysterious tower is almost complete, but the builders working on it have gone on strike. Losing patience, the alchemists that hired them are looking for anybody to help them. When the world of magic and the world of logic combine you can expect dangerous results, but a true adventurer would cherish such things... wouldn't they?
Tower of Life.name: Tower of Life
Tower of Life.start: Talk to [[Effigy]] at the [[Tower of Life (building)|Tower of Life]] just east of the [[Ardougne Monastery]].
Tower of Life.items:
*[[Hammer]]
*[[Saw]] (or [[crystal saw]])
*[[Beer]] (must be a regular beer - other beers do not work.)

Tree Gnome Village.requirements: * The ability to defeat a level 112 [[Khazard warlord]]
Tree Gnome Village.desc:
The tree gnomes are in trouble. General Khazard's forces are hunting them to extinction.

Find your way through the hedge maze to the gnomes secret treetop village.

Then help the gnomes fight Khazard and retrieve the orbs of protection.
Tree Gnome Village.name: Tree Gnome Village
Tree Gnome Village.start: Centre of the [[Tree Gnome Village (location)|Tree Gnome Village]] [[Gnome Maze|Maze]], talk to [[King Bolren]].
Tree Gnome Village.items:
* 6 normal [[logs]] (or an [[axe]], obtainable during the quest by killing [[goblin]]s in the Tree Gnome Village maze)
* Combat equipment
* Food

Tribal Totem.requirements: * [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 21 [[Thieving]] (boostable) (not required to start)
Tribal Totem.desc: Lord Handelmort of Ardougne is a collector of exotic artefacts. A recent addition to his private collection is a strange looking totem from Karamja. The Rantuki tribe are not happy about the recent disappearance of their totem.
Tribal Totem.name: Tribal Totem
Tribal Totem.start: Speak to [[Kangai Mau]] at [[The Shrimp and Parrot]] restaurant in [[Brimhaven]].

Troll Romance.requirements: * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 28 [[Agility]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Troll Stronghold]] *** [[Death Plateau]] * The ability to defeat a level 113 [[Arrg|troll]]
Troll Romance.desc: Ug loves Aga, but Aga is together with Arrg. Since Arrg is a lot stronger than Ug, Ug can't follow the regular mating ritual, which involves ripping the opponent into pieces. Will you be able to find out what will impress the troll female more than a display of violence? Will you survive the journey to help a lonely troll find love?
Troll Romance.kills: [[Arrg]] ''(level 113)'' ([[safespot]]table; difficult to reach) '''Note:''' This fight is not a safe death.
Troll Romance.name: Troll Romance
Troll Romance.start: Speak to [[Ug]] at the [[Troll Stronghold (location)|Troll Stronghold]].
Troll Romance.ironman: * [[File:Woodcutting icon.png|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 45 [[Woodcutting]] (boostable) to cut a maple log ** '''OR''' Enough combat stats and supplies to get a 1/128 drop of yew logs from [[Swamp Crab]]s (Requires completion of [[Priest in Peril]]). ** '''OR''' Enough supply of [[Serum 208]] to get a 1/128 drop of maple logs from curing [[Afflicted]] (Requires completion of [[Priest in Peril]]). ** '''OR''' [[Throne of Miscellania]] completed to obtain maple logs from [[managing Miscellania]]. ** '''OR''' [[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 50 [[Firemaking]] (not boostable) to get a maple/yew log from [[Reward Cart]] via [[Wintertodt]]. ** '''OR''' High enough combat stats to kill [[Giant Mole]] for a 1/12.8 drop of yew logs. * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 15 [[Smithing]] (boostable) to smelt an iron bar ** '''OR''' collect a spawn in level 18 [[Wilderness]] to the west of the [[Graveyard of Shadows]]. ** '''OR''' collect a spawn at [[Sunset Coast]] (Requires completion of [[Children of the Sun]]).
Troll Romance.items:
* An [[iron bar]]
* [[Maple logs|Maple]] or [[yew logs]]
* [[Rope]]
* [[Climbing boots]] (not needed if using [[Trollheim Teleport]])
* [[Wax]] (can be made ahead of time)
** A [[bucket of wax]] (use [[insect repellent]] on a beehive followed by a [[bucket]])
** A [[cake tin]]
** [[Swamp tar]]

Troll Stronghold.requirements: * Completion of [[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] [[Death Plateau]] * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 15 [[Agility]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) (47 is recommended) * The ability to defeat a level 113 [[Troll General]] (can be [[safespot]]ted)
Troll Stronghold.desc:
The Imperial Guard raid was a failure, and Dunstan's son has been captured by the trolls!

Journey through Trollheim to the Troll Stronghold, and rescue him!
Troll Stronghold.kills: * [[Dad]] ''(level 101)'' (can be safespotted) * [[Troll General]] ''(level 113)'' (can be safespotted) * [[Berry]] and [[Twig]] ''(both level 71)'' (can be safespotted) '''Only''' if you have less than [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 30 [[Thieving]] or fail to pickpocket them (can be safespotted)
Troll Stronghold.name: Troll Stronghold

Twilight's Promise.requirements:
* Completion of the following quests:
** [[Children of the Sun]]
Twilight's Promise.desc: Take your first steps into [[Varlamore]] and unlock the [[Quetzal Transport System]].
Twilight's Promise.name: Twilight's Promise
Twilight's Promise.start: Speak to [[Ennius Tullus]] or [[Furia Tullus]] in front of the [[Sunrise Palace]].
Twilight's Promise.items: * Items for two different [[combat classes]] or a [[poisoned]] weapon (be warned that the poison method is much slower). Also note that autocasting magic on the Knight of Varlamore with a staff is not possible due to a bug, though manually casting does work.

Underground Pass.requirements: * [[File:Ranged icon.png|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 25 [[Ranged]] (boostable) * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Biohazard]] *** [[Plague City]]
Underground Pass.desc: There are rumours of a secret passageway that can be used to get to the other side of the mountains west of Ardougne. Now it's just a matter of finding it.
Underground Pass.kills:
* 3 [[Demons]] ''(level 91)'' (easily [[safespot]]table)
* 3 [[Paladin]]s ''(level 62)'' (easily [[safespot]]table)
* [[Kalrag]] ''(level 89)'' ([[safespot]]table) (won't hit with [[Protect from Melee]])
* [[Disciple of Iban]] ''(level 13)''
Underground Pass.name: Underground Pass
Underground Pass.start: Talk to [[King Lathas]] on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of [[Ardougne Castle]].
Underground Pass.items:
* [[Rope]] (2 recommended)
* [[Bow]]
* 1-5 [[arrows]] (only non-poisoned arrows with metal [[arrowtips]] will work. [[Craw's bow]] does not work. Crossbows and bolts will not work. Broad arrows,  Ogre arrows, and Ice arrows will also not work.)
* [[Spade]]
* [[Bucket]] (obtainable during quest)
* [[Tinderbox]] (obtainable during quest)

Vampyre Slayer.requirements: Able to defeat a [[combat level]] 34 [[Count Draynor|vampyre]] with a very high health recovery rate.
Vampyre Slayer.desc: The people of [[Draynor Village]] live in constant terror. Their numbers are dwindling, all due to the foul creature lurking in the manor to the north known as a vampyre.
Vampyre Slayer.name: Vampyre Slayer
Vampyre Slayer.start: Speak to [[Morgan]] in his house in [[Draynor Village]], just north of [[Ned]]'s house.
Vampyre Slayer.items:
*[[Hammer]] (can be bought from the [[general store]] just north of the [[Blue Moon Inn]] for 1 [[coin]])
* [[Beer]] (can be bought during the quest for 2 [[coins]])
* [[Garlic]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Stake]] (obtained from Dr Harlow after giving him a beer)

Wanted!.requirements: *[[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] 32 [[Quest points]] (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *Completion of the following quests: **[[Recruitment Drive]] ***[[Black Knights' Fortress]] ***[[Druidic Ritual]] **[[The Lost Tribe]] ***[[Rune Mysteries]] ***[[Goblin Diplomacy]] **[[Priest in Peril]] **[[Enter the Abyss]] *The ability to defeat a level 32 [[Black Knight (Wanted!)|Black Knight]].
Wanted!.desc: A wanted man is on the loose. Can you track him down?
Wanted!.name: Wanted!
Wanted!.start: Speak to [[Sir Tiffy Cashien]] in [[Falador Park]].
Wanted!.ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The player must have 20 inventory spots to deliver all 20 rune essence at once. If the miniquest has been completed, the table in the rune shop may be used to hold rune essence from multiple trips to bring to the nearby chaos altar while inventory items are dropped without the worry of them despawning.
Wanted!.items:
*10,000 [[coins]], or:
** [[Law rune]]
** [[Enchanted gem]] (bought from a [[Slayer Master]])
** [[Molten glass]]
*20 un-noted [[Rune essence]] or [[pure essence]] (you'll get them back)
**[[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The player must deliver all 20 rune essence at once
* [[Light source]] ('''Note:''' [[Candle]]s, [[torch]]es and [[oil lamp]]s can cause [[swamp gas]] explosions if going off-route, and need a tinderbox to stay lit)

Watchtower.requirements: * [[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 14 [[Magic]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 15 [[Thieving]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 25 [[Agility]] (boostable) (not required to start) '"`UNIQ--ref-00000000-QINU`"' * [[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 14 [[Herblore]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 40 [[Mining]] (boostable) (not required to start) * The ability to defeat a level 68 [[Ogre]] and run past level 111 [[Blue dragons]]
Watchtower.desc: The Wizards of the Yanille Watch Tower have been reporting increased ogre sightings recently. Use a wide variety of your skills to help the wizards recover their stolen power crystals and stop the advance of the ogre hordes!
Watchtower.kills:
* [[Gorad]] ''(level 68)'' (safespottable)
* [[Giant bat]] ''(level 27)'' (only if bat bones are needed)
Watchtower.name: Watchtower
Watchtower.start: Begin the quest by speaking to [[Watchtower Wizard]] north of [[Yanille]] in the [[Watchtower (building)|Watchtower]]. You must climb the [[trellis]] on the north side of the tower to get up there for the first time.
Watchtower.items:
* 20 [[coins]]
* [[Gold bar]]
* [[Tinderbox]]
* [[Death rune]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Pickaxe]]
* [[Dragon bones]]
* 2 [[rope]]s (2nd rope can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Guam potion (unf)]] or [[guam leaf]] and a [[vial of water]] (vial of water can be obtained during quest)
* Any [[light source]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Skavid map]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Pestle and mortar]] (can be obtained during the quest)
* [[Bat bones]] (can be obtained during the quest, a [[knife]] or [[slash weapon]] is needed, grinding the bat bones before starting the quest to leave the pestle and mortar in the bank is also an option)
* [[Jangerberries]] (can be obtained during the quest)

Waterfall Quest.requirements: * The ability to withstand and evade attacks from level 86 [[Fire Giant]]s and level 84 [[Moss Guardian]] without any equipment.
Waterfall Quest.desc: Investigate the death of elven leaders of old. Search for the elf King Baxtorian's tomb and discover the mysterious hidden treasure of the waterfall.
Waterfall Quest.name: Waterfall Quest
Waterfall Quest.start: Speak to [[Almera]] in her house north-east of [[Baxtorian Falls]].
Waterfall Quest.ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] You must briefly visit Glarial's Tomb which has [[Glarial's Tomb#Restricted items|significant item restrictions]].

What Lies Below.requirements: *Completion of the following quests: **[[Rune Mysteries]] *[[File:Runecraft icon.png|link=Runecraft|alt=Runecraft]] 35 [[Runecraft]] (not boostable) (required to start)
What Lies Below.desc:
A travelling trader has been stranded south of Varrock after his cart was attacked by local outlaws. He needs the help of a hero to recover his lost documents, but that's not all...

The Varrock Palace Secret Guard (VPSG) are on the trail of treacherous dealings with the Monks of Zamorak. Will you be able to help the VPSG and uncover what lies below?
What Lies Below.name: What Lies Below
What Lies Below.items:
*[[Empty bowl]]
*15 [[chaos rune]]s
*Access to the [[Chaos Altar]] ([[Chaos talisman]] or [[Chaos tiara|tiara]], [[Catalytic tiara]], or travelling through the [[Abyss]] or Temple of the Eye)

While Guthix Sleeps.requirements: * [[File:Quest point icon.png|link=Quest points|alt=Quest points]] 180 [[Quest points]] (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 72 [[Thieving]] (not boostable) (required to start) * [[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 67 [[Magic]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 66 [[Agility]] (not boostable) (required to start) * [[File:Farming icon.png|link=Farming|alt=Farming]] 65 [[Farming]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 65 [[Herblore]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Hunter icon.png|link=Hunter|alt=Hunter]] 62 [[Hunter]] (not boostable) (required to start) * Ability to enter the [[Warriors' Guild]] (the sum of your [[Attack]] and [[Strength]] must be at or above 130; OR [[File:Attack icon.png|link=Attack|alt=Attack]] 99 [[Attack]], OR [[File:Strength icon.png|link=Strength|alt=Strength]] 99 [[Strength]]) (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) *Completion of the following quests: **[[Defender of Varrock]] ***[[Shield of Arrav]] ***[[Temple of Ikov]] ***[[Below Ice Mountain]] ***[[Family Crest]] ***[[What Lies Below]] ***[[Romeo & Juliet]] ***[[Demon Slayer]] ***[[Garden of Tranquillity]] ****[[Creature of Fenkenstrain]] *****[[Priest in Peril]] *****[[The Restless Ghost]] **[[The Path of Glouphrie]] *** [[The Eyes of Glouphrie]] **** [[The Grand Tree]] *** [[Waterfall Quest]] *** [[Tree Gnome Village]] **[[Fight Arena]] **[[Dream Mentor]] ***[[Eadgar's Ruse]] ****[[Druidic Ritual]] ****[[Troll Stronghold]] *****[[Death Plateau]] ***[[Lunar Diplomacy]] ****[[The Fremennik Trials]] ****[[Lost City]] ****[[Rune Mysteries]] ****[[Shilo Village]] *****[[Jungle Potion]] **[[The Hand in the Sand]] **[[Wanted!]] ***[[Recruitment Drive]] ****[[Black Knights' Fortress]] ****[[Druidic Ritual]] ***[[The Lost Tribe]] ****[[Goblin Diplomacy]] **[[Temple of the Eye]] ***[[Enter the Abyss]] ****[[Rune Mysteries]] **[[Tears of Guthix]] **[[Nature Spirit]] ***[[Priest in Peril]] ***[[The Restless Ghost]] **[[A Tail of Two Cats]] ***[[Icthlarin's Little Helper]] ****[[Gertrude's Cat]]
While Guthix Sleeps.desc:
This Grandmaster quest sees you continue the Mahjarrat storyline, hunting down one of the most powerful artefacts in existence while ensuring it doesn't fall into the wrong hands.

This artefact is known by many names – most recently, the Stone of Jas. It has shaped the course of Gielinor’s history, from the creation of the first Runes to the fall of Zaros. It was last seen at the devastating end of the God Wars, when Zamorak, in a fit of rage, used it to reduce the land of Forinthry to the Wilderness we know today.

Angered by Zamorak’s actions, Guthix rose from his age-long slumber and banished the gods. He hid the Stone of Jas far underground, where it could never disturb the balance again...

But while Guthix sleeps, nefarious forces have been gathering; the Mahjarrat. Shaped by war and deadly ritual, their plans for the Stone can only lead to catastrophe.

Facing off against the Mahjarrat is nothing new for dedicated adventurers – at every turn, they seem to grow in power and wage war against the people of Gielinor. In their last attempt, we saw them set out to tear Varrock apart with an undead army in Defender of Varrock. What are they plotting now?
While Guthix Sleeps.kills:
* 2 [[Assassin (While Guthix Sleeps)|Assassins]] ''(level 167)''
* 2 [[Mercenary axeman|Mercenary axemen]] ''(level 131)''
* [[Mercenary mage]] ''(level 112)''
* 3 [[Elite Black Knight]]s ''(level 138)''
* [[Surok Magis]] ''(level 265)''
* [[Balance Elemental]] ''(level 524)''
* 2 [[Tormented Demon]]s ''(level 450)''
While Guthix Sleeps.name: While Guthix Sleeps
While Guthix Sleeps.items:
* [[Knife]]
* [[Ring of charos(a)]] or 500 coins
* [[Seed dibber]] (only if Barbarian Farming Training has not been completed)
* [[Lantern lens]]
* [[Unpowered orb]]
* [[Bronze med helm]]
* [[Iron chainbody]]
* [[Sapphire lantern]]
* Runes to cast the [[NPC Contact]] spell four times (8 [[air rune]]s, 4 [[astral rune]], 4 [[cosmic rune]])
* Runes for any charge orb spell (30 runes of a chosen element and 3 [[cosmic rune]]s)
* Equipment for two different attack styles
'''Obtainable during quest:'''
* [[Mort myre fungus]]
* 1 [[log]] of any type except redwood (you can obtain one using a bronze axe next to the [[Hunting Expert]])
* [[Pink dye]] (for 20 coins)
* [[Snapdragon seed]]
* [[Papyrus]] and [[charcoal]]
* [[Restore potion]]
* One of each of the following runes: [[air rune|air]], [[water rune|water]], [[earth rune|earth]], [[fire rune|fire]], [[mind rune|mind]], [[law rune|law]], [[death rune|death]]

Witch's House.requirements: * The ability to defeat 4 monsters from level 19 to 53 without a break.
Witch's House.desc:
A young boy who lives in Taverley has kicked his ball into the garden of a scary old lady.

He asks you to get it back for him. This proves more difficult than it first sounds.
Witch's House.name: Witch's House
Witch's House.start: Talk to the [[boy]] near the gate entrance of [[Taverley]].
Witch's House.items:
*[[Cheese]] (You may wish to bring several in case you mess up)
*[[Leather gloves]] (obtainable during the quest)

Witch's Potion.desc: Become one with your darker side. Tap into your hidden depths of magical potential by making a potion with the help of Hetty the Rimmington witch.
Witch's Potion.name: Witch's Potion
Witch's Potion.start: Talk to [[Hetty]] in her house in [[Rimmington]], south of [[Falador]] and west of [[Port Sarim]].
Witch's Potion.items:
*[[Burnt meat]]
*[[Eye of newt]]
*[[Onion]]
*[[Rat's tail]] ''(only obtainable after starting the quest)''

X Marks the Spot.desc: Veos has long been a lover of treasure hunts and his latest hunt has brought him to Lumbridge. However, not knowing the area well, Veos could use some help finding this treasure.
X Marks the Spot.name: X Marks the Spot
X Marks the Spot.start: Speak to [[Veos]] in [[The Sheared Ram]] in [[Lumbridge]].

Zogre Flesh Eaters.requirements: * Completion of the following quests: ** [[Big Chompy Bird Hunting]] ** [[Jungle Potion]] *** [[Druidic Ritual]] * You must be able to defeat a level 111 enemy. * [[File:Smithing icon.png|link=Smithing|alt=Smithing]] 4 [[Smithing]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 8 [[Herblore]] (boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]]) * [[File:Ranged icon.png|link=Ranged|alt=Ranged]] 30 [[Ranged]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]])
Zogre Flesh Eaters.desc:
Run for your lives...the zombie ogres are here for your flesh! An ogre ceremonial dance area, used to communicate with ancient ogrish ancestors, has been overrun with diseased undead ogres.

How could something like this have happened? And what sort of rewards could an enterprising adventurer gain from exploring the tombs of such a place?
Zogre Flesh Eaters.name: Zogre Flesh Eaters
Zogre Flesh Eaters.start: Speak to [[Grish]] in [[Jiggig]], just south of [[Castle Wars]].
Zogre Flesh Eaters.items:
* 5 free inventory spaces are needed to receive items near the start of the quest
* A [[comp ogre bow]] (not needed if using [[Crumble Undead]]  in final battle) '''or''':
** [[Wolf bones]]
** [[Achey logs]] (obtainable during quest)
** [[Knife]] (obtainable during quest)
** [[Axe]] of your [[Woodcutting]] level
** [[Bow string]]
* [[Brutal arrows]] (not needed if using [[Crumble Undead]] in final battle) '''or''':
** [[Achey logs]]
** [[Knife]] (obtainable during quest)
** [[Nails]] of your [[Smithing]] level
** [[Hammer]]
** [[Feather]]s (4 per 1 brutal arrow)
